loans.name: Sona

texts.fr: Sona S. est une femme de 48 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KOUTEDIOBOULOU depuis le 28 mai 2008 et a 5 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit, elle n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Depuis deux ans elle s'est investi dans le transport, elle a acheté une motocyclette qu'elle a remis à quelqu'un qui lui mène cette activité de transport moyennant une rémunération mensuelle. Avec ce financement elle veut acheter une deuxième moto pour faire l'extension de son activité.  Les bénéfices lui permettent d'aider son mari retraité pour les charges familiales.
texts.en:
Sona S. is a 48-year-old woman who is married and the mother of five children to support.  She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Koutedioboulou since May 28, 2008.  She has had five consecutive loans and has never had a problem repaying.  Two years ago, she invested in transportation.  She bought a motorbike, which she provided to someone who runs this transport business in return for monthly payments. With financing, Sonia wants to buy a second motorbike to expand her business.  The profits will allow her to help her retired husband in covering family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a motorbike

loans.name: Rasif

texts.en: Rasif M. is a 57-year-old tinman who lives and works in Agsu city. He works on customers’ orders and his monthly income is about 400 AZN. Rasif is married and has three daughters. He applied for 1000 AZN to purchase more materials and tools. He wants to open his own workshop one day but, until that day, he needs to work very hard.

loans.use: to buy materials and tools

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en: Ilham Z. is a 42-year-old farmer who grows seasonal fruits in his own garden. He has been engaged in this business since 2005 and now his crops bring him 300 AZN a month. He grows apples, peaches, pears, pomegranates and other fruit. Ilham is married and has four children. He wishes to provide them with a bright future. For this purpose, he applied for 1000 AZN. He will use this loan to purchase new tools, improve his irrigation system and plant new varieties of fruit.

loans.use: to purchase new tools, improve his irrigation system and plant new fruit

loans.name: Diouma

texts.fr: Diouma S. est une femme de 34 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants, elle est aussi tutrice de 02 élèves. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KOUTEDIOMBOULOU depuis le 28 mai 2008 et a eu 05 expériences avec le crédit et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Elle fait un petit commerce de balais traditionnel faits à partir de feuilles de palmier, de l'huile de palme et de la pâte d'arachide. Son nouveau crédit lui permettra d'acheter en quantité suffisante sa marchandises (balais, l'huile de palme et pâte d'arachide) Elle s'approvisionne à partir des marchés hebdomadaires de la zone et des villages environnants. Elle revend sa marchandise à Dakar. Les bénéfices réalisés à partir de l'activité sont utilisés pour améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille tout en renforçant son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
Diouma S. is 34 years old, married, with two children of her own and two children to whom she is guardian. She has been a member of the Koutediomboulou Banc Villageois since May 28, 2008, and she has had five previous loans that she has repaid without any problems. She has a small business selling palm oil, peanut butter and traditional brooms made from palm leaves. This new loan will allow Madame S. to buy her goods (brooms, palm oil and peanut butter) in much larger quantities. She stocks up at the weekly markets in her area as well as in the surrounding villages. She resells her goods in Dakar. Her earnings from this business activity are used to improve her family's standard of living and to increase her savings.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen and develop her business

loans.name: Creciendo Hacia El Futuro 2 Group

texts.en:
Xiomara is the coordinator of her group, Creciendo hacia el futuro (progress to the future), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in San Pedro D. Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and sugar cane industries. The main economic activities incluD. the free trading zone and a cement factory. Running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable, and she makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and two children.

Xiomara is excited to be taking her 7th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to buy equipment and supplies for the cafeteria. She will use the profits to grow her business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to invest in the school cafeteria

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is a young lady aged 22, living in Masindi, Uganda. She is married and her husband is a student, meaning Harriet, through her retail shop business, is charged with looking after the family in every way possible. She lives in a rented house with her husband and child. She would like to have a good home with educated kids just like any other lady at her stage with good life expectations. 

Harriet has operated her shop for one year now; she says she started so small but for now she says it has improved in terms of size, and she hopes to see it grow into a big retail shop. This is Harriet’s first loan from HOFOKAM and she intends to purchase sugar, soap, and maize flour for resale in her shop.

loans.use: Purchasing sugar, soap, maize flour for resale

loans.name: Tulipanes 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Georgina is the coordinator of her group Tulipanes (Tulips), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Los Alcarrizos, a dusty industrial town where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and two children.

Georgina is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza and she is excited to grow her business like her friends who are already participating in Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling jewelry and shoes by purchasing more merchandise. She will use the profits to invest in her children's education and in growing her business.

loans.use: Shoes and jewelry to sell

loans.name: Todos Juntos Podemos Group

texts.en:
Marie is the coordinator of her group "Todos juntos podemos", which means "All together we can", and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and sugar cane industries. There is a free trading zone, a cement factory, and other economic activities, while running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her two children.

Marie is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and expanded her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business to buy more clothes to sell. She will use the profits to build her house out of concrete blocks. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Atua

texts.en:
She comes from a tribe famously known for its liking for fish since they occupy areas near the water. She is a single mother aged 45, with seven children and her name is Atua. She is the family head with the dream of seeing her children through education with flying colors for a better future. 

Atua is a fishmonger and has been in the fish-selling business for the last 20 years. She has been able to construct a house from the profit from her business. Though her business entails a lot of details from license to medical forms, Atua says she intends to carry on with it and even open up branches in other districts. She is purchasing fish using the loan funds for resale at a profit.

loans.use: Purchasing fish for resale

loans.name: Jeska

texts.en:
Jeska is a 33-year-old woman, a single mother of three children whom she looks after in a rented home in Masindi, Uganda. Jeska says she wants to have her own home in the near future. She sells local brew and has been doing so for the last nine years. 

At this stage, Jeska wants to have a bigger and a good place to house her pub business as she seeks to grow the business for more income for her family. Her local brew is hugely marketable. For a certain tribe who cherish it much more than any other drink, it’s actually hugely appreciated and valued.

This is Jeksa’s second loan from HOFOKAM and she is to buy millet for processing the local brew to sell in her pub.

loans.use: Buying millet for processing the local brew to sell

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
El señor Juan José C. A., es un hombre adulto de 71 años, es casado y su esposa se dedica a los trabajos de la finca que la familia posee, tienen 9 hijos mayores de edad, independientes que se dedican también a los trabajos de la agricultura, gracias  a las enseñanzas dadas por su padre quien los encaminó para que se valieran por su trabajo.

Tiene 42 años de experiencia en la sembrar piña, dentro de sus necesidades y/o proyectos a futuro está el realizar un estudio del suelo de su terreno, debido a que factores varios han ocasionado variedad de problemas que le imposibilitan la buena producción, es por esta razón que solicita de un préstamo para la compra de materiales agrícolas que permitan este buen mantenimiento, sobre todo a futuro la posibilidad de mejorar poco a poco su economía familiar, y de esta forma el heredarle a sus hijos una buena fuente de ingresos para sus vidas.
texts.en:
Señor Juan José C. A. is an adult male of 71 years. He is married and his wife is dedicated to working on the family farm. They have 9 children of legal age who are independent and also work in agriculture, thanks to the teaching given by their father who directed them so that they are worthy of the work. Juan has 42 years of experience in raising pineapple. Among their needs and/or projects for the future is to carry out a study of their land, since various factors have caused variety of problems that prevent good production. It is for this reason that he requests a loan for the purchase of agricultural materials that will permit good maintenance of his crop. Above all in the future he hopes to be able to improve their family economy little by little, and in this way to pass on to their children a good source of income for their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy agricultural materials for his pineapple crop

loans.name: Rosa Hermida

texts.es:
Rosa de 35 años, vive en el Paraíso de Guayaquil (zona periurbana con una ecología en disolución), con la ayuda de su esposo y sus  cuatro hijos ella pudo estudiar costura y realizar las practicas en una empresa textilera. 

Hace tres años atrás tuvo su primera maquina y pudo tener su propio taller de costura y confección en su casa, trabaja en la tarde y noche con su taller y en la mañana se dedica a vender productos en el sector donde vive para tener mas ingresos. 

Para tener la oportunidad de hacer mas ropa ella necesita comprar con el préstamo forros y cierres para su negocio. En el futuro quiere comprar maquinas industriales  para su taller.
texts.en:
Rosa is 35 years old and lives in Paraíso de Guayaquil. It is a semi-urban area on the outskirts of the city, and has a deteriorating ecosystem. With the help of her husband and their four children, she was able to study dressmaking and to learn first-hand at a textile company. Three years ago, Rosa got her first sewing machine and was able to start her own sewing workshop in her house. She sews in the afternoon and at night, and in the mornings she sells her products around the area where she lives, in order to bring in income. In order to allow her the opportunity to make more clothing, she needs to buy lining and zippers for her business. In the future, she would like to buy industrial sewing machines for her workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy zippers and lining

loans.name: Todos Juntos Podemos 1 Group

texts.en:
Zoila is the coordinator of her group "Todos juntos podemos 1" (All together we can, group number 1), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in San Pedro D. Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and sugar cane industries. There is a free trading zone, a cement factory, and other economic activities, while running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and her two children.

Zoila is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and improved her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business to buy rices, flour and other foods. Her business is a "colmado" - a place where you can find all the ingredients to make your daily food. Normally colmados such as this are in the same neighborhood, or within a short walk, from any home. She will use the profits to change her house from wood to concrete blocks so as to give a safer home to her family. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy rices, flour and other products to sell

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is a 45-year-old lady operating a restaurant in Masindi, Uganda. Her restaurant is one of the local ones designed to cater for the low income earning class in society. 

She is a mother of nine children, married to a teacher. She is the family’s breadwinner alongside her husband, and her family lives in a rented house though she hopes to construct her own house. She has been in business for eleven years. Having started with other members as a group, Edith has now become independent with her own premises.

She says she aims at improving the ambience of her restaurant to a better standard. She intends to buy foodstuffs for her restaurant business using the loan funds.

loans.use: Buying foodstuffs for her restuarant business

loans.name: José Armengol

texts.es:
El señor José Armengol L. P., tiene la edad de 37 años de edad, es casado, con sus 3 hijos adolecentes habitan en el populoso barrio Medardo Andino, su esposa se dedica a la agricultura, sus hijos apoyan a sus padres en los trabajos del hogar y la finca, tienen 11 años e dedicarse a la siembra de los cultivos de pithaya.

Dentro de los trabajos diarios que se tiene que realizar para preparar el terreno con las labores de arado, rastra, delineado y hoyado, cuida de la maleza y eliminacion de plagas y enfermedades que suelen afectar el suelo y dañar la cosecha. Este proceso productivo es muy costoso, ya que se requiere de comprar muchos insumos químicos necesarios para fertilizar el suelo. Y este a sido uno de los principales problemas que ha tenido, la falta de financiamiento, que no le permite la compra de insumos y materiales agrícolas, que brinden un mejor mantenimiento a sus terrenos, esta es la razón del préstamo, esto le traerá a un plazo mediano la posibilidad de mejorar sus condiciones económicas sobre todo que su hijo mayor está estudiando la universidad y los aranceles le han obstaculizado los planes de culminación de los semestres. Por tanto espera se le apoye a mejorar sus niveles de vida para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Señor José Armengol L. P. is 37 years of age. He is married, with 3 adolescent children. They live in the populous neighborhood Medardo Andino. His wife is dedicated to agriculture. His children support their parents in the work of the home and the farm. For 11 years they have been dedicated to the cultivation of pithaya (fruit of a variety of cactus, also known as dragon fruit). Among the daily tasks that he must perform are plowing, raking, marking lines and making holes for planting, weeding and eliminating pests and diseases that affect the soil and damage the crop. This production process is very costly, since it is necessary to buy many chemical supplies to fertilize the soil. And this has been one of the main problems that he has had, namely the lack of financing, which prevents him from purchasing supplies and agricultural materials to provide better maintenance to their lands. This is the reason for the loan. For a moderate period, It will provide him the possibility of improving their economic condition. Above all he is concerned that his older son is studying at the university and the fees they have kept him from completing some semesters. Therefore he hopes to support him to improve his standards of living for the welfare of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies and materials for growing pithaya (cactus fruit)

loans.name: Ángela

texts.es:
La señora Ángela L. C., tiene 61 años de edad vive en el Barrio de San Caralampio, ubicado en el humilde Municipio de la Concepcion, con su esposo y sus hijos que le apoyan en los trabajos del hogar, se dedica desde hace 18 años a la agricultura sobre todo de frutos cítricos, su hijo mayor de edad, es el único casado que se dedica al comercio, y apoya a su madre a los gastos económicos que se incurren en el diario vivir de la señora L..

Dentro de los principales problemas que ha acogido a la señora a lo largo de su carrera de siembra, son las plagas y las enfermedades que han obstaculizado en gran medida la producción de los frutos , es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales fertilizantes, fungicidas y otros que permitan un mejor mantenimiento de las tierras para el buen mantenimiento de sus cosechas, esta inversión le permitirá mejores condiciones económicas para la inversión en la reparación de su morada y a futuro heredársela a sus hijos o bien para la inversión o incursión a nuevas fuentes de ingresos.
texts.en:
Señora Ángela L. C. is 61 years of age and lives in the Neighborhood of San Caralampio, located in the humble Municipality of Concepcion, with her husband and their children who support her in the family work. She has been dedicated for 18 years to agriculture, mostly of citrus fruits. Her son of legal age is the only married child that is dedicated to commerce, and he supports his Mother with the economic expenses that are incurred in the daily life of Señora L.. Among the main problems that she has experienced in her work are the plagues and diseases that have hindered in great measure the production of the fruit. It is for this reason that she requests a loan for the purchase of fertilizer, fungicides and other materials that provide better maintenance of the lands for the good maintenance of her crops. This investment will provide better economic conditions for repairing her dwelling and in the future to pass on to her children or also to invest or explore new sources of income.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, fungicides and other materials to improve the production of her crop of citrus fruits.

loans.name: Eva María

texts.es:
Eva María es una madre de familia de 39 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos menores hijos en el caserío Los Zapatas del distrito de Tambogrande, una zona caracterizada por su producción de frutas para exportación, pertenece a la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, ubicada a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de utiles escolares y artículos de escritorio en una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio, el negocio tiene como principales clientes a los estudiantes de la zona, que siempre acuden a su establecimiento porque pone al alcance de sus manos artículos que siempre necesitan y por los cuales tendrían que ir hasta el pueblo central para adquirirlos.

El negocio es una fuente importante de ingresos para su familia, es por eso que ella trata de mantenerlo la mejor manera posible. Actualmente desea adquirir mas artículos para ampliar su negocio y seguir satisfaciendo la demanda de sus clientes, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Eva María es una mujer trabajadora y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es poder darle a sus hijos una mejos calidad de vida. En la zona donde vive ella es bastante estimada y respetada por sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Eva María is a mother and is 39 years old. She lives together with her husband and her two young children in the Las Zapatas hamlet in the Tambogrande District, a zone characterized by the fruit produced for export. It belongs to the province of Piura in the region of the same name, located 3 hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region. Eva María works selling school and stationery supplies in a small shop installed in her home. Her principle clients are the students in the zone, who always go to her establishment because she the articles that they always need are within their reach - otherwise they would have to go into the village to acquire them. Eva María's business is an important source of income for her family, and for this reason she tries to maintain it in the best way possible. She actually wants to acquire more articles to expand her business and continue satisfying her customers' demands. For this reason she has sought for the first time a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 500 nuevos soles, which will help her to achieve her objectives. Eva María is a very hard working and responsible woman. Her biggest desire is to be able to give her children a better quality of life. In the zone where she lives Eva María is well thought of and respected by her neighbours.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase school supplies to stock business

loans.name: Luis Eliberto

texts.es: El Sr. Luis Eliberto L. P. tiene 44 años de edad y vive en casa propia junto a su esposa y 2 hijas. Trabaja como obrero en diferentes obras que le otorga la Municipalidad de Santiago, desde hace 1 año. Quiere terminar con la construcción de su vivienda. Es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora que con mucho esfuerzo pretende tener una mejor calidad de vida para el y su familia. Su sueño es poder concluir con la construcción de su casa y darle una mejor educación a sus hijas. El Sr. Luis, agradece la ayuda que le brindemos para lograr hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Mr. Luis Alberto L. P. is 44 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and two daughters. He has worked for a year as a laborer on different projects in the town of Santiago. He want to finish construction on his house. He is a very responsible and hard working person who with his hard work intends to have a better quality of life for him and his family. His dream is to be able to finish contruction of his house and give his daughters a better education. Mr. Luis Alberto L. P. is thankful for the help that we are offering to make his dreams come true.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Mejoramiento de vivienda

loans.name: Moisés Bismarck

texts.es:
El señor Moisés Bismarck T. A., es casado de 41 años de edad tiene dos hijas adolecentes que estudian la secundaria y primaria respectivamente, viven en un municipio de Masaya, el señor labora como agente de ventas, desde hace 6 años, dando el sostén económico y alimenticio a su familia.

Dentro de sus principales necesidades esta la remodelación de su vivienda, pero sus limitaciones económicas no le han permitido llevar a cabo este proyecto y es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción tales como arena, cemento, piedrín,  y cerámicas, esta inversión le acceda a mejorar en gran medida las condiciones en las que actualmente habitan sobre todo que sus hijas se encuentran en un momento en donde demandan mejores condiciones, e independencia por la etapa de vivencia que actualmente conllevan.
texts.en:
Señor Moisés Bismarck T. A. is 41 years old and married. He has two teenage daughters that are in secondary and primary school respectively. They live in the city of Masaya. For the past 6 years he has been working as a salesman to provide for his family. Remodeling his home is among his most pressing needs, but his economic limitations are an obstacle. For this reason he is requesting a loan to buy building materials such as sand, cement, gravel and ceramic tiles. This loan will help him to greatly improve his family's living conditions. His daughters are at a time in their lives when they are asking for better conditions and independence.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials to remodel his home

loans.name: Felicita Hermenegilda

texts.es:
Felícita es una madre de familia de 51 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito de Olmos, el distrito con mayor extensión territorial de la región, está conformado por varios caseríos que distan mucho uno de otro, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a mas de una hora y cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace tres años a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado que consiste en una motocicleta a la cual se le anexa una cabina) ella, como propietaria del vehículo, lo alquila para que sea trabajado cubriendo las rutas que unen a Olmos con sus diversos caseríos. Esta actividad constituye una fuente importante de ingresos familiares.

El continuo uso brindado a la unidad movil y el estado accidentado de los caminos de la zona han hecho que la mototaxi empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar el correcto funcionamiento del vehículo, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Felicita es una mujer responsable y empeñosa. Su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para adquirir una unidad vehicular mas, con la que pueda percibir mas ingresos que le ayuden a sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Felícita is a 51 year old wife and mother who lives with her husband and children in Olmos district. The is the largest district in the region. It is made up of various communities that are far apart from one another and belongs to the Lambayeque province. It is located an hour and forty-five minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For three years, she has been offering a cargo and passenger transportation service in a motorcycle taxi (a motorized vehicle that consists of a motorcylce with a cabin attached). As the owner, she rents it out so that it can work the routes that link Olmos to different communities. This activity constitutes an important income source for her family. The continuous use of this vehicle and the poor condition of the roads in the area have caused the motorcyle taxi to undergo some serious problems that require some urgent repair to guarantee its correct use. That is why she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles that will help her acheive her goal. Felicita is a responsible and hardworking woman. Her greatest wish is to keep working to acquire one more vehicle with which she can make more income that will help her get her family ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair and maintenance expenses for a motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Eduviges Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Eduviges Antonio H. F., es casado tiene 38 años de edad, y su familia es de 3 hijos, su esposa se dedica a la venta de comida y refrescos, él labora como docente en Tecuantepe tiene a 12 años de experiencia en esta actividad.

Ellos habitan en una vivienda muy humilde, debido a sus condiciones limitadas económicamente es para su hogar que ellos solicitan de un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción que le permitan la edificación y sobretodo la reparación de su hogar, con el crédito compraran piedra, hierro, cemento, piedrín, con este material se edificara un muro en la parte trasera de su vivienda y se embaldosara el patio, debido a que en la temporada de invierno los insectos traen muchas enfermedades que amenazan con la salud de sus hijos adolecentes, es para la satisfacción de sus hijos que desean realizar este esfuerzo económico, asi como la proteccion de los miembros de la familia debido a que habitan en un àrea de la ciudad, que no goza de mucha seguridad social.
texts.en:
Eduviges Antonio H. F. is 38 years old, married, and has three children. His wife works selling food and beverages. He works as a teacher en Tecuantepe and has 12 years of experience in this field. They live in a very humble home due to their limited finances. For this reason, they seek a loan to purchase construction materials that will allow them to improve and above all repair their home. With the credit, they will buy stone, iron, cement, and gravel to improve the wall behind their home and to tile the patio, because in the winter insects bring many illnesses that threaten the health of their young children. It is for the satisfaction of their children that they wish to see through this economic feat, as well as the protection of their family members since they live in an area of the city that does not enjoy good security.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase stone, iron, cement, gravel for home improvements

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Mariatu K. is serious, hardworking and very determined to see that her business grows. Mariatu started a plastic utensils business when she got a small amount of capital from her husband. She has successfully managed her business for the past four years. Since she started her business, she has been helping her husband to support their home. 

Mariatu lives with her husband and four school-going children. She goes to work at 7:00 a.m. and back home at 6:45 p.m. daily. Mariatu’s challenge is how to improve her business to the level that she is able to employ an assistant to help her with the business. This she believes will help her expand the business, so that she can make more profit to enable her continue supporting her children and maintain her business. 

Mariatu needs a loan to expand her business and realize her dream of creating a job for another person. She intends to use the proceeds from this loan to educate her children to university level and buy land for erecting their family house.

loans.use: To buy more plastic bowls

loans.name: Nellys Manuela

texts.es:
Doña Nellys  de 51 años  de edad, labora para el MINED de Nueva Guinea como docente desde hace 18 años, tiene un hijo de 12 añitos de edad estudiando su primaria.

Esta solicitando su 1er credito para invertilo en mejoras de su vivienda, pues pretende cambiarle el techo a su vivienda ya que se encuentra en mal estado y con el invierno se moja parte de la casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que trabaja como agricultor en la finca que ellos poseen pues el asume los gastos familiares. 

su sueño es que su familia sigan los buenos caminos de DIOS y que permanezcan en union familiar.
texts.en:
Nellys is 51 years old, and has worked for the Ministry of Education of Nueva Guinea as a teacher for 18 years. She has a 12-year-old son studying in primary school. She is seeking her first loan for home improvements. She intends to replace the roof as it is in poor condition and part of the house gets wet in winter. She counts on the help of her husband, who works on the farm they own, to take care of the family expenses. Her dream is for her family to follow the good ways of God and stay together.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Metal roofing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Replace the roof of his house & pay for some household expenses

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Martina de  labora como decente  de primaria desde hace 13 años en  la Escuela Ruben Dario. Tiene 3 hijos los cuales estan estudiando, ademas cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que asume los gastos del hogar pues tiene su pequeño negocio de ferreteria.   

Martina esta solicitando refinanciamiento de su 7mo crèdito  con el objetivo de construir una habitaciòn y de esta manera brindarles comodidades a sus 3 hijos.  Expresa que se siente agradecida con AFODENIC por el apoyo que le ha brindado, pues gracias a los creditos otorgados ha logrado mejorar sus condiciones de vida.  Tanto ella como su esposo son reconocidos como personas de buen comportamiento social, son una familia muy humildes y trabajadores.  

Ademas Martina se caracteriza por su gran espiritu de superacion profesional pues actualmente esta cursando su tercer año en la universidad URACCAN la aspira a sacar su titulo de Ciencias de Educacion, su mayor sueño en la vida que sus hijos tengan salud y que estudien para que sean hombres de bien y tener una vivienda bonita como toda persona con mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Martina has worked as a primary school teacher for 13 years in the Ruben Dario School. She has three children who are in school. Her husband helps with the household expenses, as he has a small hardware store. Martina is seeking her seventh loan in order to construct a room and thus make her three children comfortable. She says that she is grateful for the help of AFODENIC--thanks to the loans she has received, she has been able to improve her living conditions. She and her husband are known to be well-adjusted people. They are a humble and hardworking family. Furthermore, Martina is known for her spirit of professional ambition. She is currently in her third year of university at URACCAN [Nicaraguan University of the Autonomous Regions of the Caribbean Coast] to get her degree in Educational Sciences. Her main dream in life is for her sons to be healthy and study in order to become good men, and to have a beautiful home like every person with better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Room construction

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel V. R. es un  señor de 44  años de edad quien vive con su esposa en una comunidad llamada El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, Provincia de Cartago.  Es una pequeña comunidad rural de aproximadamente dos mil habitantes. Sus pobladores se dedican a la producción de leche y siembra de café. Tiene un relieve irregular y mucho del terreno se mantiene como bosque tropical húmedo. La comunidad tiene paisajes muy pintorescos que combinan el bosque tropical con dos lindas lagunas, plantaciones de café y lecherías.
Don Miguel y su familia   se han dedicado por mucho tiempo al negocio de la lechería, y aun más desde que se instalo en su comunidad la planta de elaboración de quesos, propiedad de la Asociación de Productores de Leche de El Sauce. Debido a su experiencia   él conoce ,miuy bien acerca de  todos los cuidados que demanda, además de la instrucción recibida por parte de sus familiares  a lo largo del tiempo. 
Don Miguel  desea obtener un micro crédito de ¢500,000 (quinientos mil colones) para comprar una vaca lechera  mas y así aumentar  su producción a mas de 40 litros de leche por día  con esto el   lograra  crecer  su negocio ya que desea ser un microempresario exitoso para   ayudar a que su familia siga adelante y poder pagar la universidad de su hijo.
Don Miguel  es socio de la Asociación de Productores de El Sauce, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su octavo préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico. El asegura está muy agradecida por la ayudad que esta organización le ha proporcionado para cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Miguel V. R. is a 44 year old gentleman who lives with his wife in the community of El Sauce de Santa Tersita in Turrialba, Cartago Province. This small rural community has approximately 2000 residents, most of whom make their living by producing milk and growing coffee. The area is hilly and much of the land consists of humid tropical forests. In addition, the community has picturesque views that combine the tropical forests with two beautiful lakes, coffee plantations, and dairy farms.

Don Miguel and his family have dedicated much of their time to their dairy business. They focus even more of their time now that a cheese factory has been built in their community by the El Sauce Milk Producers Association. Since he has experience, Miguel is able to take care of all the demands required of his business. In addition, he has imparted his knowledge to the rest of his family over time.

Don Miguel wants to obtain a microloan of 500,000 CRC in order to buy another dairy cow so that he can increase his milk production by more than 40 liters per day, which will allow him to grow his business. He wants to become a successful micro-entrepreneur so that he can help his family get ahead and pay for his son’s university expenses.

Don Miguel is a member of El Sauce Association of Producers, one of 100 member organizations that make up EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his eighth loan and he hopes to continue growing on a personal and financial level. He says he is extremely grateful for the assistance the organization has provided so that he can accomplish his goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es:
La Sra.  María Teresa M. D., es una persona emprendedora quien tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación cuenta con dos molinos, además de las venta de leña, tortilla y frutas, ella trabaja de 5 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, cuenta con una trabajadora quien se encarga en la atención de los clientes (su hija).
Es madre de familia casada con tres hijos estos ya no se encuentra en el colegio ya que dos están casados y una soltera.
El préstamo solicitado es para utilizarlo en la compra de un motor para uno de los molinos, compra de leña y frutas para el negocio.
María Teresa  dice que todos los préstamos que le ha otorgado ceprodel han sido para su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. María Teresa M. D. is an enterprising individual who has a business in her home. She operates two grain mills and also sells firewood, tortillas, and fruit. María works from 5am until 6pm. She has one employee (her daughter) who is in charge of attending to the customers.

María is married and the mother of three children who are no longer in school. Two are married and the other one is single.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a motor for one of her grain mills. She will also buy firewood and fruit for her business. María Teresa says that all the loans she has received from CEPRODEL have been used for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase firewood, fruit, and a motor for her grain mill

loans.name: Juubo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  JUUBO est un des groupes de solidarité du Banc Villageois de NDOFFENE 1, il est composé de 08 femmes qui sont toutes mariées et mère d’au moins de 5 enfants. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 50 ans et se sont solidairement organisées de puis plus de 03 ans. Elles ont comme principales l’embouche bovine et/ou ovine, la transformation et vente d’huile d’arachide et de céréales locales. La position géographique du village est profitable aux membres du groupe et aux femmes  du village en général, car beaucoup de marchés hebdomadaires sont polarisés par ledit village. Alors, en moyenne, 04 jours sur 07 les femmes sillonnent ces marchés pour mener des activités commerciales. Ce prêt qui leur est octroyé leur permettra d’acheter des bœufs et de petits ruminants pour l’embouche et des arachides et des céréales locales pour le petit commerce.
Siga S., pour des raisons de décès d’un proche est absente lors de la prise de photo et n’y figure pas

Fatou Elhadj D. debout à droite au second rang de la photo est âgée de 48 ans, elle est mère de 07 enfants. Elle mène des activités diverses, comme la vente d’huile d’arachide, de céréales locales et elle fait aussi de l’embouche ovine. Son nouveau prêt lui servira essentiellement à acheter des moutons qu’elle va engraisser et revendre  au bout de 5 mois. Quant au petit commerce elle va le mener avec les revenus qu’elle a pu réaliser à partir des ses activités antérieures. Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge de ses enfants surtout en ce qui concerne leur scolarité.
texts.en:
The Juubo Group is one of the community support groups of Ndoffene 1 Banc Villageois. It is made up of eight women, all of whom are married and have at least five children. They have an average age of 50 and have been working together for over three years. Their main activities are raising cattle and/or sheep, processing and selling peanut oil and local grain. The location of the village is advantageous to the group members and village women in general because many weekly markets are held nearby. So, on average, the women travel to the markets to sell their goods four days out of seven. This loan that they have been granted will allow them to buy steers and small ruminant animals to rear, as well as peanuts and local grain for their small-scale business. Due to the death of a family member, Siga S. was not present when the photo was taken, so she is not in it. Fatou Elhadj D., standing on the right in the second row, is 48 years old and she has seven children. She conducts various business activities, such as selling peanut oil and local grain, as well as raising sheep. This new loan will basically allow her to buy some sheep that she will fatten up and sell after five months. As for the small-scale business, she will run it on the income she has made from her previous business activities. Her aim is to play a part in taking care of her children's needs, especially their schooling.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen the finances of this community support group

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Replace the roof of her house

loans.name: Yakha

texts.fr: Yakha B. est une femme de 60 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants et tutrice d’un  garçon confié par un tiers. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SAMBA 15 ans 1 depuis le 19 juillet 2002, elle a 15 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit et ne s’est jamais confrontée à des difficultés de remboursement. Elle est vendeuse de crème glacée et de jus de fruit naturels qu’elle fabrique de ses propres mains. Elle mène cette activité depuis plus de 05 ans et son nouveau prêt lui permettra de la renforcer  en achetant plus de condiments pour la préparation de ses crèmes et jus de fruit. Son objectif est d’augmenter ses revenus financiers et de participer à la prise en charge des besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Yakha B. is sixty years old, married, the mother of three children and the guardian of a boy entrusted to her by someone else. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Samba since July 19, 2002. She has already benefitted from 15 consecutive loans and never met any difficulties in paying them back. She sells ice cream and natural fruit juices which she makes with her own hands. She has done this kind of work for more than five years and her new loan will help strengthen her business by allowing her to buy more ingredients needed to prepare her ice cream and fruit juices. Her goal is to increase her income and to participate in meeting the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase working capital

loans.name: La Presa De Chosto Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de llama La Presa de Chosto, se ubica en el Estado de México. Esta comunidad se distingue por que existía una presa (hace 20 años). El grupo está conformado por 10 integrantes. 
María de los Ángeles M. es la presidenta del grupo. Tiene 39 años, estudió hasta el 6to año de primaria, es casada y tiene un hijo. Ella se dedica a la venta de bordados que inició hace 6 años. Solicita el préstamo para comprar hilos, servilletas, manteles, etc. 
La  señora Julia L.  integrante del grupo arriba mencionado se dedica a la venta de ropa que inició hace 12 años. Solicita el préstamo para comprar pantalones, camisas, suéteres para dama y caballero. Tiene alrededor de 100 clientes en las localidades de Chosto, La Mesa y Lanzados; poco a poco se dio a conocer en la región inicialmente tenía un taller de costura (hace 15 años) en el cual se maquilaba ropa, sin embargo por cuestiones personales se cerró el negocio y se repartió el capital entre los socios, de ahí les surgió la idea de vender ropa. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente contenta y satisfecha para invertir en su negocio la cantidad solicitada, ya que esta temporada de venta es buena por las clausuras en las escuelas, tiene pedidos de varios clientes ya solo para comprar la mercancía y repartirla. Tiene 38 años, estudió hasta el 6to año de primaria es casada y tiene 6 hijos, es originaria de la Mesa de Chosto. Quiere este crédito para comprar ropa satisfaciendo los pedidos de sus clientes. También espera emprender otro tipo de negocio, los fines de semana vende tostadas en el municipio de Acambay, le agradaría tener un establecimiento para vender comida típica. Tiene como proyecto a mediano plazo contar con un local para exhibir la ropa, desde que inicio con su negocio ha caminado casa por casa para colocar sus prendas, sufriendo las inclemencias del clima. 
Los otros integrantes son:
NOMBRE	        ACTIVIDAD
ROSALBA M.R.	        COMIDA
ALICIA M. A.	        ABARROTES
MA DE LOS ANGELES M.A.	ARTESANIAS
NOEMI O.T.	        DULCES
AVELINO M. A.	        COMIDA
ROSALVA M.L.          	JUGUETES
AGUSTINA L.M.	        GLOBOS
HILDA A.S.      	ROPA
ALMA ALEJANDRA M.M.	ZAPATOS X CATALOGO
texts.en:
This group, called La Presa de Chosto (The Chosto Dam), is located in the State of México. This community was known for its dam (20 years ago). The group is comprised of 10 members. María de los Ángeles M. is the president of the group. She is 39 years old, has a sixth-grade education, is married, and has a child. She sells embroidery, and has done this for six years. She is seeking a loan to purchase threads, napkins, tablecloths, etc. Julia L. has worked selling clothing for 12 years. She is seeking a loan to buy pants, shirts, and sweaters for women and men. She has around 100 clients in the areas of Chost, La Mesa, and Lanzados; little by little she has become known in the region. Initially she had a sewing workshop (15 years ago) in which she produced clothing. For personal reasons, she closed the business and distributed the capital among her associates, and from there came the idea to sell clothing. While asking for this loan, she is happy and satisfied to invest the credit into her business, as this season is good for sales due to school closures. She has orders from various clients and has to buy the clothing and distribute it. She is 38 years old, has a sixth-grade education, and is married with six children. She is originally from Mesa de Chosto. She wants this loan so she buy clothing to fill the orders of her clients. She also hopes to start another type of business. On weekends, she sells tostadas in the municipality of Acambay, and she would like to have an establishment for selling traditional foods. As a medium-term project, she has a place to display the clothing, since she has been walking house to house selling her clothes, suffering from inclement weather. The other members are: NAME: ACTIVITY ROSALBA M.R.: Food ALICIA M. A.: Groceries MA DE LOS ANGELES M.A.: Handicrafts NOEMI O.T.: Sweets AVELINO M. A.: Food ROSALVA M.L.: Toys AGUSTINA L.M. : Balloons HILDA A.S.: Clothing ALMA ALEJANDRA M.M.: Catalog shoes

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase threads, napkins, tablecloths

loans.name: Djita

texts.fr: Djita D. est une femme de 56 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 0 enfants. Elle est  membre du Banc Villageois de SAMBA 15 ans 1 depuis le 17 juillet 2002 et a 15 fois de suite reçu de crédit et a toujours régulièrement remboursé. Elle fait un commerce de tissus. Pour acheter sa marchandise elle va dans son pays d’origine le Mali,  pays frontalier au Sénégal. Elle vend en général sa marchandise à crédit et fais ses recouvrements mensuellement. Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son approvisionnement en tissus afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et de réaliser des bénéfices qui lui permettront de participer à la prise en charge familiale et de renforcer son niveau d’épargne.
texts.en:
Djita D. is 56, married, and has no children. She has been a member of the Samba 15 Ans 1 Banc Villageois since July 17, 2002, and she has received 15 previous loans, all of which she repaid. Madame D. runs a fabrics business. To buy her goods, she travels to her native country, Mali, which shares a border with Senegal. She usually sells her wares on credit and collects payment monthly. This loan will allow Madame D. to build up her stock of fabrics in order to better satisfy her clientèle and make a profit that will allow her to contribute to her family's needs and increase her savings.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen and develop her fabrics business

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr: Adama Baïdy SY est une femme de 32 ans, elle est divorcée et vit avec son unique enfant. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Samba 15 ans 1 depuis le 10 avril 2007 et a 6 fois de suite reçu de crédit qu’elle a toujours bien gérés et remboursés à temps. Elle fait un petit commerce de tissus teintés, elle s’approvisionne au Mali, pays frontalier au Sénégal, et revend dans sa ville. Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de payer son voyage vers le Mali et d’acheter son produit constitué de tissus teinté. Son objectif est de prendre en charge son enfant et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
Adama Baïdy SY is a 32-year-old woman who is divorced and living with her only child. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Samba 15 ans 1 since April 10, 2007. She had six consecutive loans, which she has always managed well and repaid on time. Adama has a small business selling dyed cloth. She purchases her goods in Mali, a country bordering Senegal, and she sells them in her town. Her new loan will enable her to pay for trips to Mali and to purchase her goods of dyed cloth. Her goal is to support her child and to increase her savings.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her working capital and buying cloth to sell

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama D. est une femme de 40 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants, elle est aussi tutrice de 07 autres enfants qui lui sont confiés par des tiers. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de SINTHIANG HOULATA depuis le 01é décembre 2009, elle n’a qu’une année d’existence dans le Banc Villageois et y a fait des performances remarquables en matières mobilisation d’épargnes. Elle est vendeuse de chaussures, de vêtements et de parfums. Avec son nouveau crédit elle va renforcer son niveau d’approvisionnement en marchandises (vêtements, parfums et chaussures) Elle a comme objectif soutenir ses enfants dan leurs études tout en augmentant son épargne.
texts.en:
Mariama D. is a 40-year-old woman, married, and the mother of six children. She is also the guardian of seven other children, who are entrusted to her by third parties. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of SINTHIANG HOULATA since December 1, 2009. She has been with the Banc Villageois for only a year and has a remarkable record there with regard to her savings rate. Mariama is a seller of shoes, clothing, and perfumes. With her new loan, she is going to boost the level of supplies of merchandise (clothing, perfumes, and shoes). Her goal is to support her children in school while increasing her savings.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying and reselling shoes, clothing, and perfurmes

loans.name: Aracely Judith

texts.es:
Aracely Judith Roció Vásquez, está dedicada a la venta de minutos  y quiere comprar un plan de minutos a celulares y una fotocopiadora para adicionar a su negocio este servicio y para ello està solicitando un credito a la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo por valor de $800.000 COP. Aracely  desde hace 3 años, buscando generar un ingreso,  prestó a una amiga $300.000 COP  a un interés del 15%, para emprender el negocio de vender minutos a celulares y a teléfonos fijos; con este  dinero compró sus primeros dos planes a sus operadores, una mesa y una silla e invirtió en la compra de dulces, para provechar el potencial de ventas de este sitio de trabajo que es muy visitado por transeúntes. 
Aracely tiene 9 meses de estar vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, desde ese momento,  su vida le ha cambiado para bien,  porque con estos financiamientos logró liberarse de créditos con  muy altas tasas de interés y este dinero conseguido con esta organización le ha permitido  mejorar su ingreso. Ella sueña con que su negocio prospere y adicionarle otros servicios como internet fotocopiado, buscando la forma de obtener otros ingresos  para sacar adelante a su hijo de un mes  de nacido y canalizarle un mejor futuro.
Aracely es una joven que se manifiesta sin problemas pero con muchas ganas de seguir trabajando y en las búsqueda de oportunidades que le permitan llegar a ser exitosa con el tiempo.
texts.en:
Aracely Judith Roció Vásquez sells phone minutes. She wants to buy a cellular phone plan and a photocopier for her business. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo in the amount of 800,000 COP. Aracely started her business three years ago in order to generate an income. She borrowed 300,000 COP from a friend at an interest rate of 15% so that she could start selling cell phone minutes and renting phone booths. With this money, she bought her first two cell phone plans, a table, and a chair to begin her operation. She also bought candy to take advantage of potential sales since many people pass by her location.

Aracely has been a member of Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo for nine months. From that moment, her life changed for the better because she was able to relieve herself of high interest loans and channel more of her money into improving her income. She dreams of having a prosperous business and adding other services such as Internet and photocopying. Aracely continues to look for other ways to generate revenue so that she can move her one-month-old son forward and provide him a better future.

Being a young woman, Aracely appears to not have any problems. She is eager to continue working and looking for opportunities to help her become successful over time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a photocopier & an additional cellular phone plan

loans.name: Binta

texts.fr: Binta N. est  âgée de 48 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants et tutrice de 02 enfants des ses proches. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SINTHIANG HOULATA depuis le 23 juillet 2002 et a 15 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit et a toujours remboursé sans difficulté. Elle est vendeuse de légumes, elle a une table de fortune au marché central de sa ville, elle y étale ses différents légumes constitués de carottes, de navets, de choux, de feuilles d’oseilles, de patates etc. l’objet de son crédit est d’acheter plus de légumes afin de réaliser plus de bénéfices et contribuer à la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Binta N. is 48 years old and the married mother of six children and the guardian of two children of friends or family. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of SINTHIANG HOULATA since July 23, 2002 and has had fifteen consecutive loans, which were always repaid without difficulty. Binta is a seller of vegetables. She has a make-shift table at the central market of her city and displays on it her different vegetables: carrots, turnips, cabbage, dried hibiscus flowers, potatoes, etc. The goal of her loan is to purchase more vegetables in order to make more profit and to help meet family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her working capital

loans.name: Guadalupanas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama guadalupanas porque en la sección en la que viven es “sección de Guadalupe” aparte de que son personas muy devotas. Está ubicado en el Estado de  México.  El grupo está conformado por  10 integrantes. 

Margarita D. es la presidenta  del grupo. Tiene 38, estudió hasta el 5 año de primaria,  es comerciante y ama de casa y tiene en total 2  hijos (1 mujer y 1 varon).  Ella se dedica a la venta de Tupperware que inició hace 1 años. Solicita el préstamo para invertir en producto  Sus clientes son las señoras de la misma comunidad y poblados cercanos.  Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente contenta. Quiere este crédito para comprar más producto. También espera poder ofrecerles a sus hijos una vida mejor y ayudar a su esposo.

Juana G. es otro integrante de este grupo. Tiene 28 años, estudió hasta el 6 año de primaria, es casada y tiene en total 2 hijos (1 mujeres y 1 varones).  Ella se dedica a la venta de  Bolsas y carteras que inició hace 1 años. Solicita el préstamo para comprar más mercancía. Sus clientes son las maestras de la escuela y las señoras que van a la iglesia los domingos.  Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente contenta, quiere este crédito para invertir en mas bolsas   También espera poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la escuela de sus hijos.

Los otros integrantes del grupo son:
MARGARITA VENTA DE TUPPER
JUANA VENTA DE BOLSAS
RITA VENTA DE COSMETICOS
TRINIDAD VTA DE ABARROTES
MARIA CLAUDIA TAQUERIA
MARIA DEL CARMEN
LOURDES VENTA DE PLATA
MA INOCENTE VENTA DE PLASTICOS
MARTHA VENTA DE CALZADO
MARIA MERCEDES VENTA DE CERAMICA
texts.en:
This group is called "Guadalupanas" because they live in the "Sección de Guadalupe" neighborhood and are very devout people. This neighborhood is in Mexico State. The group is comprised of 10 members. Margarita is the president of the group. She is 38 years old, studied until the 5th grade of elementary school, is a businesswoman and housewife, and has two children (a girl and a boy). She works selling Tupperware, and began doing this a year ago. She is requesting a loan to buy stock. Her clients are the women of her community and nearby towns. At the time of applying for this loan, she feels happy. She wants this loan in order to buy more stock. She also hopes to be able to offer her children a better life and to help her husband. Juana in another member of the group. She is 28 years old, studied until the 6th year of elementary school, is married and has two children (1 girl and 1 boy). She sells bags and purses, and began doing this a year ago. She is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise. Her customers are the teachers at the school and the women who go to the church on Sundays. At the time of requesting this loan, she is happy. She wants this loan to buy more bags. She also hopes to be able to help her husband with the school expenses for their children. The other members of the group are: Margarita - sells Tupperware Juana - sells bags Rita - sells cosmetics Trinidad - sells groceries Maria Claudia - runs a taqueria Maria Carmen Lourdes - sells silver Ma Inocente - sells plastic goods Martha - sells footware Maria Mercedes - sells ceramic goods

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Aïssatou

texts.fr: Aïssatou D. est une femme de 50 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants et tutrice de 05 autres qu’elle a plus ou moins adoptés. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SINTHIANG HOULATA depuis l’inauguration dudit Banc Villageois le 23 juillet 2002. Elle a 15 fois de suite était bénéficiaire de crédit et a toujours bien géré et remboursé à temps. Elle est détentrice d’un réfrigérateur et fabrique des glaces, de la crème et de jus de fruit locaux. Son nouveau crédit lui permettra d’acheter des condiments pour la préparation de ses jus et crème d’une part et d’autre part, participer au payement des factures d’électricité. Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Aïssatou D. is fifty years old, married, the mother of four children and the guardian of five others whom she has essentially adopted. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Sinthiang Houlata since its inception on July 23, 2002. She has benefitted from 15 consecutive loans which she always managed well and repaid on time. She is the owner of a refrigerator and makes ice cream, creams, and juice from local fruits. Her new loan will permit her to buy ingredients for the preparation of her juices and creams, as well as to help pay the electricity bills. Her goal is to support her husband in taking care of family responsibilities.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital and strengthen her business

loans.name: Nafissatou

texts.fr: Nafissatou S. est âgée de 27 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SINTHIANG HOULATA depuis le 03 mars 2006 et a 07 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit, elle n’a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Elle développe une activité de petit commerce de tissus et son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’en acheter en quantité plus importante que d’habitude. Son objectif est de réaliser des bénéfices qui l’aideront à mieux participer ç la prise en charge de sa progéniture par exemple par rapport à la santé et la nourriture.
texts.en:
Nafissatou S. is 27 years old, married and the mother of 3 children. She has been a member of the SINTHIANG HOULATA village bank since March 3, 2006 and has received a loan 7 times. She has never had any problems with repayment. She is developing a small fabric business and her new loan will allow her to purchase fabric in larger quantities than usual. Her goal is to make a profit that will help her to better contribute to the care of her offspring, for example, in relation to their health and diet.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and resale of fabric

loans.name: Almakan's Group

texts.en:
Almakan O. is the leader of the group. She is 39 and a widow. She has raised two sons and two daughters; the older son studies at university and the others are at school. In order to make money, Almakan, with the initial investment of 10,000 soms, started to purchase fruit and vegetables and resell them on the market at a higher price. In this way she plans to earn 5000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, Almakan wants to purchase various kinds of vegetables in order to resell them at the market. In the future she wants to stabilize her business and increase her turnover.

Chynarkan Z., 33, is the treasurer of the group. Her husband is a concrete worker on the hydro station. They have two sons and a daughter; all of them study at school. In order to make money, Chynarkan and her husband’s sister sell dairy products and national drinks near the road. She started with the initial investment of 5000 soms and now she makes 3000 soms per month. Chynarkan applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase dairy products to increase their turnover. In the future she plans to expand her business and purchase some land for farming.

Tynara K., 33, is married. Her husband works as a driver. They have two sons and a daughter. In order to make money,a year ago Tynara started to sell dairy products and national drinks near the road. She started with the initial investment of 10000 soms and now she earns 5000 soms per month. That profit made it possible for her to purchase a vehicle for her husband. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase dairy products and honey to resell. 

Satkankul U., 56, is a widow. She has raised five sons. The first son is a welder, the second is in construction; the third son is a soldier and the others went to work in Russia to earn some money. A year ago Satkankul started to breed livestock; she started this activity with the initial investment of 10,000 soms. Now that she has five sheep and three goats, Satkankul can sell one goat or one sheep a month if she needs money. She wants to get a loan to purchase sheep to increase the number of livestock and resell some of them after fattening. In autumn she plans to earn some money and purchase a cow.

 --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young, ambitious and socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). Mol Bulak is the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the Mol Bulak Finance staff.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for resale

loans.name: Munhtuya

texts.en:
Munhtuya S. is a 22-year-old, married woman who lives with husband in the Uvs province of western Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her husband works in a local meteorology center as a typist. 

Munhtuya operates a small cafe in her town. Years after her successful graduation from a college as a chef, she plans to start her business by cooking meals at a rented cafeteria with this loan. Munhtuya is requesting a 600,000 Mongolian Tugriks loan to start her cafeteria business.

loans.use: To start her cafeteria business

loans.name: Davaanyam

texts.en:
Davaanyam D., 28, resides with his wife and two children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in Uvs Province, Western Mongolia. His wife is a shoemaker who helps with his shoe-making business. Davaanyam has been making shoes for five years now, his products well known as “ white soled shoes” which are popular and warm and valued by his customers for their quality and design. He would eventually like to expand his business to the point of making a variety of shoes. 

Davaanyam, a shy, modest person with poor literacy skills, says “I will try my best to make shoes well and pay the loan on time.” He is requesting a 400,000 MNT loan to purchase materials such as glue, leather, rubber and tools for his shoe-making business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Enhtur

texts.en:
Enhtur S. is 39 years old and lives with his wife and three children, ages 3 to 19 in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a house. His eldest daughter is a student in Germany, while the younger two children are in high school and kindergarten. 

Enhtur operates a car repair and service business. He purchases old cars in order to sell them which produces a good profit. He began his business in 2005, and since that time has been enlarging his business to include operating a car repair service. 

This couple works hard to provide for their children and improve the quality of their lives with education. He is a modest and hard working person and requesting a 4,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase construction materials and supplies for building a new dormitory to expand his business lines.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials and supplies for building a new dormitory.

loans.name: Josephine Wairimu

texts.en:
Josephine Wairimu is a 46-year-old lady who is married to George Gachie, a 42-year-old farmer. They have three children between the ages of 6 and 24 years. 

Josephine is both a farmer and an owner of a green grocery shop at Waratho, which is on the outskirts of Nairobi. She sells her farm produce and milk from her cattle to her neighbors and those who pass by her grocery shop. She also sells milk to the local dairy processing plant near her home. She is able to take home 5,000 KES per month as profit.

Josephine learned about KADET from a marketing initiative and she decided to join.  She has now applied for her second loan which she will use to buy more stock for her grocery like pulses (groundnuts, peas and other protein sources) and also buy animal feed for her cattle.

Josephine would like to build a better house for herself and a better life for her children. She believes that with hard work she will achieve her goals.

loans.use: To restock items in her grocery shop and to buy animal feed

loans.name: Tryphonia

texts.en:
It is now fifteen years since M. Tryphonia started up her banana-selling business in Kyeikuchu, Ibanda, in western Uganda. With this as her only source of livelihood, she has painstakingly managed to make ends meet, albeit with some long-drawn-out seasonal income fluctuations and poor road systems used to access bigger markets.

With a hardwork ethic, the 40-year-old married and happy-go-lucky mother of four children has kept her business on a consolidated growth path. In a month, she makes close to 120,000 Ugandan shillings in profits. Her business, in gaining ground over these years, has in effect also meant that her family has benefited, especially in its requirements.

Tryphonia’s business plan for the future is to be able to sell more bananas to an increasingly expanding market. With this loan, she envisages purchasing manure and fertilizers for her banana plantation in order to improve her crop.

loans.use: To buy agricultural inputs like manure and mulches for her plantation

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase vegetables

loans.name: Henriette

texts.fr: A. Henriette est née en 1984 à Tori, au Bénin. Mariée à AYOSSO Didier, un mécanicien, Henriette est mère d'un enfant, qui est scolarisé. Henriette a un autre enfant à sa charge. Henriette vit depuis huit ans environs au quartier Cocotomey, dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi, avec son mari et ses deux enfants à charge. Henriette apporte une aide financière à son mari en ce qui concerne les charges familiales, grâce au revenu de son activité. Henriette n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Henriette vend des condiments de sauce et des produits vivriers (riz, farine de manioc, etc.) à son domicile. Henriette achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Henriette a bénéficié déjà de deux crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés à ALIDé. Henriette désire agrandir son activité et mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. C'est ce qui l'amène à solliciter un troisième crédit. Plus tard, Henriette ambitionne ouvrir une boutique pour y vendre ses produits.
texts.en:
Ms. A. Henriette was born in 1984 in Tori, in Benin. Married to Mr. AYOSSO Didier, a mechanic, she is the mother of one child, who is in school, and has another child to support. Henriette has been living with her husband and two children for about eight years in the Cocotomey district, in the community of Abomey Calavi. She helps out her husband financially with regards to their family expenses, thanks to the revenues from her business. Henriette did not attend school. She has been selling sauce condiments and staple foods (rice, cassava flour, etc.) out of her home. She purchases her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She has already had two loans from ALIDé that have both been repaid. She would like to expand her business and to respond better to customer demand. Later on, Henriette has the ambition to open a store for selling her products.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying 2 baskets of tomatoes, 3 baskets of chili peppers, and 2 sacks of cassava flour

loans.name: Fati

texts.fr: A. Fati est née le 24 Novembre 1982 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Fati vit depuis une vingtaine d’année au quartier Cocotomey, dans la commune d’Abomey Calavi. Fati est une célibataire qui n’a pas d’enfant. Fati vit seule et assure seule ses différentes charges. Fati n’a fréquenté que l’école primaire. Pour assurer ses besoins, Fati vend divers produits (riz, couscous, mayonnaise, sucre, conserves de tomate, dentifrices, allumettes, etc.)  à son domicile.  De façon secondaire, Fati vend de la farine de manioc. Fati s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin et aussi au marché de Cococodji dans la commune d’Abomey Calavi. C’est la deuxième fois que Fati sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un crédit, en vue d’agrandir son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Fati a bien effectué le remboursement de son premier crédit.
texts.en:
A. Fati was born on November 24, 1982 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. For about twenty years, she has been living in the Cocotomey district, in the community of Abomey Calavi. She is unmarried and has no children. She lives by herself and is alone in supporting herself. Fati did not attend school. To meet her needs, she sells various goods (rice, couscous, mayonnaise, sugar, canned tomatoes, toothpaste, matches, etc.) out of her home. Secondarily, she sells cassava flour. She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and also at the Cococodji market, in Abomey Calavi. This is the second time that Fati has requested a loan from ALIDé in order to expand her business and to satisfy her customers further. She has indeed repaid her first loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying 3 boxes of canned foods and 3 sacks of cassava flour

loans.name: Jachline

texts.en:
Jachline B. is currently in the business of selling charcoal at home and is requesting a loan to stock more charcoal to sell.  Jachline is 41 years old and is married to a husband who is a peasant. She has three children and who all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
A 49-year-old widow with seven children, all attending school, Sarah E. is currently in the business of selling maize flour and rice at the market and is requesting a loan to stock bags of soya beans and beans to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock bags of soya beans and beans to sell

loans.name: Damienne

texts.fr: S. Damienne est née en 1975 et est mariée à ATCHADE K. Télesphore, un électricien. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un est scolarisé. Il y a juste deux ans que Damienne et son mari se sont installés au quartier Djeffa, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, où ils vivent avec leurs enfants. Le couple se partage les différentes charges familiales. Damienne n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Damienne vend des condiments et de l’huile de palme à Ekpè. Damienne gère également un moulin à condiments. Damienne achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son capital et de rehausser le niveau de son activité , afin de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Damienne sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un deuxième prêt. Le premier prêt dont Damienne avait bénéficié a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Ms. S. Damienne was born in 1975 and is married to Mr. ATCHADE K. Télesphore, an electrician. The couple have two children, one of whom is in school. Just two years ago, Damienne and her husband settled in the Djeffa district, in the community of Sèmè-Podji, where they live with their children. The couple sharing in covering their different family expenses. Damienne did not attend school. To support herself, she sells condiments and palm oil in Ekpè. She also runs a condiments mill. She purchases her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. With the goal of bolstering her capital and raising her level of business, in order to respond better to customer demand, Damienne is requesting a second loan from ALIDé. The first one she had received was repaid.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying containers of palm oil and some condiments

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce W., a 43-year-old married mother of four children, has been operating a catering business employing two people for five years to earn a living. Joyce hopes to build a café so that she can have a reliable business premise and therefore is requesting a loan of Kes. 40, 000 through Imani group in Faulu Kenya.  She dreams of buying a piece of land where she can build a hotel in the future.

loans.use: To build a café for her business.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret D., 29 years old and single, is currently in the business of selling green vegetables such as dodo and okra and is requesting a loan to stock beans and rice to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan.
