BarranquilL., donD. se encuentra D. todo lo relacionado con los celulares en todas las marcas, desD. los más antiguos hasta los más modernos, así como accesorios y centros D. reparación D. estos mismos; es allí  donD. Martin tiene un puesto D. venta D. celulares y diversos accesorios relacionados con esta línea;  él Inició su vida como comerciante vendiendo cigarrillos, luego comercializando víveres  que traía D. Maicao, un municipio del departamento D. L. Guajira al norte D. Colombia; como se encontraba en el espacio púbico, fuè reubicado en este  amplio centro comercial donD. hoy se encuentra y ahí decidió vender hielo al por mayor y refrescos, pero luego enfermó y   con otro amigo  se dedicó   a vender celulares y gradualmente le metió accesorios como porta celulares, carcasas y otros detalles. 
Martin tiene 8 años D. estar en los programas D. L. Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  quien lo ha financiado para  L. compra D. activos fijos y para invertir en capital D. trabajo; y desD. entonces su negocio está más elegante y genera más ingresos porque se ha posicionado en estas instalaciones. En L. actualidad solicita a esta organizaciòn un credito para comprar nuevos estilos D. celulares y modernizar L. linea D. ellos con actuales modelos que han salido al mercado.
Su sueño en este momento es capitalizar su negocio y tener variedad D. mercancías  para competir con L. diversidad, teniendo lo que el cliente necesite y le guste y sobre todo lo más moderno que aparezca el mercado, por eso debe estar constantemente inyectándole capital D. trabajo a su negocio. También sueña con disfrutar más D. sus nietos y es un propósito que se ha trazado y que le genera mucha felicidad.
texts.en:
Martin Ramón D. L. P. has a large family that consists of his wife and 3 children ranging in age from 22 to 40 years old. He owns a business, insiD. a very popular mall in central BarranquilL., where he deals in everything related to cell phones of all kinds from the oldest to the most recent, as well as accessories and service centers. He has a stall here where he sells cell phones and different cell phone accessories. He started as a businessman selling cigarettes, then selling food brought in from Maicao, a city in the Department of Guajira in northern Colombia. Since he found a public space he relocated to this large shopping center and here he decided to sell soft drinks and ice wholesale. He eventually became tired of this, and along with another friend, he decided to sell cell phones and gradually, he introduced accessories like cell phone holders, cases and other items. Martin has been in the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo programs for 8 years now and they have given him loans for the purchase of fixed assets and to invest in working capital. Since then his business has become more chic and generates more income because of his place in the shopping center. Currently, he is requesting a loan to buy new styles of cell phones and to update the line with the current models that have flooded the market. Right now his desire is to grow his business and have a variety of merchandise in order to compete by having what his customers need and want and above all, to have the most up-to-date merchandise in the market. For this reason he wants to keep investing money into his business. Also, he plans to enjoy his grandchildren more as this makes him very happy.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy new styles of cell phones and to update his line with the current models

loans.name: Capilla Conchita Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama CapilL. Conchita, porque se encuentra frente a L. capilL. D. L. inmaculada Concepción. Está ubicado en el Estado D. México.  El grupo está conformado por 10 integrantes y es L.  cuarta vez que solicita un crédito a CrediComún. 

L. señora Leydy D. L. C. M. tiene 22años, es casada, estudió hasta el 6º año D. primaria, es ama D. casa y no tiene hijos.  ElL. se dedica a L. producción y venta D. pan que inició hace 3 años. Solicita el préstamo para comprar harina, azúcar y material para su puesto. Sus clientes son D. los alrededores ya que los comercializa los días D. feria, también les venD. a personas D. L. misma localidad cuando hay algún evento. A demás del pan también elabora pizza L. cual venD. por pieza o por rebanada.

Al momento D. solicitar este préstamo se siente contenta porque terminan un ciclo mas cumpliendo con pagos y con L. idea D. seguir invirtiendo  su crédito ya que le ha costado mucho trabajo mantener en pie su negocio, a pesar D. las situación económica ha logrado crecer poco a poco  gracias al crédito y al apoyo que tiene D. su esposo , comenta L. señora que sufrieron mucho para lograr iniciar L. producción ya que anteriormente elL. apoyaba a sus papas y ellos le permitían hacer uso del horno pero después D. que decidió independizarse fue en donD. le costó trabajo hacerse D. sus cosas. ElL. espera que con el tiempo y con el gran apoyo que manifiesta tener con el crédito lograr incrementar su producción ya que este negocio lo quiere ampliar y que le permita con su trabajo arduo mantener a sus hijos que planea tener ya que por el momento solo tiene L. idea D. trabajar y hacer más granD. sus negocio.

Los otros integrantes del grupo son: 
Crisanta M. V. (adornos D. temporada), 
Laura S. M. (cría D. animales),
María Guadalupe F. M. (cría y venta D. pollos), 
Carolina M. M. (Cría D. ganado), 
Susana C. S. (Cría y venta D. pollos), 
Carmen S. C. (Venta D. verdura), 
Leydy D. L. C. M. (Producción y venta D. pan), 
Amalia D. M. (Venta D. ropa), 
Araceli C. M. (Venta D. verdura) y 
Lourdes M. V.

Todas las señoras aparecen en L. foto sin embargo por timidez L. señora Guadalupe y Carolina quedaron un poco ocultas entre sus compañeras.
texts.en:
This group is called CapilL. Conchita because their businesses are located in front of the Chapel of the Immaculate Conception in the State of Mexico. The group is composed of 10 members and this is the 4th time they have solicited a loan through CrediComún. Leydy is 22 years old, married, and has completed the 6th year of primary school. She is married and has no children. Leydy is dedicated to the production and sale of bread, a business she started 3 years ago. She is soliciting a loan to buy flour, sugar, and supplies for her stall. Her clients are from the surrounding area and she sells on market days. Leydy also sells to people from the same locality when there is a special event. Besides bread, she also makes pizza, which she sells whole or by the slice. As she solicits this loan, Leydy feels very satisfied because she has just finished repaying a loan and is contemplating investing the new loan. It has cost her much work to keep the businesses going. Despite the current economic situation, she has managed to grow, little by little, thanks to the loan, and to her husband's help. Leydy suffered very much upon starting production, because she was helping her parents who permitted her to use their oven. Then after she decided to become independent, it cost her much effort to take charge of her own affairs. She hopes that in time, and with the h Help she will receive with this loan, she will be able to increase production, because she wants to expand her business, and that this will permit her to work hard to maintain the children that she plans to have. For the moment, she only focuses on the idea of working to make her business larger. The other members of the group are: Crisanta (seasonal decorations) Laura (raising animals) Maria Guadalupo (raising and selling chickens) Carolina (raising cattle) Susana (raising and selling chickens) Carmen (selling vegetables) Amalia (selling clothes) Araceli (selling vegetables), and Lourdes All of these women appear in the photo except, from shyness, Guadalupe and Carolina remain a bit hidden among their companions.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING FLOUR, SUGAR, AND SUPPLIES FOR MAKING AND SELLING BREAD AND PIZZA AT HER STAND

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.fr: Madeleine S. est une femme de 53 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois des femmes Catholiques de Tambacounda depuis le 27 juin 2008, le jour de l'inauguration. Elle fait la préparation et vente de couscous sénégalais depuis plus de 05 ans. Son nouveau prêt lui permettra de d'acheter plus de mil afin de préparer beaucoup plus de couscous afin de mieux fidéliser sa clientèle et de réaliser des bénéfices qui lui permettront de pouvoir faire face à ses besoins personnels et de soutenir son mari dans les différentes taches familiales.
texts.en:
Madeleine S. is a married woman of 53, the mother of six children. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" of the Catholic Women of Tambacounda since June 27, 2008, the date of its opening. She has been preparing and selling Senegalese couscous for five years. Her new loan would allow her to buy more millet in order to make much more couscous. In this way she would be able to develop customer loyalty, meet her personal needs, and better support her husband with various family expenses.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of millet to produce couscous for resale at market

loans.name: Xesaclac 2 Group

texts.es:
Doña Arcadia A. B., es quien dirige este grupo de señoras,  del paraje Xesaclac, Caserío Jutacaj, de la aldea Xequemeya, Momostenango, doña arcadia se dedica a la venta de leña,  cuenta con 2 hijas y 3 hijos,  cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos, ella lo compra con los comerciantes que lo venden a ellas, tiene su punto de venta en el centro del Municipio de Momostenango, departamento de Totonicapán.

Tiene una segunda actividad económica, que es la crianza animales domésticos tales como:  cerdos, ovejas, pollos y vacas,  cuenta con la ayuda de sus esposo que se dedica  a la venta de ropa en el mercado Del municipio de San Pedro Sacatepequez, del departamento de San Marcos, y las  personas  necesitan ampliar sus producción de animales y también de venta de leña  , por lo que se acercaron a las oficinas de la asociación ASDIR de pologuá, para poderles financiar, su actividad económica y así poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y de sus familias,  ya que es un segundo crédito que ellas solicitan.
texts.en:
Arcadia A. B. manages this group of women from the Xesaclac parrish in the Jutacaj rural community, Xequemeya village, Momostenango. Arcadia sells firewood. She has two daughters and three sons, and they help her. She buys from merchants. She sells at a spot in the center of the Momostenango municipality in the Totonicapán department. She has a second economic activity, which is raising domestic animals like pigs, sheep, chickens, and cows. Her husband helps her. He sells clothes in the market in the San Pedro Sacatepequez municipality in the San Marcos department. The people in the group need to expand their animal production and their firewood sales. That is why they came to the ASDIR Asociación’s offices in Pologuá to be able to finance their economic activities. That way they will be able to improve their living conditions and those of their families. This is the second loan they have requested.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more pants, blouses, skirts, shirts, underwear and a sewing machine

loans.name: Camino De Victoria 1, 2 Group

texts.en:
Edermira is the coordinator of her group, Camino de Victoria 1 y 2 (Victory Road), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Edermira’s group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production, and the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure being a single mom with three children.

Edermira is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza to invest in her fried food stand, improving her business and enabling a better quality of life with her children. She plans to use this loan to buy foods like cheese, chicken, flour, oil and some vegetables with which she will make fried food named empanada (made of flour and stuffed with meat, chicken, cheese or vegetables).

Edermira will use the profits to continue investing in her business, with the long-term goal of saving towards purchasing her own home. She believes that with the loans she will make this dream come true. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more flour, oil, butter, cheese, chicken and other ingredients

loans.name: Léonie

texts.fr: L. Léonie est née en 1965 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Léonie vit depuis une vingtaine d'année au quartier Zévou Aga à Porto-Novo. Mariée et mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, dont trois sont à sa charge, Léonie vit seule avec ses enfants et assure seule leurs différentes charges. Léonie n'a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Léonie vend des condiments de sauce (tomates fraîches, oignons, piments, etc.) à son domicile. Léonie s'approvisionne à Ikpinlè au Bénin et aussi à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Léonie exerce cette activité depuis dix huit ans et a déjà obtenu deux prêts qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Léonie désire renforcer son activité et augmenter ses stocks de produits, afin de répondre au mieux aux divers exigences de sa clientèle et d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaire. Pour y parvenir, Léonie sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Leonie L. was born in 1965 in Porto-Novo, Benin's administrative capital. She has lived in the Zévou Aga neighborhood of Porto-Novo for about twenty years. She is married with four children, all of whom have attended school and three are still in her care. Leonie lives alone with her children and provides for their needs on her own. Leonie only attended primary school. To cope with her various responsibilities, Leonie sells sauce condiments (fresh tomatoes, onions, peppers, etc.) from her home. She gets her stocks at the Ikpinlè market in Benin and also in Cotonou, Benin's economic capital. Leonie has been in business for eighteen years and has previously obtained two loans, both fully repaid. She wants to strengthen her business and increase her stocks to better meet her customers’ diverse requirements and bolster her sales. To that end, she is requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase baskets of fresh tomatoes, peppers and onions

loans.name: Xesaclac 3 Group

texts.es: Doña Basilia Ordóñez A., esta persona se dedica a la venta D. Tomate ,  cuenta con 5 hijas y 2 hijos,  que la ayudan con la actividad que realiza, la venta D. la Tomate , ella lo compra con los productores,, tiene su punto D. venta en el centro del Municipio D. Momostenango, departamento D. Totonicapán,  y tiene una segunda actividad económica como es la crianza animales domésticos tales como:  cerdos, ovejas, pollos y vacas,  cuenta con la ayuda D. sus esposo que se dedica  a la venta D. ropa en el mercado Del municipio D. San Pedro Sacatepequez, del departamento D. San Marcos, y las  personas  necesitan ampliar sus producción D. animales y también D. venta D. leña. Este grupo D. señoras viven en el paraje Xesaclac, Caserío Jutacaj, D. la aldea Xequemeya, Momostenango, han decidido solicitar, para financiar, su actividad económica y así poder mejorar sus condiciones D. vida y D. sus familias, que es un segundo crédito que ellas solicitan.
texts.en:
Basilia Ordóñez A. sells tomatoes. She has five daughters and two sons. They help her with the tomato sales. She buys from the producers, and she has her sales spot in the center of the Momostenango municipality in the Totonicapán department. She has a second economic activity, which is raising domestic animals like pigs, sheep, chickens and cows. Her husband helps her. He sells clothes in the market in the San Pedro Sacatepequez municipality in the San Marcos department. The people in the group need to increase their animal production and their firewood sales. This group of women lives in the Xasaclac parrish in the rural community of Jutacaj, Xequemeya village, Momostenango. They decided to request a loan to finance their economic activities. That way they will be able to improve their living conditions and those of their families. This is the second loan that they have requested.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase their working capital

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos Luis Gutiérrez M.  es un  señor de 48  años de edad quien vive con su esposa y 2 hijos  en una comunidad llamada El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, Provincia de Cartago.  Es una pequeña comunidad rural de aproximadamente dos mil habitantes. Sus pobladores se dedican a la producción de leche y siembra de café. Tiene un relieve irregular y mucho del terreno se mantiene como bosque tropical húmedo. La comunidad tiene paisajes muy pintorescos que combinan el bosque tropical con dos lindas lagunas, plantaciones de café y lecherías.
Don Carlos y su familia   tienen aproximadamente 5 años en el  negocio de la lechería, así que Debido a su experiencia   él conoce muy bien acerca de  todos los cuidados que demanda, además de la instrucción recibida por parte de sus familiares  a lo largo del tiempo. 
En este momento el    desea obtener un micro crédito de ¢500,000 (quinientos mil colones) para comprar una vaca lechera  aumentar  su producción de leche, con esto el   lograra  crecer  su negocio ya que la demanda de leche cada vez es mayor, y los precios de venta son muy buenos. 
Don Carlos  es socio de la Asociación de Productores de El Sauce, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer  préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico.
texts.en:
Carlos is a 48 year old man who lives with his wife and two children in a town called El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba in the province of Cartago. The town is a small rural community of approximately 2,000 people. Its residents work in milk production and coffee planting. Its terrain is hilly and a lot of the land is moist like a tropical forest. The town has very picturesque landscapes that combine tropical forest with two pretty lakes, plantations and dairy farms. Carlos and his family have been in the dairy business for about five years. He knows from experience as well as from instruction from relatives over time how demanding this business is. He currently wishes to obtain a loan in the amount of $975 to buy a dairy cow in order to increase his milk production. With this loan he will achieve business growth since milk demand is increasing and selling prices are very good. Carlos is a member of the Asociación de Productores de El Sauce (El Sauce Producers Association), one of the 100 partner organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan and he hopes to continue growing personally and financially.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cerone, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Thimothe

texts.fr:
Commercant de 52 ans ,marie pere de 4 enfants dont l'age varie entre 28 et 2 ans.
En 1990 , quand il perd son travail a cause de la crise ,ou il etait caissier dans un grand Super Marche (Presto)de la place, il commence alors avec la vente du petrole lampant, il associe a cela la location des chaises en plastique et apres en 2006 les appels telephoniques et la vente des  cartes recharges. 
Avec le pret il compte renouveller le stock des chaises en plastique,ajouter  encore 1000l de petrole lampant l'achat des  cartes de recharges en grande quantite des differentes societes de telephonie mobiles.

Certes la vente des cartes ne produit pas de grands benefices , mais il procedera cette fois ci a la vente des cartes en gros, et livrer plusieurs litres de petrole lampant chez les detaillants, eviter les ruptures de stocks; et renouveller ses chaises en plastiques. 
Pour l'avenir il pense qu'il n'est pas trop tard pour lui d'etre un grand homme d'affaire, ouvrir une station service c'est son reve le plus fort.
Tres connu dans le quartier , on l'appelle chef de quartier.
texts.en:
This businessman, 52, is married and the father of four children, aged between 28 and 2 years old. In 1990, he lost his job because of the crisis. He had been a cashier at a big local supermarket (Presto). He began at that point to sell kerosene and to rent out plastic chairs, and after 2006, to sell phone time and telephone recharge cards. With this loan he is intending to renew his stock of plastic chairs, add another 1000 liters of kerosene to his stock as well as a large quantity of telephone recharge cards from various mobile phone companies. It is true that selling the cards does not bring in much profit, but he intends to buy them wholesale this time, and to deliver several liters of kerosene at a time to retailers, avoiding finding himself out of stock, and getting new plastic chairs. For the future, he thinks it is not yet too late for him to become a big businessman. His greatest dream is to open up a service station. He is well-known in his neighborhood, where they call him "Chief".

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of telephone charge cards, plastic chairs, and drums of kerosene

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy cosmetics and beauty salon products

loans.name: Jose Dolores

texts.es:
José de 46 años, vive en el Paraíso de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución), Hace 14 años el compro un solar para construir su casa y tener su negocio de comidas.

Después de haber comprado el solar con una mesita y cocineta el empezó a vender “caldo de salchicha” (plato típico del Ecuador que se lo prepara con las viseras de la vaca rellenas de plátanos),  poco a poco con esfuerzo a podido tener su propio negocio ahora también vende “fritada” (es un plato con carne de chancho y granos), trabaja todos los días desde las 05:30am hasta el anochecer. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar una cocina y mesas para su negocio de comidas, en el futuro quiere arreglar mejor su negocio de comidas rápidas.
texts.en:
José is 46 years old and lives in Paraíso de Guayaquil - an area now on the outskirts of the city, whose natural ecology is fast disappearing. 14 years ago, he bought a plot of land to build his house and set up his catering business. After he bought the land, a table and a little kitchen, he began selling “caldo de salchicha” (an Ecuadorean speciality made with beef and plantains). Little by little and with a lot of work, he was able to build up the business, which now also sells "fritada" (a dish made with pork and corn). He works every day from 5.30am till nightfall. With this loan, José wants to buy a better kitchen and tables for his business. In the future he wants to improve his fast food business further.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Kitchen, tables

loans.name: Célestine

texts.fr: Z. Célestine est née en 1985 et vit depuis une dizaine d'année au quartier Abokicodji à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Célestine est célibataire et n'a pas encore d'enfant. Célestine vit seule et assure seule ses différentes charges. Célestine n'a pas fréquenté l'école, mais a appris la coiffure. C'est cette activité que Célestine exerce depuis près de dix ans, et qui lui procure des revenus l'aidant à subvenir à ses besoins. Parallèlement à cette activité, Célestine vend des mèches et des produits de coiffure dans son atelier. Célestine achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et aussi au Nigéria, pays limitrophe du Bénin. Célestine a déjà bénéficié de deux prêts qui ont été tous bien remboursés auprès de ALIDé. La demande en produits cosmétique de la clientèle de Célestine se fait de plus en plus sentir et Célestine désire augmenter le stock de ses produits pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. C'est donc pour y arriver que Célestine sollicite un troisième crédit.
texts.en:
Z. Célestine was born in 1985 and has been living for about 10 years in the Abokicodji district in Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin. Célestine is single and doesn't have any children yet. She lives alone and supports herself. Célestine didn't go to school but instead learned hairdressing. This is the business that she has been in for almost 10 years and which brings in the income she lives off of. Alongside this business, she sells hair extensions and other hairdressing products in her salon. She buys her merchandise in Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin, and also in Nigéria, a neighboring country of Bénin. Célestine has already received two loans which she correctly reimbursed to ALIDé. The demand for cosmetics among Célestine's clientele is growing, and Célestine would like to add to her stock of these products so that she can better satisfy her clientele. This is the reason why she is requesting a third loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of hair extensions and other hairdressing products

loans.name: Rose Marie Chantal

texts.fr: Rose est une femme celibataire et mere de 2 enfants .Elle est dans le metier de la coiffure.Elle a un salon de coiffure mais aussi un centre de coiffure ou elle forme des eleves dans les metiers de la coiffure et de l'esthetique.Elle dispose d'une experience de plus de 6 ans dans le domaine.Elle fait ce metier pour gagner sa vie et gerer ses enfants.Voila pourquoi elle utilise ses benefices realises dans les charges familiales.Elle compte developper son activite dans le futur.
texts.en:
Rose is a single mother of two children. She is a hairdresser. She has a beauty shop and also a training center where she teaches coiffure and cosmetology. She has more than six years experience in this field. She works at this job in order to support herself and her children. For that reason, she uses her profit for family expenses. She hopes to develop her businesses still further in future.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to renovate her beauty shop

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es:
Alexander Fernández V.  es un  señor de 35  años de edad quien vive con su esposa y 2 hijos  en una comunidad llamada El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, Provincia de Cartago.  Es una pequeña comunidad rural de aproximadamente dos mil habitantes. Sus pobladores se dedican a la producción de leche y siembra de café. Tiene un relieve irregular y mucho del terreno se mantiene como bosque tropical húmedo. La comunidad tiene paisajes muy pintorescos que combinan el bosque tropical con dos lindas lagunas, plantaciones de café y lecherías.
Hace poco más de dos años, don Alexander se ha desarrollado como microempresario, con un pequeño proyecto dedicado a la  producción de leche y algunos derivados, tales como natilla y queso. El vive  con sus 2 hijos quienes han ayudado a mantener a flote el hogar y su pequeño negocio.  Colaboran tanto en la elaboración como en la comercialización de los productos.
Dice estar muy satisfecho  con este proyecto, ya que le ha generado una mayor confianza, ha servido como una fuente de ingresos para mejorar sus condiciones a pesar de algunos problemas que aquejan a la comunidad y sin dejar de lado que ha logrado mantener a su familia unida. Y no han tenido que emigrar a la ciudad a buscar trabajo.
Actualmente Don Alexander requiere un préstamo de ¢623,000 (Seiscientos veintitrés mil colones) con el fin de comprar una vaca lechera, la cual asegura conocer bastante bien porque es de su vecino. Con esta vaca el pretende aumentar la producción de leche y  así generar más ingresos que le permita seguir creciendo como Microempresario
texts.en:
Alexander Fernández V. is a 35 year old man who lives with his wife and 2 children in a community called El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, in Cartago province. It is a small rural community with around 2,000 inhabitants, mostly producing milk and coffee beans. The area has hilly terrain and a lot of it is tropical rain forest. There are some real beauty spots, where the tropical forest meets two lovely lakes, coffee plantations and dairy farms. In a little over two years, Alexander has developed himself into a micro-entrepreneur, with a small business producing milk and milk products such as cheese and cream. His children have helped him keep the home and business running, even helping to make and market the produce. He says he is very happy with this project: it has increased his confidence and provided income to improve their living conditions despite difficulties that have befallen the little community - indeed it has enabled him to keep his family together, as it means he has not had to leave to find work in the city. Now Alexander needs a loan of 623,000 colones ($1200) in order to buy a milk cow from his neighbour. With this cow he will be able to increase his production, generate more income, and continue to develop as an entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Olivier Fabrice Guichard

texts.fr:
Jeune coiffeur de 29 ans , celibataire avec 2 enfants dont l'age varie entre 5 ans et 3 mois, il ouvre son salon de coiffure homme  en 2003 apres avoir arreter ses etudes  en classe de premiere par manque de soutien.
Il a des nombreux clients dans le quartier, des enfants et des adultes, ses recettes varient entre 10000frs a 15000 frs par jour. 
Avec l'octroi de son pret, il compte acheter  deux tondeuses electriques, deux tondeuses manuels, les lames rasoirs, des produits cosmetiques, des mousses a raser,de l'alcool et de la poudre.
Il a des grandes ambitions , se faire un nom en faisant connaitre son salon par la qualite de ses services et ouvrir un autre salon avec le temps.
Il pense avec le temps epargner au fur et a mesure , ameliorer les conditions de vie de sa petite famille et etre un grand homme d'affaire.
texts.en:
This young 29-year old hairdresser is the single parent of two children, a 5-year old and a 3-month old. He opened his barbershop in 2003 after having to quit primary school for lack of support. He has many customers in the neighborhood, including both children and adults. His revenues range from 10,000 to 15,000 francs per day. With the loan, he intends to buy two electric clippers, two manual ones, razor blades, cosmetics, shaving foams, some alcohol and some powder. He has great ambitions. He hopes that the quality of his services will help him make a name for himself and eventually open another salon. Over time, he plans to save his money, improve the living conditions of his family, and become a successful businessman.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase two electric clippers, razor blades, and cosmetics

loans.name: Victoriano Percider

texts.es:
Victoriano de 41 años, vive en el Paraíso de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución), el tiene cuatro hijos y trabaja vendiendo helados, bolos (refresco congelados en fundas). 

El y su esposa se levantan muy en la mañana para hacer los bolos y los helados, en la mañana y tarde sale a vender los bolos y helados y en las noches para tener mas dinero trabaja en el mercado de “Montebello” de Paraíso.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar frutas para vender en su casa y tener mas dinero. En el futuro quiere independizarse totalmente para pasar mas tiempo con su familia.
texts.en:
Victoriano is 41 years old and lives in Paraíso de Guayaquil - an area now on the outskirts of the city, whose natural ecology is fast disappearing. He has 4 children and works selling ice-creams and "bolos" (frozen soft drinks, a bit like popsicles). He and his wife get up early in the morning to make the ice-creams and bolos, and Victoriano goes out in the morning and afternoon to sell them. In the evenings he makes extra money working in the Montebello market in Paraíso. With the loan he wants to buy fruit, to sell from home to make more money. In future he would like to work totally for himself so that he can spend more time with his family.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit

loans.name: Marie  Emilie

texts.fr: Marie Emilie est une femme mariee et mere de plusieurs enfants.Elle fait le commerce de produits divers comme le miel,l'huile de palme etc...Elle achete ses produits en Guinee pour les revendre a ziguinchor.Elle a une experience de plus de 10 ans dans ce commerce.Elle fait ce commerce pour gagner de l'argent et subvenir a ses charges familiales.Elle compte developper son commerce dans l'avenir.
texts.en:
Marie Emilie is married with children. She sells various products such as honey, palm oil etc. She purchases her goods in Guinea in order to resell them in Ziguinchor. She has been in this line of business for over 10 years. She does it in order to earn money and help with the family expenses. She plans to expand her business in the future.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthening her business

loans.name: El Billar Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Billar lo conforman tres féminas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es María Auxiliadora R., coordinadora del grupo, ella se dedica al comercio de ropa como camisas, blusas, pantalones, jeans, etc. desde hace tres años. Este negocio lo inicio con 2,000 córdobas actualmente la inversión es mayor porque tiene una clientela fija.
Las otras integrantes de grupo son Dina Isabel R.  R. quien a partir del 2003 comercializa  ropa y calzado y María de los Ángeles L. Calero comenzó a los 17 años vendiendo fresco en la actualidad tiene su propia refresquería.  
Las tres sueñan con mejorar sus negocios, tener su propio local e invertir en otros productos por ejemplo R. añora tener una tienda, Lezema desea llegar a tener una repostería y R. desea progresar. Es por ello que aplican los conocimientos adquiridos en las capacitaciones de Adim.
texts.en:
The Billar group is made up of three women who are hardworking, eager, and enterprising. One of them is María Auxiliadora R., the group’s coordinator. She has been selling clothing such as shirts, blouses, pants, jeans etc. for three years. She began with an investment of 2,000 córdobas in the business, but now it is larger because she has a regular clientele. The other members of the group are Dina Isabel R. R. who has been selling clothing and shoes since 2003, and María de los Ángeles L. Calero who began selling drinks at the age of 17, and now has her own refreshment stand. The dream of the three women is to improve their businesses, have their own stalls, and buy other products to sell. R., for example, would like to have a store, Lezema a bakery, and R. just wants to get on in life. For these reasons, they are putting into practice the knowledge they have gained through Kiva partner Adim’s training programs.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Odile

texts.fr: Odile M. est une femme de 51 ans, elle est mariée et mère d'un enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois des femmes Catholiques de Tambacounda depuis son inauguration le 27 juin 2008. Elle en a reçu 04 crédits qu'elle a toujours bien gérés et remboursés sans difficulté. Elle est teinturière et son nouveau prêt lui permettra de d'acheter des tissus et de intrants pour les teindre. Après les avoir teints, elle confectionne des draps de lit pour ensuite les revendre par pièce. Les bénéfices générés à partir de cette activité lui permettent de participer financièrement à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Odile M. is 51 years old, married, and the mother of one dependent child. She has been a member of the Tambacounda Catholic Women's Banc Villageois since it was created on June 27 2008. She has received four loans from the Banc Villageois, all of which she has managed very well and repaid without any problems. She dyes fabric, and this new loan will allow her to buy fabric and ingredients for the dyes. She makes bed sheets and sells them individually. The profit generated from this activity will allow her to contribute financially to an improvement in the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Sarah Puchner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric and ingredients to make dyes

loans.name: Mariposas Group

texts.es:
LA SEÑORA LIZBETH G. H. ES ORIGINARIA DE LA  RIBERA ÁNGEL CORZO MUNICIPIO DE COPÍNALA MESCALAPA ESTADO DE CHIAPAS, MÉXICO. CONOCIDO TAMBIÉN  COMO GUADALUPE. TIENE 28 AÑOS DE EDAD ESTUDIO HASTA EL TERCERO DE SECUNDARIA, VIVE EN UNION  LIBRE CON EL SEÑOR JULIO REYES HERENANDEZ  Y  TIENE UNA HIJA PEQUEÑA DE 7 AÑOS DE EDAD.
LIZBET DESDE PEQUEÑA CONOCIO ÉSTA ACTIVIDAD, YA QUE ÉSTE ES UN NEGOCIO FAMILIAR Y SUS PADRES SE DEDICABAN A ÉSTO, ASÍ ELLA Y SU HERMANA FORMARON UNA SOCIEDAD Y TABAJABAN JUNTAS EL NEGOCIO. HACE POCOS AÑOS PASO A SU PROPIEDAD, LA CUAL COMENTA QUE LE HA AYUDADO MUCHO EN SUS INGRESO DE SU HOGAR Y FAMILIA.
SU INSPIRACION POR ESTE TRABAJO ES QUE GRACIAS A ELLO HA  PODIDO SALIR ADELANTE DIA A DIA SIN DAR UN PASO ATRÁS, POR ESO SOLICITO EL PRESTAMO CON FUNDACION REALIDAD A.C. PARA TRABAJARLO Y CON LAS GANACIAS QUE OBTENGA A HORRAR  Y CONSTRUIR UN LOCAL PARA ATENDER MEJOR SUS CLIENTES Y SE SIENTAN CONTENTOS Y SATISFECHOS CON LA ATENCION.
DOÑA LIZBETH PASO A FORMAR PARTE DEL GRUPO POR SU PRIMA LIMNI QUIEN LA INVITO A UNIRSE CON LAS DEMAS INTEGRANTES Y DIERON  POR NOMBRE “MARIPOSAS”, LA RAZON  DEL NOMBRE ES POR QUE EN SUS CASA AY CHARQUITOS DE AGUA Y SE JUNTAN MARIPOSAS.

LAS PERSONAS QUE INTEGRAN EL GRUPO MARIPOSAS SON:
*MIRNA A.  H.: EN LA FABRICACION DE BLOCK.
*LIMNI G. P.: VENDE TAMALES  Y ANTOJITOS.
*DELLANIRA VAQUEZ G.: VANTA DE FRUTAS Y LEGUNBRES.
*DOÑA LIZZBETH, LA CUAL SE LETOMO LA HISTORIA AL NEGOCIO DE CARNE.
*EZPERANZA G. H.: TIENE UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES.
*MIRENA G. S. QUIEN TIENE UN DEPOSITO DE REFRESCOS.
ES ASI COMO SE CONFORMA ESTE CRUPO Y POR CIERTO ESTA MUY UNIDO.
NOTA: EN LA FOTO APARESE LA AYUDANTE DE LA SEÑORA LIZBETH (ES LA SEÑORA QUE ESTA PESANDO Y CORTANDO LA CARNE),LA AYUDANTE NO ESTA INTEGRADA AL GRUPO, PERO COMO HABÍA CLIENTES NO PODÍAN DEJARLOS ESPERANDO, POR QUE COMO DICE LA SEÑORA LIZBETH, "LOS CLIENTES SON LO MAS IMPORTANTE EN UN NEGOCIO"
texts.en:
Lizbeth G. H. is from the Ángel Corzo shore of the Copínala Mescalapa municipality in the state of Chiapas, México. She is also known as Guadalupe. She is 28 years old, and she went to school until the third year of high school. She lives in a common-law-marriage with Julio Reyes Herenandez, and they have a small seven year old daughter. She has been butchering beef since she was young. She was in a partnership with her sister, and they worked together in the business. After a few years it came into her ownership. She comments that it has really helped her with the home and family income. She is inspired to work because, thanks to the work, she has been able to get ahead day to day without taking a step backwards. That is why she requested a loan with the Fundación Realidad A.C. She will use the loan for work, and with the earnings she gets she will save and build a place. At the place she builds she will be able to better take care of her customers, and they will be happy and satisfied with the service. Lizbeth became part of the group because her cousin, Limni, invited her to join the other members. They named the group “Mariposas” (Butterflies) because in their houses there are pools of water where butterflies gather. The following people are members of the Mariposas Group: Mirna A. H.: Makes blocks Limni G. P.: Sells tamales and snacks Dellanira Vaquez G.: Sells fruits and vegetables Lizbeth, she told her story about her meat business Ezperanza G. H.: Has a grocery store Mirena G. S.: Has a soft drink store That is who makes up the group, and they are assuredly very united. Note: Lizbeth’s helper appears in the photo (she is the woman weighing and cutting the meat). Her helper is not in the group. Because there were customers, they could not let them wait. As Lizbeth says, “The customers are the most important thing in a business”.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expenses for butchering meat an ingredients for pastries

loans.name: Sope Serigne Fallou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOPE SERIGNE FALLOU est composé de six femmes toutes issus du même village et se sont organisées et constituées par proximité et par affinité. Elles sont âgées en moyenne de 35 ans exceptée  Aïcha F. et Ndèye Y. qui sont respectivement de 49 ans et 48 ans (première et troisième sur la photo à partir de la droite). Le groupe est créé le 14 décembre 2008 et ses activités principales sont le petit commerce de légumes, de friperie et l'embouche. L'existence du grand marché quotidien dans la ville est très favorable aux femmes pour l'expansion de leurs activités commerciales. En plus des remboursements réguliers qu'elle font elles ont une bonne capacité de mobilisation d'épargne.

Coumba M. en médaillon sur la photo est née le 16 octobre 1969, elle a 41 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants en charge. Elle mène une activité de petit commerce de légumes et d'huile de palme. Elle poste d'un petit espace au marché central de sa ville où elle a installé une table en fortune pour la vente de ses produits. Elle mène cette activité depuis son intégration dans le Banc Villageois le 14 décembre 2008. En sus de cette activité elle fait de la pâtisserie et vend ses galettes dans les écoles et en faisant du porte à porte. L'objet de son présent crédit est de renforcer sa capacité d'investissement afin d'accroître ses activités et de toucher une plus large clientèle dans le but de réaliser plus de bénéfices. Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge familiale, participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille, et à son épanouissement. Par exemple la santé et la nourriture.
texts.en:
The soldiarity group Sope Seringe Fallou is made up of six women all from the same village who have come together as friends and neighbors.Their average age is 35, with the exception of Aïcha F. and Ndèye Y., 49 and 48 years old respectively (first and third from the right, in the photo). The group was created on December 14 2008 and its main activities are selling vegetables and second-hand clothing, and fattening animals. The town’s large daily market helps the women to increase their business activity. As well as the regular repayments that they are making, they also have the ability and motivation to save. Coumba M., shown in close–up in the photo, was born on October 16 1969, is 41 years old, married and the mother of two dependent children. She has been carrying out this activity since joining the Banc Villageois on December 14 2008. In addition, she makes pastries and sells her goods in schools and door-to-door. The purpose of this loan is to increase her capacity for investment in order to expand her business and to reach more customers, with the goal of making more profit. She aims to support her husband in the household expenses and contribute to the family’s growth and improvement in living conditions, such as health and nutrition.

Translated from French by Sarah Puchner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase investment capacity and promote the group's activities

loans.name: Luna Group

texts.es: La señora Micaela T. G., quien representea este grupo, del paraje Cuesta del aire, del a aldea Chivarreto municipio de San Francisco el Alto departamento de  Totonicapán, trabaja en relación de dependencia, en la confección de delantales, ella trabaja los días, lunes a viernes, sus patrón es de la misma aldea, su estado civil es soltera, por lo que quiere hacer su capital  desde ya para poder  estar solvente en el futuro,   ella se dedica también a la crianza de animales domésticos tales como ganado vacuno. Bovino, porcino  y en la crianza de pollos ponedoras  y los vende en el mercado  des San Francisco el Alto departamento de Totonicapán,  , las personas  necesitan ampliar sus Capital de Trabajo, son personas que se conocen muy bien, desde hace 8 años han trabajado siempre juntas, por lo que se acercaron a las oficinas de la asociación ASDIR de Pologuá,  para solicitar  el segundo crédito que necesitan para su , su actividad económica que es la confección de delantales y  necesita comprar una maquina  industrial  y así lograr  sacarle provecho a sus trabajo y así poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y de sus familias.
texts.en:
Micaela T. G. represents this group from the Cuesta del Aire parrish in the Chivarreto village, San Francisco municipality, El Alto department, Totonicapán. She works for an agency making aprons. She works everyday, Monday through Friday. Her boss is from the same village. She is single, and she wants to make money in order to be able to be solvent in the future. She also raises domestic animals like cows and pigs. She raises laying hens, and sells them in the San Francisco el Alto market in the Totonicapán department. The people in the group need to increase their working capital. They are people who know each other very well. They have worked together for eight years. They came to the ASDIR asociación’s office in Pologuá to request their second loan. They need the loan for their economic activity, making aprons. They need to buy an industrial machine. That will benefit their work, and they will be able to improve their living conditions and those of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Marguerite

texts.fr: Marguerite D. est une femme de 39 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle est membre du banc Villageois des Femmes Catholiques de Tambacounda depuis le 27 juin 2008, jour de l'inauguration dudit Banc Villageois. Elle a durant ces deux dernières années bénéficié 04 fois de suite de crédit et a toujours remboursé sans difficulté. Elle développe un petit commerce de jus de citron et d'huile de palme, en sus, avec son réfrigérateur elle fabrique des glace qu'elle vend dans son quartier. Son prêt lui servira à s'approvisionner en marchandises (jus de citron et huile de palme) et à participer au payement des factures d'électricité. Son objectif est de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille tout en renforçant son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
Marguerite D. is a 39-year old woman, married and the mother of five children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of the association of Catholic Women of Tambacounda since June 27, 2008, the launching date of that Banc Villageois branch. In the past two years, she obtained loans four times and always repaid them without any issues. Her line of business is selling lemon juice and palm oil; in addition, she owns a refrigerator and makes ice for sale in her neighborhood. Her loan will allow her to stock up her goods (lemon juice and palm oil) and help pay electricity bills. Her goal is to help improve the life conditions of her family while boosting her savings.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthening and promoting her business

loans.name: Xequemeya Group

texts.es: La señora Feliza González M., es casada cuenta con 2 hijas y 4 hijos  ellas se dedica a la venta de papas fritas, en el centro de San Francisco el Alto, Totonicapán, y también cuenta con la ayuda  de su esposo, el se dedica al servicios, como ayudante de albañil, doña feliza compra su mercadería, y también se dedica a la crianza de animales domésticos como ganando vacuno, bovino y porcino, y lo vende en el centro de momostenango, los días  de plaza como lo es domingo y miércoles, es la coordinadora de este grupo de señoras,  del Caserío Jutacaj,  Aldea Xequemeya, Momostenango del  departamento de  Totonicapán, son personas que trabajan, desde hace 8 años, han decidido ampliar su capital de trabajo , por lo que se acercaron a las oficinas de la asociación ASDIR de Pologuá,  para poderles financiar su actividad económica y así poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Feliza González M. is married and has 2 daughters and 4 sons. She sells french fries in the center of San Francisco el Alto, Totonicapán with the help of her husband. He is an assistant bricklayer. Feliza buys her supplies in the center of Momostenago on the market days of Sunday and Wednesday, and also raises domestic animals such as cattle, cows and pigs, and sells them there. She is the coordinator of this group of women from the Jutacah farming village, Xequemeya, Momostengango in the Totonicapán Department. They are women who have been working for the last 8 years, and have decided to increase their working capital. That is the reason why they went to the ASDIR of Pologuá offices- to help finance their work and thus improve the quality of their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Dios Proveera 1 Group

texts.en:
Fior is the coordinator of her group, Dios Proveera (God Will Provide), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Fior’s group is located in the lush rugged Samana peninsula, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure with her longterm partner and their two children.

Fior is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza and she is excited to invest in her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling underwear by adding a jewelry element to it. With this loan she will purchase the jewelry that she plans to sell. She will use the profits to invest in school supplies and medicine for her children.

loans.use: To buy silver jewelry to sell

loans.name: Las Originales Group

texts.es:
Las Originales grupo conformado por Juana O., Darling S. y Deyanira Hernández tres mujeres esforzadas, emprendedoras y luchadoras. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora O. comerciante de calzado. Ella inicio el negocio con este negocio hace siete años junto con su esposo quien se encarga de la producción mientras ella los distribuye en la zona franca.
La meta de O. es ampliar su negocio en especial por las ventas de agosto y llegar a tener su propia tienda.
Las otras dos integrantes del grupo son Darling S. quien desde hace más de tres años vende cosméticos Avon, marca de gran prestigio en Nicaragua y Deyanira Hernández tiene un pequeño taller de costura donde invertirá en telas e hilos.
texts.en:
The Originales group is comprised of Juana O., Darling S., and Deyanira Hernández. These three women are hard-working, enterprising, and tenacious. The coordinator of the group, Mrs. O., is a shoe merchant. She started the business with her husband seven years ago. He is in charge of production while she distributes the shoes in the “Zona Franca” (a governmental organization that regulates exportation from Nicaragua). Mrs. O.’s goal is to expand her business, especially for the August sales. She also wants to have her own store. Darling S., a member of the group, has been selling Avon cosmetics for over three years. This brand is very prestigious in Nicaragua. Dayanira Hernández, the other group member, has a small seamstress shop. She will buy fabric and thread.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Footwear

loans.name: Jehova Es Mi Pastor  2 Group

texts.en:
Juana is the coordinator of her group, Jehova es mi Pastor 2 (God is my pastor), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Juana’s group is located in Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production, and the second biggest city in Dominican Republic, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure with her two children.

Juana is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in cosmetics, laundry and beauty products like shampoo, conditioner, body cream, soaps, detergents, etc.

Juana will use the profits to reinvest in her business and, through the loan's benefits, give her family a better life, like getting her own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics, laundry and beauty products

loans.name: Maria Targelia

texts.es:
La Señora. María M. es socia del banco comunal El Paraíso  hace dos ciclos, vive en la parroquia de Cumbe la cual es conocida  por sus bellos paisajes, su gente calida y también por su producción agrícola y ganadera.

Nuestra socia se dedica a la cría de chanchos, no puede realizar ninguna actividad mas debido a que sufre de artritis crónica la misma que le esta deformando sus huesos, pero esta muy contenta ya que gracias a su trabajo a salido adelante.

La Señora. María tiene 46 años de edad, es viuda hace 17 años, tiene 2 hijas de 26 y 25 años de edad, son casadas y viven independientemente con sus familias.Nuestra socia vive en una pequeña casita de tablas y solo una hija le ayuda económicamente

Los créditos le han beneficiado mucho para el alimento de sus chanchos y ahora su nuevo crédito que realiza en la fundación Espoir lo va a invertir en la compra de un chanchito mas y su alimento, su meta es  seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
María M. has been a member of the El Paraíso (The Paradise) Communal Bank for two cycles. She lives in the Cumbe parrish. It is known for its beautiful scenery, the warmth of its inhabitants, and its farming and livestock production. Our member raises pigs. She cannot do any other activity because she suffers from chronic arthritis. The arthritis is deforming her bones. However, she is very happy because, thanks to her work, she has gotten ahead. María is 46 years old, and she has been a widow for 17 years. She has two daughters, 26 and 25 years old. They are married and live independently with their families. Our member lives in a small house made of boards, and only one daughter helps her economically. The loans have helped her a great deal to feed her pigs. Now, with her new loan from the Espoir foundation, she will buy one more small pig and feed for the pig. Her goal is to keep growing in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a pig and feed for the pig

loans.name: Grettel

texts.es:
Grettel V. M.   es una  joven de 28  años de edad quien vive con su esposo y 2 hijos en una comunidad llamada El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, Provincia de Cartago.  Es una pequeña comunidad rural de aproximadamente dos mil habitantes. Sus pobladores se dedican a la producción de leche y siembra de café. Tiene un relieve irregular y mucho del terreno se mantiene como bosque tropical húmedo. La comunidad tiene paisajes muy pintorescos que combinan el bosque tropical con dos lindas lagunas, plantaciones de café y lecherías.
Desde hace muy poco tiempo doña Grettel  ha querido desarrollarse como microempresaria, con un pequeño proyecto dedicado a la  producción de leche y algunos derivados, tales como natilla y queso. 
Dice estar muy agradecida con este proyecto, ya que le ha generado una mayor confianza, ha servido como una fuente de ingresos para mejorar sus condiciones a pesar de las dificultades económicas que hay en la región 
Actualmente Grettel  requiere un préstamo de ¢500,000 (quinientos mil colones) destinados a la  compra de una vaca lechera. Esto le permitirá aumentar la producción de leche y por ende la de sus productos los cuales aseguran ser muy demandados en la comunidad ya que son de muy buena calidad.
Doña Grettel es socia de la Asociación de Productores de El Sauce, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo  préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico.
texts.en:
Grettel V. M. is a 28-year old young woman who lives with her husband and two children in a community called El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, in the the province of Cartago. It is a small rural community with a population of approximately 2,000. The local people are milk and coffee producers. The area is hilly and much of the land is tropical rainforest. It’s very attractive with two lovely lakes, coffee plantations, and dairies mixed in with the rainforest. In the last little while Grettel has wanted to develop her small dairy business with a project involving milk products such as cream and cheese. She says that she is very pleased with the business because it's built her confidence and served as a source of income for improving her life despite the problems that the community faces. Currently Grettel needs a loan of 500,000 colones with which to buy a cow. This will enable her to increase milk production and other dairy products which are sure to be in great demand in the community since they are of high quality. Sra. Grettel is a member of the Producers’ Association of El Sauce, one of the hundred member organisations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her second loan and she hopes that it will enable her to continue developing both on a personal and on an economic level.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Jehova Es Mi Pastor 4 Group

texts.en:
Milady is the coordinator of her group Jehova es mi Pastor 4 (God is my Pastor 4). Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti, generally. Her group is located in Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production and the second biggest city in Dominican Republic, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with a child.

Milady is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business stand by buying vegetables and fruits. She will use the profits to expand the business and get her own house to live comfortably. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Vegetables, fruits and other items

loans.name: Rebeca Group

texts.es:
El grupo Rebeca está conformado por tres féminas trabajadoras una de ellas es Rebeca Rosalina Lezama E., coordinadora del grupo quien inicio hace ocho años con vendiendo  frijoles cocidos hoy en día por medio de los préstamos comercializa hueso, ropa y calzado. Ella es una mujer fuerte, emprendedora y luchadora quien es madre y padre de un joven de 26 quien tiene problemas motores y es su razón de ser y un pequeño quien es como otro hijo.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son  María del Carmen S. U. la cual hace más de 15 años se dedica al comercio de ropa y tortillas, en la actualidad ella desea invertir en el destace de chancho negocio muy fructífero ya que además de vender la carne puede producir  nacatamales, frito, moronga, chicharrón etc. e  Ileana Chevez desde hace nueve años vende zapatos, frutas y sopas de hueso, queso, mondongo, de cola etc.
texts.en:
The Rebeca group is comprised of three hard-working women. One of them is Rebeca Rosalina Lezama E., the coordinator of the group. Eight years ago she started selling cooked beans. Now, with the loans, she sells bones, clothes, and footwear. She is a strong, enterprising, and tenacious woman. She is mother and father to a 26 year old young man and a little one who is like another son. The 26 year old has motor problems; he is her reason for living. María del Carmen S. U., a member of the group, has been selling clothes and tortillas for over 15 years. Now she wants to invest in the very fruitful business of butchering pigs. In addition to selling the meat, she can make "nacatamales" (a traditional Central American dish similar to a tamale), fried pork, blood sausage, and "chicharrones" (pork rinds), etc. Ileana Chevez, the other group member, has been selling shoes, fruit, bone soup, cheese, blood sausage, tripe, and cola, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beans, bones, clothes, and footwear

loans.name: Diana Marisol

texts.es:
La Sra. Diana L. es socia del banco comunal  El Paraíso, vive en la parroquia de Cumbe conocida por su gente que es muy calida y amable a pesar de que su clima es frió su gente se dedica a la agricultura  y ganadería, muchos de su población joven han viajado a distintas partes del mundo para mejorar le economía de sus hogares.

La Señora Diana tiene 25 años de edad es madre soltera y tiene un hijo de 6 años que estudia en una escuelita de la comunidad, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus padres la misma que es propia.

Nuestras socia se dedica a la cría de animales como: vacas, pollos, cuyes los mismos que los vende en su comunidad. Es nuestra socia hace 3 años y fue gracias a una ex compañera del bankito quien la invito a que ingrese; su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para seguir creciendo en su negocio.

Su meta es de viajar a España.
texts.en:
Diana L. is a member of the Paraíso (Paradise) Communal bank. She lives in the Cumbe parrish. It is known for its very warm and friendly people in spite of the cold climate. The people work in agriculture and livestock. Much of the younger population has traveled to places that are far away in order to improve their household economies. Diana, age 25, is the single mother of a six year old. He goes to the community school. She does not have her own house. She lives in her parents’ house, which is their own. Our member raises animals like cows, chickens, and guinea pigs. She sells them in her community. She has been a member for three years. This is thanks to a former bank colleague who invited her to join. She will use the new loan to buy chickens in order to continue growing in her business. Her goal is to travel to Spain.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chickens

loans.name: Genesis 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Yaina is the coordinator of her group Genesis. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti, generally. Her group is located in the slums north of S. Domingo, where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their two children.

Yaina is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business of selling used clothing by purchasing a large package of assorted used clothing that comes from places like the Salvation Army in the U.S. She will use the profits to invest in saving toward the future of her children.

loans.use: A large package of used clothing

loans.name: Genesis Group

texts.es:
El grupo Génesis está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Juana del Rosario R. quien tiene una pequeña fritanga, restaurante popular que consiste en comidas fritas como tajadas con queso, carne asada (gallo pinto, tajadas, ensalada de repollo y carne), pollo asado o frito, tacos, enchiladas…etc. El negocio lo inicio hace 20 años con el cual sus apoyo a sus seis hijos y sigue apoyando a los menores de 20, 18, 17 y 15 años respectivamente quienes colaboran en la fritanga.

R. piensa invertir una parte del préstamo en materia prima para el negocio y otra para comprar cosméticos. El sueño de ella es trabajar con su propio capital para ello trabajara arduamente.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Ángela Rosa R. quien vende tortillas, frijoles, cuajadita y nacatamales desde hace siete años y Juan Manuel F. T. quien se dedica al comercio de corte, perfumes y productos de aseo personal.
texts.en:
The Génesis group is comprised of three hard-working people. Juana del Rosario R. is one of them. She has a small “fritanga”. This is a popular restaurant, which sells fried food like plantain chips with cheese, roasted meat, (“gallos pinto”; which is rice and beans, plantain chips, cabbage salad, and meat) roasted or fried chicken, tacos, and enchiladas, etc. She stared the business 20 years ago. She supported her six children with the business. She continues supporting the younger ones, ages 20, 18, 17, and 15. They help in the fritanga. R. is planning on using part of the loan to buy raw material for her business. She will use the other part to buy cosmetics. Her dream is to work with her own money, and she is working arduously to do so. Ángela Rosa R.; a member of the group; has been selling tortillas, beans, cheese, and nactatamales (a traditional Central American dish similar to tamales) for seven years. The other member, Juan Manuel F. Tiberino, cuts hair and sells perfume and personal hygiene products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Basic grains, oil, bananas, cabbage, and meat, etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María C. Sánchez  es una  señora de 35  años de edad quien vive con su esposo en una comunidad llamada El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, Provincia de Cartago.  Es una pequeña comunidad rural de aproximadamente dos mil habitantes. Sus pobladores se dedican a la producción de leche y siembra de café. Tiene un relieve irregular y mucho del terreno se mantiene como bosque tropical húmedo. La comunidad tiene paisajes muy pintorescos que combinan el bosque tropical con dos lindas lagunas, plantaciones de café y lecherías.
Desde hace muy poco tiempo doña María  ha querido desarrollarse como microempresaria, con un pequeño proyecto dedicado a la  producción de leche y algunos derivados, tales como natilla y queso. Ella vive  con su esposo, quien ha sido su mayor impulso y ayuda, asegura que entre los 2 van poder mejorar sus condiciones económicas para poder tener su primer hijo.
Dice estar muy agradecida con este proyecto, ya que le ha generado una mayor confianza, ha servido como una fuente de ingresos para mejorar sus condiciones a pesar de las dificultades económicas que hay en la región 
Actualmente María  requiere un préstamo de ¢500,000 (quinientos mil colones) destinados a la  compra de una vaca lechera. Esto le permitirá aumentar la producción de leche y por ende la de sus productos los cuales aseguran ser muy demandados en la comunidad ya que son de muy buena calidad.
Doña María  es socia de la Asociación de Productores de El Sauce, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su Primer  préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico. Y
texts.en:
35-year old María C. Sánchez lives with her husband in a community called El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, in the the province of Cartago. It is a small rural community with a population of approximately 2,000. The local people are dairy and coffee farmers. The area is hilly and much of the land is tropical rainforest. It’s very attractive with two lovely lakes, coffee plantations, and dairies mixed in with the rainforest. In the last little while María has wanted to develop her small dairy business with a project involving milk products such as cream and cheese. Her husband has been a big support and help, and María is certain that between them they can improve their financial situation and start a family. Currently María needs a loan of 500,000 colones with which to buy a cow. This will enable her to increase milk production and other dairy products which are sure to be in great demand in the community since they are of high quality. She is a member of the Producers’ Association of El Sauce, one of the hundred member organisations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan and she hopes that it will enable her to continue developing both on a personal and on an economic level.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Monica Mariela

texts.es:
La Señora Mónica A. es socia del banco comunal El Paraíso, vive en la parroquia de Cumbe conocida por su gente que es muy calida y amable a pesar de que su clima es muy frió, su gente se dedica a la agricultura  y ganadería mucha de su población joven a viajado a distintas partes del mundo para mejorar la economía de sus  hogares.

Nuestra socia tiene 25 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo de 5 años, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus padres y ayuda en la economía del hogar, también recibe apoyo económico por parte del padre de su hijo.

La Señora Mónica se dedica  a los quehaceres de la casa, también cría cuyes y los vende en su parroquia cuando tiene alguna necesidad.

Es nuestra socia hace 4 años y los créditos le han beneficiado para empezar con su negocio, la presidenta del banco comunal fue quien la invito a formar parte de este grupo de mujeres luchadoras. Su nuevo crédito que realiza en la fundación Espoir lo va a invertir en la compra de más cuyes y así ir creciendo con su negocio.

Su meta es llegar a tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Señora Mónica A. is a member of the El Paraíso (Paradise) Community Bank. She lives in the parish of Cumbe where the people are very warm and friendly despite the very cold climate. The local people work in agriculture and animal husbandry although many of the young folk have travelled to distant lands to get work and improve the financial situation of their families. Mónica is 25 years old, a single mother, and has a 5-year old son. She doesn’t have a house of her own so she lives in her parents’ house and contributes to household expenses. She also receives financial assistance from the father of her child. Mónica takes care of the household and also raises guinea pigs which she sells in the parish when she needs the money. She’s been a member of the group for four years, and she has used loans to start her business. It was the president of the bank who invited her to become a member of this group of hardworking women. Mónica will use this new loan with Kiva partner Espoir to buy more guinea pigs and in this way expand her business. Her goal is to have a house of her own.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs

loans.name: María Bertha

texts.es: María Bertha C. es una mujeres trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora de 45 años. Ella en el 2005 inicio con el comercio de ropa y luego instalo una pequeña venta la cual inicio con el comercio de chiverías. Hoy en día ambos negocios se encuentran bien surtidos en el caso de la venta tiene desde granos básicos, carne, refrescos, productos lácteos etc.
texts.en:
45-year old María Bertha C. is a hardworking, enterprising woman who puts a great deal of effort into all that she does. In 2005 she began selling clothing and then started her own stall selling snacks. Today both businesses are doing well, and she also sells basic grains, meat, soft drinks, and milk products etc. from her stall.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing and basic grains

loans.name: Unidas Para Triunfar 5 Group

texts.en:
Fany is the coordinator of her group Unidas para Triunfar 5 (Unite to Triumph). Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti, generally. Her group is located in Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production. It's the second biggest city in Dominican Republic, where running water, none of which is potable, and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner.

Fany is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza. She will expand her jewelry business into different neighborhoods and take the jewelry into town to customers at their jobs. She plans to use this loan to invest in silver jewelry, like rings, necklaces, bracelets, etc.  She will save the profits to open a beauty salon with her next loans. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Rings, necklaces, bracelets and silver jewelry

loans.name: Emmanuel 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Soribel is the coordinator of her group 'Emmanuel', and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally--many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo, an area where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their two children.

Soribel is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza  after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling clothing and shoes by purchasing underwear, bras, high-heeled shoes, men's shoes and boxers for men to sell. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Underwear, bras, high-heeled shoes, men's shoes and boxers for men

loans.name: Carla Patricia

texts.es:
Carla Patricia Martínez Vaca es una fémina esforzada, luchadora y emprendedora de 24 años quien tiene un pequeño bar y tragamonedas desde hace seis años. Ella invertirá el crédito en su negocio para que mejore y en ropa interior para diversificar sus ingresos. 

Martínez sueña con tener su propio local ya que por no contar con este el negocio lo atenido que trasladar de lugar varias veces.
texts.en:
Carla Patricia Martínez Vaca is a hard-working, tenacious, and enterprising 24 year old woman. She has had a small bar and slot machine for six years. She will use the money to improve her business. She will also buy underwear to diversify her income. Martínez dreams of having her own place. Not having her own place means that she has to move her business several times.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Drinks and underwear

loans.name: Genesis 1 Group

texts.en:
Romula is the coordinator of her group Genesis 1, and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally--many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production, the second biggest city in Dominican Republic, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and 5 children.

Romula is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza  after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business, a small cafeteria where she sells baked goods, ice cream, juice and other snacks. She will use the profits to improve her home and business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: baked goods, Ice cream, juice, etc.

loans.name: Angele

texts.fr: Angèle B. est une femme de 23 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois des Femmes Catholiques de Tambacounda dont elle fait parti du Comité de Gestion depuis le début en 2008. Elle développe un petit commerce de jus de citron, d'huile de palme et de fruits de mère telles les crevettes. Son prêt lui permettra de mieux s'approvisionner en marchandises (huile de palme, jus de citron et crevettes). Son objectif est de prendre ses besoins personnels en charge, de soutenir son mari dans les différentes charges familiales.
texts.en:
Angèle B. is a 23-year old woman, married and the mother of three dhicldren. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of the association of Catholic Women of Tambacounda and a member of its Management Committee since the Banc’s inception in 2008. Her line of business is selling lemon juice, palm oil and seafood, for example, shrimp. Her loan will allow her to increase her stock of goods (palm oil, lemon juice and shrimp). Her goal is to take care of her personal needs and to support her husband in providing for the various family expenses.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthening and promoting her business

loans.name: Mujeres Esforzadas 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Damiana is the coordinator of her group 'Mujeres Esforzadas' (Forceful Women), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally--many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the slums north of Santo Domingo, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and six children.

Damiana is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling cakes by buying the necessary ingredients. She will use the profits to build a second room for her children as well as to save for their education. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: A sack of sugar, a sack of flour, flavoring, and eggs

loans.name: Marlys Nayibe

texts.es: Marly C. está buscando la forma de disminuir los costos de sus materias primas y encontró un proveedor que le ofrece unos buenos precio, para  poder elaborar las comidas rápidas, como tortas, papas y arepas que vende. Negocio en el que le va muy bien y el que  aprendió cuando desde su niñez, cuando  su papa quedó sin trabajo y vio a su madre realizarlo para poder sufragar los gastos del hogar, especialmente su estudio y el de sus hermanos.  Cuando crecieron ayudaron a su padre y ella a la vez terminó  su  bachillerato y comenzó a estudiar auxiliar de  enfermería, actividad  que le sirvió para trabajar en una empresa, pero cuando  se quedó sin empleo, inició el negocio que ya conocía: “la venta de comidas rápidas”, negocio le da para hacerse cargo de si misma, de sus propias obligaciones y para  ayudar a sus padres y hermanos, por eso   Marlys siempre está pensando en  ampliarlo para salir todos adelante. Mediante todo este tiempo ella  ha recibido dos créditos con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con ellos ha logrado hacer su historia crediticia, porque antes no tenía ninguna financiación y esto le ha ayudado a mejorar su servico. Su meta mas adelante es ampliar su negocio tener su casa propia y ayudar a sus padres a construir su segunda planta  y culminar su carrera profesional. Marly piensa  que actualmente hay pocas oportunidades para desarrollarse profesionalmente, por eso ha acudido a una actividad que le ayuda a sostenerse y así se siente tranquila como mujer emprendedora.
texts.en:
Marly C. is looking for the way to decrease the cost of her raw materials and she found a supplier who is offering her a good price. She makes fast food, such as sandwiches, potatoes and cornmeal rolls that she sells. This business is going very well for her.
