She learned it as a child when her father lost his job and her mother began to do it to pay for the household expenses, especially her siblings' schooling. When they grew up, they helped her father and she finished high school and began to study to be nursing assistant. This activity served for her to work in a business, but when she lost her job, she began her business since she already knew about, "selling fast food". This business lets her take care of herself, of her responsibilities and to help her parents and siblings. That is why Marlys is always planning on growing it to get everybody ahead. During this whole time she has recieved two loans from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and with them she has been able to establish her credit history. Previously, she didn't have any financing and this has allowed her to improve her service. Her goal for the future is to expand her business, have her own home, help her parents build a second floor and finish her professional studies. Marly thinks that at this time there are few opportunities to develop professionally and that is why she has taken up an activity that helps her support herself and feel at ease as an enterprising woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials wholesale such as eggs and flour.

loans.name: Huaycheñitas Group

texts.es:
En el Centro Focal German Busch se reúne la Asociación Comunal Huaycheñitas,es un grupo de 8 personas estusiastas y alegres.

La presidenta es Francisca de 34 años tiene el negocio de venta de comida, el cual emprendió por iniciativa propia hace 4 años aproximadamente. Francisca vende en la Ceja de la ciudad de El Alto todos los días  de 9 de la mañana a 3 de la tarde. Con los ingresos que se genera puede cubrir las necesitades básicas de sus 5 hijos. Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos como arroz, fideo y papa.

Las demás integrantes de este grupo tienen diferentes negocios que se dedican a la producción, servicio y comercio.
texts.en:
The Huaycheñitas Communal Bank meets at the German Busch branch office. It is a group of eight enthusiastic, cheerful people. The group president is Francisca, who is 34 years old and has had a business selling meals for the past four years. She launched the business on her own initiative. Francisca works in La Ceja neighborhood of the city of El Alto each day from 9am to 3pm. She uses the income from her business to pay for the basic needs of her five children. She needs this loan to buy ingredients like rice, noodles and potatoes. The other group members have different businesses in the production, service and commerce sectors.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Staff

loans.use: Compra de insumos

loans.name: Gloria Vilma

texts.es: Gloria Vilma Cuá T. cuenta con 20  años de edad,  Casada, con un hijo, actualmente se dedica a la artesanía “Elaboración de cortes típicos” ya que también aparte de que elabora cortes, también elabora servilletas Típicas , se acerco a la Asociación ASDIR  por un préstamo,  debido a la falta de capital de su negocio, ya que no cuenta con el efectivo necesario para cubrir la demanda, ya que solo ella no puede cubrir la demanda de sus clientes en su actividad por las misma razón necesita de más capital  para  su negocio, como también poder seguir mejorando sus fuentes de ingresos y poder darle a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Gloria Vilma Cuá T. is 20 years old and married with one son. Currently, she works as an artisan making traditional fabric. The fabrics she makes are very distinctive. She also makes traditional table napkins. She approached Asociación ASDIR for a loan due to her business’ lack of capital. She doesn’t have the cash necessary to meet the demand for her products and, as a result, cannot meet her customers’ requests. This is why she needs more capital for her business. She also wants to continue improving the source of her income in order to give her family a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Juana Julia

texts.es: La señora Juana Julia V. O. tiene 28 años de edad, Casada, se dedica a la Artesanía “elaboración de delantales Típicas”, también cuenta con una tienda de consumo diario, su tienda se encuentra en un sitio muy reconocido, por la misma razón es que necesita más capital para poder ampliar su tienda y tener todos los artículos que sus clientes demandan, se decidió efectuar un préstamo para poder comprar más productos para la tienda, esto con el proposito de contribuir con sus vecinos al ofecerles diferentes articulos  de consumo diario al alcance de su hogar y tambien mejorar sus ganacias, como también mejorar su condición de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana Julia is 28 years old, married, and presently dedicated to artisan crafts, making traditional aprons. She also has a store that sells all types of snacks. She has approached the ASDIR association for a small loan to be able to purchase more products for her store. Juana notes that the store is situated in a very recognized location. And she also needs more capital to be able to expand the store. With this small assistance, she could improve its utility, as well as bettering the condition of life for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de mas producto para su tienda

loans.name: Dina Luz

texts.es:
Dina Luz Pérez vive en el barrio Ciudadela Metropolitana, Municipio de Soledad muy cerca a Barranquilla; como Dina Luz  tiene a su cargo sus dos hijos de 4 y 10 años, trabaja muy duro para sostenerlos con su negocio de vender mercancías variadas,  como colonias, calzado clásico y deportivo, suéteres y relojes. Ella vende su mercancía a crédito y se la pagan de acuerdo al plan de pago acordado con sus clientes, entre los que se encuentran vecinos, familiares, amigos,  pero ella elige como sus clientes, principalmente a gente que tenga un ingreso y pueda responderle pagándole la mercancía que ella le acredita.

Este es su tercer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y lo invertirá en la compra de calzado, ropa deportiva, camisas para hombres y perfumes que tiene encargados por parte de clientes referidos. Está muy  satisfecha de que el negocio sirva para sostener su núcleo familiar y por eso ella se esfuerza para hacerlo crecer y brindarle a sus dos pequeños las mejores oportunidades que ella pueda; esa fue justamente  la razón por la cual,  lo inició y le ha dado un buen resultado, porque sus ingresos gradualmente han aumentado y   mas adelante tiene como meta   adquirir su propia vivienda y para eso Dina Luz se prepara día a día.
texts.en:
Dina Luz Pérez lives in the Ciudadela Metropolitana neighborhood of the Municipality of Soledad, very close to Barranquilla. Because Dina Luz has two young children in her care, aged 4 and 10, she works very hard to support them with her business of selling assorted merchandise such as cologne, traditional and athletic shoes, sweaters and watches. She sells her merchandise on credit, and her customers follow an agreed-upon payment plan. Her customers include neighbors, family members and friends, but she principally seeks out clients who have a steady income and are able to make the payments for the merchandise she sells them on credit. This is her third loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, and she will invest it in buying shoes, sports clothing, men's shirts and perfumes, which have been ordered by customers referred to her. She is very satisfied with the way her business allows her to support her nuclear family, and for this reason she is working hard to make it grow, in order to provide her two little ones with the best opportunities she can. This is precisely the reason why she started the business, and it has given her good results, because her income has gradually been increasing. Her goal for the future is to acquire her own home, and Dina Luz is preparing for this day by day.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying shoes, sports clothing, men's shirts and perfumes ordered by customers

loans.name: Jairo Antonio

texts.es: Jairo Mogollón Narváez, es el propietario del negocio “Súper Tiendas 3 Jotas” ubicado en la ciudad de Bogotá, la capital de Colombia, donde vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 14 y 24 años de edad. Su negocio es una especie de supermercado donde vende víveres, ranchos licores, drogas, aseo, artículos de miscelánea y  minutos a celulares; este negocio tiene 14 años de estar ubicado en el mismo sitio, lo que indica que se encuentra muy bien posicionado, por eso quiere seguir surgiendo con él y adicionarle una panadería y cafetería mas adelante, que es justamente su desafío. Este es su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y está solicitando $2.000.000  COP, para surtirlo con abarrotes, ranchos y víveres, comprando en un mayor volumen, para que su utilidad se vea aumentada gradualmente con la venta de sus productos, que   rotan diariamente entre amas de casa y familias  que viven en el sector, especialmente en el conjunto residencial donde se encuentra ubicado y donde están sus principales compradores
texts.en:
Jairo Mogollón Narváez is the proprietor of the business “Súper Tiendas 3 Jotas” located in the city of Bogota, the capital of Colombia. He lives in Bogota with his wife and two children ages fourteen and twenty-four. His business is a type of supermarket where he sells groceries, licour, drugs, cleaning products, miscellaneous items, and cell phone minutes. This business has been in the same location for fourteen years, which indicates that he has a good location. This is why he wants to continue there and in the future add a bakery and a cafe, which is exactly what his challenge is. This is his first loan with "Fundación Mario Santo Domingo" and he is asking for $2,000.000 COP to stock his business with groceries, rations and provisions, buying them in bulk, so he can gradually see an increase in sales of his products. He sells to housewives and families who live in the area, especially in the residential area he is located in and where his main customers are.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock with groceries, rations, and provisions in greater volume.

loans.name: Freddy Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Freddy Antonio C. L., tiene 37 años de edad, habita acompañado por su pareja de vida, la cual es panadera y con sus ingresos apoya a la economía del hogar, tienen 2 hijos menores de edad, que estudia la escuela primaria.

Ellos tienen una panadería desde hace 16 años, el alza de precios continua de la materia prima principal, debido al aumento del combustible que les ha ocasionado inestabilidades económicas, detieniendo el crecimiento de su negocio y por ende el desequilibrio de su economía domestica, fue con el esfuerzo de la cabeza del hogar que lograron la apertura del negocio, a futuro pretenden realizar una elaboración del productos a nivel industrial, no una venta estilo cafetería personalizada, esperan llegar a tener los recursos necesarios para incursionar de esa forma en el mercado nacional, por ahora solicita de un préstamo para la compra de  materia prima que aumente sus ventas y brinde capital necesario para llevar a cabo algunos planes que se tiene trazados para la mejora continua de sus niveles de vida de todos los miembros de la familia.
texts.en:
37-year old Sr. Freddy Antonio C. L. lives with his wife. She is a baker, and the money she earns helps with household finances. They have two young children who attend primary school. They have had the bakery for 16 years. The increase in prices for ingredients is continuing because of the rise in the cost of gasoline, and this has led to economic instability for the family and slowed down the growth of their business. The business was started through Freddy’s efforts as the head of the household. In the future they hope to make much larger quantities of their products and sell them to many more customers, and thus move away from being simply a bakery for local people. They hope to obtain the resources necessary to enter the nationwide market, and for this reason Freddy is asking for a loan to buy ingredients so he can increase sales and get the capital he needs to realize his plans to continue improving the standard of living of his whole family.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy baking ingredients

loans.name: Magda Ivania

texts.es:
La señora Magda Ivania S., es una adulta mayor de 65 años soltera con un hijo mayor de edad con capacidades especiales, ella se dedica a elaborar Manualidades, desde hace 8 años se ha convertido en su fuente de ingresos.

Fue con el dinero de su jubilación que comenzó su pequeño negocio, ha tenido problemas de cancelación de las ordenes de trabajo que ha realizado, este ha sido un problema para ella debido a que no ha podido recuperar lo invertido en su negocio razón por la cual le a obstaculizado el crecimiento de su negocio, a futuro comprara una vitrina donde las elaboraciones se aprecien mas, con este préstamo adquirirá  una mayor variedad de materiales que le permitan aumentar sus elaboraciones y le aumente sus ventas para el mejor beneficio de su economía y la de su hijo que le demanda muchos gastos y atenciones debido a su condición especial.
texts.en:
Magda Ivania S., 65, is an older adult. She has an adult, special needs son. She makes handicrafts and this has been her source of income for the past 8 years. She used her retirement funds to start her small business but she has had problems with the cancelation of orders for work she has completed; this has been a problem for her because she has been unable to recuperate the investment she put into her business. This has been an obstacle to growth. In the future she’d like to buy a display case where her creations will show more favorably. She will use this loan to buy a greater assortment of materials to increase her production thereby increasing sales so that she and her son’s economy will improve because his special circumstances create many expenses and needs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials.

loans.name: Ligia Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Ligia del Socorro B. G., tiene la edad de 41 años habita en el Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla, habita acompañado por su pareja de vida, ellos tiene 2 hijos, el cual uno de ellos estudia la universidad, y apoya a sus padres en el negocio, la familia se dedica al comercio desde hace ya 7 años que este ha sido su fuente de sustento.

Fue con el apoyo de su esposo que se emprendió en esta actividad de oferta de mercaderia en general para uso personal, a futuro espera instalar un tramo de venta en el marcado de Masaya, pero por ahora solicita un préstamo para la compra de un mayor inventario de mercadería que le permita aumentar las ventas y por ende los ingresos, y de esta manera gozar  con el capital necesario para futuras fuentes de ingresos que traiga beneficios económico-sociales a la familia, sobre todo que su humilde hogar necesita de remodelaciones que beneficien a su diario vivir.
texts.en:
Ligia del Socorro B. G., 41, lives in Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla with her life partner. They have two children. One of them is in college and helps the parents with the business. The family’s source of support for the last 7 years has been commerce. She started her general personal use merchandise sales business with help from her husband. In the future, she’d like to set up a sales stall in Masaya’s market. For now, she is asking for funding to buy a larger amount of stock merchandise that will allow her to increase sales thereby leading to higher income that will bring socio-economic benefits to the entire family especially because their humble home needs improvements that will make daily living better.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Juana Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Juana Mercedes A. P., tiene la edad de 55 años vive en el barrio la Borgoña, tiene 3 hijos y es madre soltera, todos sus hijos son mayores de edad, trabajan y viven de forma independiente, así mismo apoyan a su madre en los gastos y actividades en su hogar, ella es una mujer muy humilde que realiza trabajos domésticos en casas privadas, tiene alrededor de 15 años de ganarse de esta manera el sustento diarios de toda su familia.

Con el apoyo económico de sus hijos es que logró componer su habitación personal, a futuro espera tener los recursos necesarios para remodelar en su totalidad su hogar, por ahora solicita de un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción que le permitan terminar de componer el patio trasero de su hogar, es importante señalar que esta inversión les traerá un beneficio a toda la familia a habitar en un ambiente más salubre, seguro y cómodo.
texts.en:
Juana Mercedes Aguirre P., 55, lives in the La Borgoña neighborhood. She is a single mother who has 3 adult children who are working and living independently. They help out their mother with the household expenses and activities. She is a very unassuming woman who works as a domestic in private residences. She has been doing this work for about 15 years, and it has allowed her to support herself and her family. With the economic support of her children she managed to fix up her own personal living space. In the future she hopes to have the resources necessary to renovate her whole home, but for now she requests a loan to buy construction materials that will permit her to finish repairing the patio at the back of her home. It is important to note that this investment will bring a benefit to the whole family, so that they can live in an environment that is healthier, secure and comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to repair a patio at the back of her home

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
Mrs. Phat K., age 45, lives in Chheal Phlouh village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice for a living. Her husband, Mr. Suy Meas, breeds ducks for their eggs. 

In order to support her farm and her husband's duck breeding endeavors, Mrs. Phat K. has decided to ask for a loan in order to buy duck food and to buy fertilizer to support her farming crop. 

This couple has three children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory and the younger two are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy duck food and farming fertilizer

loans.name: Yi

texts.en:
Mr. Yi U., age 51, lives in Choes village in Takeo province. He and his wife, Mrs. Sorng Bou, are farmers who own a hectare of land to cultivate rice for a living. Aside from farming, Mr. Yi U. has a sugar palm house business. 

In order to increase their income to improve the family living, Mr. Yi U. has decided to ask for a loan in order to buy a cow for breeding. 

This couple has four children: one is a construction worker, two are seamstresses in the garment factory, and the youngest is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Mrs. Srey N., 56, who lives in Srae Kaes village in Takeo Province, is a farmer who owns 2.50-hectares of land upon which she cultivates rice for a living. In order to support this farm, Mrs. Srey N. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay for a laborer to plow her farm. Her husband, Mr. Phan Nol, shown with her in the photo, is an electronics repairman (video player, radio, television, etc) earning a small income to support his family. This couple has two children, both students, who also support their mother's farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay for a laborer to plow her farm

loans.name: Soban

texts.en:
Mrs. Soban U. is 37 years old and a villager who lives in Tonloab village in the Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 3 hectares of land in which to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Sosean Var, is a rice-wine maker at home and is able to earn a small income to support his family. 

In order to increase income to improve the family's living conditions, Mrs. Soban U. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets for breeding and with the rest of the loan, she wants to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her farming crop. 

This couple has three children who are students in the local school and also support their parents' businesses.

loans.use: To buy piglets for breeding

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Mrs. Touch E. is 49 years old and lives in Tonloab Village in Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. Ny Norn, are farmers who own 4-hectares (~ 10 acres) of land on which they grow rice for a living. 

Mrs. Touch E. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farm and to pay to rent a plowing machine. Aside from farming, Mr. Ny Norn works as a farm laborer so he can earn a small income to support his family. This couple has a child who is a student. 

Mrs. E.'s husband appears in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide and to rent a plowing machine

loans.name: Puthrea

texts.en:
Mr. Puthrea B. is a 24-year-old married man who lives in Chheal Phlouh Village in Takeo Province. He is a battery charger in the local village and is able to earn a small income to support his family. 

His charging machine was broken, so Mr. Puthrea B. decided to ask for a loan to buy a dynamo and to pay for repairs. 

His wife, Mrs. Sreyrem Paem, is a farmer who owns 2-hectares (~ 5 acres) of land on which she grows rice for a living. This couple has a child who is just 3 years old. 

His wife appears in the photo with him.

loans.use: To buy a dynamo and to pay for repairs to his battery charger

loans.name: Duk

texts.en: Mr. Duk Y. is 29 years old and is a villager who lives in Chheal Phlouh village, Takeo province. He and his wife, Mrs. Sokna Keo, are farmers who own 1-hectare of land to cultivate rice and sweet potatoes on to earn their living. Aside from farming, Mr. Duk Y. is also a fisherman while his wife is a pig breeder. With both these businesses they are able to earn a small income to support their family. In order to support their pig breeding, Mr. Duk Y. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets and pig feed for breeding. This couple has three children; two are students in the local school while another one is a year old. His wife is in the photo with him.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig feed for breeding

loans.name: Ath

texts.en:
Mrs. Ath S., age 34, lives in Chheal Phlouh village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns three hectares of land to cultivate rice for living. Mrs. Ath S. is working hard on their farm but still does not earn enough income to support her family. 

In order to increase income so she can improve her family's standard of living, Mrs. Ath S. has decided to ask for a loan in order to buy rice to offer for sale and to buy two piglets for breeding. 

Mrs. Ath S. is a widow with two children who are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy rice to offer for sale

loans.name: Chreb

texts.en:
Mrs. Chreb C., age 44, lives in Thkov village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Ya Phin, are farmers who own four hectares of land to cultivate rice. To improve this farm, Mrs. Chreb C. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a water machine and fertilizer to support her farming crop. 

Aside from farming, they also have a sugar palm house business, which allows them to make a small additional income to help support their family. 

This couple has four children: three are seamstresses in the garment factory and the youngest attends the local school.

loans.use: To buy a water machine and fertilizer

loans.name: Mr. Moeun Chin Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mr. Moeun C., age 41, is the village bank president, having been selected by its 17 members. They live in Srah Trakuon village in Takeo province. Each member of this village loan will use their portion to support different business purposes. 

Mr. Moeun C. and his wife, Mrs. Yeang M., are farmers who own a hectare of land to cultivate rice for a living. To improve the farm, Mr. Moeun C. has decided to ask for a loan in order to buy fertilizer. The rest of the loan will be saved in order to buy a cow for breeding. 

Aside from farming, Mr. Moeun C. is also a laborer, which allows him to receive a small salary to support his family living. 

This couple has three children who are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to save for the purchase of a cow for breeding

loans.name: Sophy's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four members who live in Kandoeng Thum village in Takeo province. Mrs. Sophy M. is 44 years old and is the leader of the group loan, having been selected by its members. Each of the members will use their individual portions to support different business purposes. 

Mrs. Sophy M. and her husband, Mr. Sokchea Hang, are recycling middlemen. In order to increase income to improve the family living, Mrs. Sophy M. decided to ask for a loan in order to buy piglets for breeding. 

This couple has six children: two are security guards, one is a waiter in a restaurant, and the younger three are students in the local school as well as working in their parents' businesses.

loans.use: To buy piglets for breeding

loans.name: Heng's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Heng D., age 68, is the leader of a group loan, having been selected by its four members. They live in Trapeang Kralaong village in Takeo province. With the loan, each of the members hopes to increase income in order to improve their families' standard of living. 

Mrs. Heng D. is a broommaker. She is requesting a loan to add to her savings in order to buy a motorcycle to support her child's business. Mrs. Heng D. is a widow with two children: one cooks and sells rice in the local market while another is a motorbike taxi driver.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to support her child's transportation business

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sorn M., age 51, lives in Voat Svay village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns  four hectares of land to cultivate rice and sweet potatoes for living. 

In order to support the farm, Mrs. Sorn M. decided to ask for a loan in order to buy fertilizer and pesticide as well as to pay for a laborer to help plow her farm. She wants to use the rest of the loan to buy a cow for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Heang Em, is a motorcycle taxi driver who is able to earn a small additional income to support his family living. 

This couple has three children: one is a mirror smith, one is a construction worker, and the youngest attends the local school. Her husband appears in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay for a laborer to help plow her farm

loans.name: Nov

texts.en:
Mrs. Nov H., age 32, lives in Tuol Svay village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Youn Yos, are farmers who own two hectares of land to grow rice and vegetables, which allows them to earn a small income to support their family. 

In order to support this farm, Mrs. Nov H. has decided to ask for a loan in order to dig a well and to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline in order to support her farming crops. 

This couple has two children: one is attending the local school and the other is five years old. Her husband appears  in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline

loans.name: Nhoun

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhoun P., age 57, lives in Tuol Svay village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Houy Koem, are farmers who own two hectares of land to cultivate rice and vegetables. This allows them to earn a small income to support their family. To support the farm, Mrs. Nhoun P. has decided to ask for a loan in order to dig a well and to buy a water machine to support her farming crops. 

This couple has three children: two are seamstresses in the garment factory and the youngest is a student. Her husband appears in the photo with her.

loans.use: To dig a well

loans.name: Mich

texts.en:
Mrs. Mich T., age 49, lives in Tuol Svay village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 1.20 hectares of land to cultivate rice and vegetables, which allows them to earn a small income to support her family. She currently faces a problem because she does not have enough money to ensure successful crops. She has therefore decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to rent a water machine to water her crops. 

Mrs. Mich T. is a widow with three children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory and the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Roeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Roeun S. is a 30-year old married woman and a villager in Mea Neak village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Mean Khann, are farmers who own 2.50 hectares of land and a threshing machine to cultivate rice. Aside from farming, Mr. Mean Khann is a horse cart driver who is able to earn a small income to support his family.

Mrs. Roeun S. is requesting a loan to buy two wheels to support her threshing machine. This couple has three children; two are students in the local school and one is too young to study or work. Her husband appears in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy two wheels for the threshing machine

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarin S., age 27, lives in Mea Neak village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns two and a half hectares of land to cultivate rice for a living. To support this farm, Mrs. Sarin S. has decided to ask for a loan in order to buy a harvesting machine to support her farming crop. 

Her husband, Mr. Phay Oeng, breeds ducks. He is able to help support his family by earning a small income selling duck eggs in the community. 

This couple has three children: two are very young and one is attending the local school. Her husband is pictured in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy a harvesting machine

loans.name: Phann

texts.en:
Mrs. Phann I., age 29, lives in Mea Neak village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Phart Reach, are farmers who own three hectares of land to cultivate rice for a livI.. Aside from farmI., Mr. Phart Reach is able to earn a small income raisI. ducks and sellI. duck eggs in order to support his family. 

In order to support both these businesses, Mrs. Phann I. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and to buy duck food. 

This couple has four children: two very young and the older two are attendI. the local school. Her husband is pictured in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and duck food

loans.name: Huor

texts.en:
Mrs. Huor L. is 53 years old and a villager who lives in Kanhchang village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 1 hectare of land to cultivate rice. She is able to earn a small income to support the family. Mrs. Huor L. is a widow with five children; one is a seamstress in a garment factory and one is employed in a private company. The others attend the local school and help their mother with farming. 

In order to help the children, Mrs. Huor L. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorcycle for their transportation.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her children

loans.name: Hun

texts.en:
Mrs. Hun S. is 58 years old and a villager who lives in Tuol Svay village, Takeo province. She is a widow with three children; one is a farmer, one is a motorcycle repairer and the last one is a student in the local school.  

Mrs. Hun S. is a farmer who owns 3 hectares of land to cultivate rice for a living. Mrs. Hun S. is requesting a loan to dig a well to support her crop and with the rest of the loan, she wants to buy motorcycle supplies to support her child's motorbike repair business.

loans.use: To dig a well and buy motorcycle repair supplies

loans.name: Sokhon

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhon R. is 33 years old and lives in Trapeang Kralanh village, Takeo province. Her husband is in the photo with her.  She and her husband, Mr. That Kuy, are farmers who own a plot of land. They cultivate rice and earn a small income to support their family, which includes three children; two attend the local school and the youngest is 2 years old. The family does not have any oxen for plowing the field. Thus, Mrs. Sokhon R. decided to ask for a loan to buy two oxen to support her farming. Mrs. Sokhon R. is also employed in a garment factory where she earns a small salary to help support her family.

loans.use: To buy two oxen

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
She is a single mother with two children aged nine and seven years. At 27 years, Doreen looks after her family in terms of their welfare and school fees for the children with whom she lives with in a rented house in Masindi, Uganda.

It’s in Masindi that Doreen operates a bar in which she sells beer, sodas and water to earn a living. She has been in the business for the last three years and she says she started very small but now she can see there is some progress in stock and activity though she maintains that competition is very high.

Doreen says her business dream is to have a bigger bar with an entertainment centre. This is Doreen’s third loan from HOFOKAM and she is to buy beers, sodas, and plastic chairs for her bar.

loans.use: To buy beers, sodas, and plastic chairs for her pub

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 31-year-old lady married to a businessman with two children aged 13 and 12. She lives with her family in Masindi, Uganda where she sells second-hand clothing. She has been in the business for one year. She started doing business selling juice, sugar, and airtime but she opted to change her business to clothing. She says changing business lines is not easy but she says she can cope because she feels good and she even says she plans to have a big clothing shop in the near future. 

This is Mariam’s first loan from HOFOKAM and the purpose of the loan for Mariam is to purchase used clothing to sell.

loans.use: Purchasing used clothing to sell at her stall.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is widowed with nine children. All of her children go to school. She also takes care of two grandchildren. She owns a ladies salon in Mengo Kisenyi, where she works on all types of hair with weaving, plaiting and relaxing. She wants to use this loan to buy more hair relaxers, conditioner, weaves and braids. She has been in this business for 30 years. 

Besides this business, she also gets some money from selling piped water. Her customers are the local people. Joyce works six days a week and buys these products from shops in Kikuubo, one of the busiest places in Kampala city. Her business challenges include defaulters and transport costs. She is aspiring to own a fully stocked salon.  

Joyce decided to work with MCDT because she was in need of additional capital. Joyce resides in and owns a two-roomed house. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food, school fees and paying utility bills

loans.use: To buy more boxes of hair relaxers, conditioners, weaves and braids

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is widowed with three children. All her children are in school. She also takes care of additional family members. She owns a retail shop in Kalerwe selling all types of merchandise. She buys merchandise like sugar, soap,,salt and tea leaves from Kampala city shops and goes shopping once a week. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt and two boxes of soap. She has been in this business for 25 years. Besides this retail shop, she also sells cooked food near her shop and sells to all categories of people. both on retail. At times, she does outside catering. Her customers are students from nearby schools and the community around. Rose works seven days a week. Her business challenges includes rainy season because she resides in a floody place. She is aspiring to see her business grow big and start selling on wholesale only, and even building rental rooms.  Rose decided to work with MCDT because she need additional capital. Rose resides in and owns a four-roomed house, and the family has access to electricity and no piped water at home. Her greatest monthly expenses includes food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt and boxes of soap

loans.name: Nakkazi

texts.en: S. is a single lady with no children. She stays with her parents and she takes care of them. She owns a stall in Kalerwe market selling food stuffs  like banana clusters, sweet potatoes, cassava and Irish potatoes. She doesn’t incur any transport costs because she buys from her place of work. She wants to use this loan to buy more clusters of bananas, one sack of sweet and Irish potatoes, and cassava. She has been in this business for two years and also with MCDT for two years, servicing her third loan. She doesn’t have any other side business. Her customers are nearby families. She works seven days a week. S.’s business challenges includes rainy season because she works in a muddy place, and defaulters. She is aspiring to go directly to farmers. She joined MCDT because she wanted additional capital. The family has access to electricity and no piped water, and her monthly expenses include food and rent for their home.

loans.use: To buy moe banana clusters, one bag of sweet and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Hasifa

texts.en: Hasifa is a single lady with no children. She resides with her old parents and takes care of them. She sells juice in Kalerwe market and sells to all categories of people, both on retail and wholesale. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of passionfruit, sugar and oranges for squeezing juice.    She has been in this business for three years and with MCDT for two years, servicing her third loan. She doesn’t have any other side business. Hasifa works seven days a week. Her business challenge is the rainy season because few customers come to her for a drink. She aspires to see her business grow big and to employ three girls. Hasifa joined MCDT to boost her business by acquiring additional capital. She resides in and rents a two-room house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes rent and food .

loans.use: To buy more bags of passionfruit, sugar and oranges for squeezing juice

loans.name: Mayi

texts.en:
Mayi is married with two children who both go to school.  She owns a beauty salon in Kawempe and works on all types of hair, like plaiting, weaving and relaxing. She wants to use this loan to buy more boxes of relaxers, weaves and braids. She has been in this business for nine years and doesn’t have any other source of income.  She works on all categories of people, women, children and men. She works six days a week. Her main business challenge is the transportation of boxes of relaxers, braids and weaves from Kikuubo in Kampala city to her salon, because she uses public transport to and from shopping, which she does once a week.  

She is hoping to see her business grow into a fully stocked salon and also wants to build a house.  Mayi joined MCDT to boost her business by getting additional capital.  For about $22, she rents and resides in a two-room house which also acts as her salon. The family has access to electricity but no piped water, and her monthly expenses include rent, school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of relaxers, conditioners,weaves and braids

loans.name: Oké

texts.fr: A. Oké est née en 1940 et vit depuis vingt cinq ans environs au quartier Abokicodji à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Oké est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et majeurs. Aucun de ses enfants n'est donc plus à sa charge. Oké est une veuve qui vit seule et assure seule ses différentes charges. Il y a près de dix ans que Oké mène comme activité la vente de fagots de bois à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Oké vend de l'essence au bord de la voie, à la devanture de sa maison. Oké s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du Bénin. Oké a déjà obtenu deux prêts de ALIDé, et les a tous bien remboursés. Oké désire une évolution de son activité. C'est pour cette raison que Oké sollicite un troisième crédit, en vue d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et d’accroître son chiffre d’affaire.
texts.en:
Oké A. was born in 1940 and has lived for about 25 years in the Abokicodji neighborhood of Cotonou, Benin's economic capital. She is the mother of four grown children, all of whom went to school and none of whom are now dependent on her. She is a widow who lives alone and supports herself. For about ten years she has sold firewood from her home, and as a side business she also sells gasoline by the roadside in front of her house. She gets her supplies in upcountry Benin. She has had two previous loans from ALIDé, both repaid in full. She wants to grow her business, and for that reason is seeking a third loan so as to increase her stock in trade and increase her turnover.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy firewood

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah is married with six children and all her children go school. She also takes care of additional family members.  Recently Hadjah changed her business from frying eatables like samosas, chapatti and donuts to selling charcoal. She has been in this charcoal business for a few months.  She sells charcoal in Kawempe market, both retail and wholesale, to all categories of people.  She doesn’t incur any transport costs as she buys bags of charcoal from the very market where she works. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of charcoal.

Hadjah works six days a week and her business challenges include thieves and the rainy season because she works in an open place.  She hopes to see her business grow bigger, wants to start going to villages for charcoal, and also wants to build a house.  Hadjah joined MCDT because of the low interest rates charged compared to other finance institutions.  Hadjah rents and resides in a four-room house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, market dues, food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en:
Mr. Phorn C. is 56 years old and lives in Trapeang Roka village, Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns 1 hectare (2.5 acres) of land he uses to cultivate rice for a living. Aside from farming, he is also a chicken breeder at home and is able to earn a small income to support his family.

In order to support his chicken business, Mr. Phorn C. decided to ask for a loan to buy more chickens to enlarge his business activities.

Mr. Phorn C. is widower with four children: one is a security guard, one is a laborer in Korea, while the other two are students and also support their father’s businesses.

loans.use: To buy more chickens to enlarge his business activities

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Ly Y. is 40 years old. She is one of four people located in Pring village in Takeo province who are together seeking a group loan. The group selected Mrs. Ly Y. as their leader. With the loans, the group members hope to increase their income to support their family's daily financial needs. Mrs. Ly Y. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. She does not have enough money to pay for all of her farming expenses, so she has decided to ask for a loan to pay for a laborer to plow her farm. She also intends to use the loan to buy piglets for breeding. Her husband, Sokhorn C., is a teacher in the local school where he receives a small salary to support his family. This couple has four children; one is a seamstress in a garment factory, while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To have farm plowed and to buy piglets

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is married to a peasant farmer. They have seven children, all of whom go school. She also takes care of additional family members. She sells charcoal in Makerere Kikoni, selling on both a retail and a wholesale basis.  She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of charcoal. Besides this charcoal business, she also owns pork joint near her charcoal store.  Agnes sells to all categories of people.  She has been with this business for five years and works six days a week.  

Her business challenges include defaulters and the rainy season.  She wants to go directly to villages for charcoal and also build her own house. Agnes joined MCDT because they were giving out timely loans and because of their low interest rates.  Agnes rents and resides in a two-room house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water.   Her monthly expenses include school fees, food and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcaol

loans.name: Mrs. Ear Chea Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. EA. C. is 48 years old. She has been selected as the group leader by seventeen people who are seeking a group loan. The group is located in Prey Ba Soeng village in Takeo province. Each member of this group will use his/her portion of the loan for different purposes. Mrs. EA. C. and her husband, Mr. K. C., are farmers who own 1.5 hectares of land. They cultivate rice and vegetables to earn a small income to support their family's daily needs. In order to support this farm, Mrs. EA. C. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide for her crops. This couple has three children, all of whom are students and also support their parents' farming activities.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, gasoline and pesticide

loans.name: Clarisse

texts.fr: M. Clarisse est née le 14 Octobre 1972 et est mariée à HOUSSOU Aurélien. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés. La famille s’est installée depuis une dizaine d’année au quartier Missessin à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Clarisse contribue avec son mari aux charges familiales. Clarisse vend des tissus depuis huit ans environs, ce qui l’aide à subvenir à ses besoins. Clarisse achète ses tissus à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et les vend par le système de distribution. Clarisse a déjà bénéficié de deux prêts qui ont été tous bien remboursés à ALIDé. En vue de rehausser son activité par l’augmentation de sa quantité d’approvisionnement et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Clarisse sollicite un troisième prêt.
texts.en:
Clarisse M. was born October 14, 1972. She is married to Aurélien Houssou. They have two children, both in school. For about ten years they have lived in the Missessin neighborhood of Cotonou, Benin's economic capital. Between the two of them, they pay for their family's needs. Clarisse has sold cloth for about eight years, which helps her support the family. She buys her cloth at Dantokpa, Benin's international trade center, and sells it to her customers one-on-one. She has had two previous loans from ALIDé, both fully repaid, and now would like a third so as to grow her business and better meet her customers' needs.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cloth

loans.name: Rose

texts.fr: D. M. Rose est née le 03 Avril 1952 et est mariée à De SOUZA Flavien. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Rose vit depuis une quinzaine d’année au quartier Gbégamey à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Rose vit avec ses enfants. Rose apporte une aide financière à son mari en l’aidant à répondre aux divers besoins de la famille, grâce au revenu que lui génère son activité. Rose n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Depuis huit ans environs, Rose vend de la nourriture (pâte de maïs fermentée accompagnée de sauce et de poissons frits) de façon ambulante. De façon secondaire, Rose vend des produits divers (biscuits, bombons, savons, etc.). Rose achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Rose sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un crédit en vue de renforcer son activité et d’augmenter la quantité de nourriture préparée pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Rose D. M., born April 3, 1952, is married to Flavien De Souza. They have two children, both educated. For about 15 years she has lived in the Gbégamey neighborhood of Cotonou, Benin's economic capital, with her children. She helps her husband pay for the family's needs, thanks to her business income. She never went to school. For about eight years she has sold food door-to-door (corn mush and sauce, fried fish). She also sells other products such as cookies, candy and soap, which she buys at Dantokpa, Benin's international trade center. She is asking for a second loan from ALIDé so as to grow her business by preparing more food for her customers.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cornmeal and condiments

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is married with six children, and all her children go school. She also takes care of additional family members. Victoria owns a stall in Maganjo market selling bananas. She sells to all categories of people both on a retail and a wholesale basis.   

She wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas. She buys bananas from delivery vans at her place of work and so doesn’t incur any transport costs.  She has been in this banana business for over thirteen years.  She also owns a beauty salon and rental rooms.  Her customers are from the local community.  She works seven days a week.  Her business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. 

Victoria would like to go directly to Masaka villages for bananas and also to build more rental rooms. She joined MCDT because of the low interest charged. She owns and resides in a three-room house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water.  Her monthly expenses includes school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr: S. Julienne est née en 1946 et vit depuis cinquante ans environs au quartier Abokicodji à Cotonou,  capitale économique du Bénin. Julienne est mère de cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et qui ne sont plus à sa charge. C’est une veuve, qui vit donc seule et assure seule ses différentes charges. Julienne n’a pas été à l’école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Julienne vend divers produits (arachide grillé, bombons, biscuits, lait, etc.) à son domicile. Julienne exerce cette activité depuis quinze ans. Julienne s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Julienne a déjà obtenu une fois de prêt à ALIDé et a bien remboursé. Julienne sollicite à nouveau un crédit afin d’élever le niveau de son activité et de se faire plus de revenus, grâce à ses ventes.
texts.en:
Julienne S. was born in 1946 and has lived for about 50 years in the Abokicodji neighborhood of Cotonou, Benin's economic capital. She has five children who all went to school. None of them is now dependent on her. She is a widow who lives alone and supports herself. She never went to school. To meet her needs, she sells various products from her home (roasted peanuts, candy, cookies, milk and so on). She has been doing this for about 15 years. She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, Benin's international trade center. She has paid back one loan from ALIDé, and would like a second one to grow her business and increase her income.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various products such as candy, cookies and peanuts.

loans.name: Mr. Sothy Chuch Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mr. Sothy C. is 28 years old and married. He has been selected the leader of a group of ten people seeking a group loan. The group is located in Krang ToU. village in Takeo province. Mr. Sothy C. is a farmer who owns 2 hectares of land where he cultivates rice. He is also a laborer. His wife, Mrs. Sophal C., sells desserts in the local market. With these businesses they are able to earn a small income to support their family. In order to increase their income and improve their standard of living, Mr. Sothy C. decided to ask for a loan to buy a female pig for breeding. This couple has two children; one is a student in the local school and one is just five years old. The day of the loan disbursement Mr. Sothy C. was busy working in the field. Instead, his wife, Mrs. Sophal C., received the loan for him. Mr. Sothy Church's wife is in the photo above.

loans.use: To buy a pig for breeding

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Née en 1971, I. Mariama vit depuis dix neuf ans au quartier Gbégamey à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariama est mariée à MAMA BAHOUNCHI et est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Mariama vit avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple se partage les différentes charges familiales. Mariama n’est pas allée à l’école. Depuis une dizaine d’année, Mariama vend de la bouillie faite de maïs, accompagnée de beignets à base de farine de blé, de façon ambulante. Mariama se ravitaille à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Mariama sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé, en vue de rehausser son activité et d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire. Le premier crédit dont Mariama a bénéficié a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Born in 1971, Mariama I. has lived for nine years in the Gbégamey neighborhood of Cotonou, Benin's economic capital. She is married to Bahounchi Mama, and has two children, both of whom are in school. She lives with them and her husband. The couple share in paying for their family's needs/ She never went to school. For about ten years she has sold cornmeal mush with doughnuts on the side, door-to-door. She buys her supplies at Dantokpa, Benin's international trade center. She is asking for a second loan from ALIDé so as to grow her business and increase her income. She repaid a previous loan in full.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cornmeal and wheat flour

loans.name: Rom

texts.en:
Mrs. Rom P. is 33 years old and lives in Prey Chour village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land she uses to cultivate rice and she is also laborer in a garment factory. Her husband, Mr. Sarin Soung, is a construction worker who receives a small salary to support his family.

In order to support her husband’s work, Mrs. Rom P. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike to provide for her husband’s transportation needs.

This couple has two children who are attending the local school. Her husband is shown with her in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to use for commuting

loans.name: Rann

texts.en:
Mrs. Rann L. is 41 years old and lives in Roluos village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Saroeun Rin, are farmers who own 2 hectares (5 acres) of land they use to cultivate rice.

For this farm, Mrs. Rann L. decided to ask for a loan to purchase a water pump, hose, and fertilizer to support her farm crop.

Aside from farming, Mr. Saroeun Rin is also a maker  of big pots from which he is able to earn a small income to support his family. This couple does not have any children.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump, hose, and fertilizer to support her farm crop

loans.name: Mil

texts.en:
Mrs. Mil P. is 42 years old and lives in Tuol Svay village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Es Sae, are farmers who own 1.5 hectares (3.75 acres) of land that they use to cultivate rice for a living. Her husband is shown with her in the photo.

In order to support this farm, Mrs. Mil P. decided to ask for a loan to dig a well and to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her farm crop.

Aside from farming, Mr. Es Sae is also a fisherman who is able to earn a small income to support his family. This couple has six children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory, another is a laborer, while the other four are attending the local school and also support their parents’ farming.

loans.use: To dig a well and to buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
A newly recognized member of ASHI, Josephine C., is requesting a loan which she will use as additional capital to grow her small eatery, which is located just in front of her house. The variety of foods she cooks and sells has captured the taste of many people living around and in her village. However, growing her small livelihood activity without access to loans was hard, considering that the income she earns every day must provide all the needs of her family. 

Now that she is with ASHI, Josephine is hoping that her business will really grow and become stable so that she will be able to pay for her husband's medications as well as for the education of her four children, especially when they go to college someday. Presently, her eldest (14 years old) is in high school and her second child (11 years old) is in elementary. Her third child is in a preschool while her youngest is only one year old.

Josephine knows that being poor and having a husband who is ill, she will be undergoing a lot of challenges before she can improve her family's standard of living. However, with the services of ASHI that she can access, she hopes to overcome poverty.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients and utensils for her small eatery.

loans.name: Phearum

texts.en:
Mrs. Phearum Y. is a 31-year-old married woman who lives in Krang Touch village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 2 hectares (5 acres) of land that she uses to cultivate rice. Her husband is a construction worker who is able a small income to support his family.

In order to support her husband’s work, Mrs. Phearum Y. decided to ask for a loan to purchase a motorcycle to provide for her husband’s transportation needs.

This couple has two children: one is attending the local school while the other one is 5 years old.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to provide her husband with transportation

loans.name: Phon

texts.en:
Mrs. Phon U. is 56 years old and lives in Ta Preah village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 2 hectares (5 acres) of land that she uses to cultivate rice. She is also raises ducks for duck eggs and is able to earn a small income to support her family.

In order to support her duck breeding, Mrs. Phon U. decided to ask for a loan to bU. 2T (metric tons) of duck food.

Mrs. Phon U. is the mother of two children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory while the other is a duck breeder who supports his mother, too.

loans.use: To buy 2T of duck food to support her duck breeding business

loans.name: Sokhon

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhon Soeun is 32 years old and is a villager in Kandaol village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Pengly Tae, are farmers who own 1.20-hectare of land which they use to cultivate rice, beans and corn for a living. 

They do not have enough money to run their farm, thus Mrs. Sokhon Soeun decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her crops. This couple has a child who is 2 years old. Her husband is with her in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Ghulaam Fatima's Group

texts.en:
Ghulaam Fatima lives in the city of Vehari with her husband and family. She has four children, three daughters and a son. One of them is getting her education. Her husband is a laborer and she sells clothes to cover the basic needs of her family. She purchases the clothes from Faisalabad and sells them to different shops in Vehari to earn income. 

She is applying for a loan from Asasah to invest in her business. She will buy more varieties of clothes to offer to her clients. She thinks that by adding variety to her business, she can earn more income that will help her family to live a better life. 

Note: In this picture Rukshana, one group member, is showing her bread-making business.

loans.use: Purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap S. is 41 years old and lives in Pnov village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Doeun S., are farmers who own 3.50-hectare of land which they use to cultivate rice. In addition to being farmers, they are also duck breeders who are able to earn a small income to support their family. 

For their farm and duck breeding businesses, Mrs. Sopheap S. decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, pesticide and duck food. This couple has four children; one is a duck breeder, two are students and one stays at home. Her husband is with her in the photo.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, pesticide, duck food

loans.name: Folakè

texts.fr: Née en 1985 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, O. Folakè est mariée à ELEGBEDE Razack, un photographe. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Seulement deux des enfants sont à la charge de Folakè et de son mari. Folakè vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants au quartier Dandji à Cotonou. Le couple subvient ensemble aux différents besoins de la famille. Depuis huit ans, Folakè  mène comme activité, la vente de produits de soins (pâte dentifrice, brosses à dents, médicaments, etc.) de façon ambulante. De façon secondaire, Folakè vend également des sachets et des chaussures. Folakè s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui a bien remboursé les crédits qu'elle a obtenu entre temps. Dans le but d'augmenter son fonds de roulement et d'agrandir son activité, Folakè sollicite un autre crédit.
texts.en:
Born in 1985 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Folakè O. is married to Razack Elegbede, a photographer. They have three children, some of whom go to school. Only two of the children are in the care of Folakè and her husband. Folakè lives with her husband and children in the Dandij district of Cotonou. The couple takes care of the various family needs jointly. For the eight past years, Folakè has been engaged in selling personal care items (toothpaste, toothbrushes, medications etc) as a street vendor. In addition, she also sells plastic bags and shoes. Folakè stocks up in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She is a long-time client of ALIDé and always repaid all her loans properly. In order to increase her business capital and expand her activities, Folakè is seeking a new credit.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing tooth paste, toothbrushes, medications etc

loans.name: Sopha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopha O. is 40 years old and lives in Pnov village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Vy Seng, are farmers who own 4 hectares of land which they use to cultivate rice for a living. 

They do not have enough money to maintain their farming activities, thus Mrs. Sopha O. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, rice seed, pesticide and gasoline to support her farm.  Aside from being a farmer, Mr. Vy Seng also owns a plowing machine which villagers can rent to plow their fields, which provides a small additional income to support his family. 

This couple has five children; three are students in the local school, while the others are too young to study or work. Her husband is with her in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed, pesticide and gasoline

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine lives with her three children, all of whom go to school. The third child is still very young.  She also takes care of her old parents.  She owns a small restaurant in Nakulabye's Kiyaye zone market, selling all types of food like local food, chips and chicken. She sells to all types of people both retail and wholesale.  

She wants to use this loan of 300,000 UGX to buy more food stuffs like bananas, rice, cassava, beef and charcoal. She has been in this business for seven years. Some of her customers are market vendors.  Justine works seven days a week. Her business challenges include defaulters and the rainy season. When it rains it becomes difficult for her customers to reach her restaurant.  

Justine is dreaming of owning a fully stocked hotel. She joined MCDT because she wanted to get additional capital for her business.  She rents and resides in a two-room house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include food, rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs like bunches of bananas, cassava, beef and charcoal

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley E., a simple 44-year-old woman, enjoys her career being a wife, mother, and a businesswoman. Her dreams are simple and all are for the welfare of her family. Through ASHI and its services, especially loans, Shirley hopes to have a stable and profitable business one day. The profit she will make out of this would be her support and the financial assistance she needs to improve the lifestyle of her family. 

Since Shirley joined ASHI in 1997, she has been able to sustain a business in partnership with her husband, financed by the loans she has received. Shirley and her husband catch “bangus” (Philippine national fish: milk fish) fingerlings from the shallow part of the ocean for resale. An implement used for this fishing activity is a fishnet with a bamboo frame and handle. This kind of activity is seasonal yet it generates good income for Shirley to be able to put aside savings meant to support the needs of her family when “bangus” fingerlings are off-season.  Sometimes her husband works as a part-time driver of a tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar) for transportation. This way she never has problems in repaying the loan she has requested. As a matter of fact, Shirley has been a very good member of ASHI.

Presently, “bangus” fingerlings are in season. Shirley wishes to purchase materials for making an implement for fishing and increase the volume of their catch to have larger amount of profit. In this way, she will be able to support her family's needs, especially the education of her youngest, eight-year-old child. She really hopes that this child will graduate from college just like her eldest child who has just recently begun working for ASHI as an ASHI staff member. Her other three children are supported by her most of the time since they are just small-time hired laborers and are earning very little.

loans.use: To purchase fishing gear

loans.name: Savorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Savorn S. is 36 years old and lives in Damnak village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 1.50-hectares of land which she uses to cultivate rice for a living. 

In order to support her farm, Mrs. Savorn S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and to pay for a laborer to plow her farm. Aside from being a farmer, she is also a congee (rice porridge) seller in her local village which provides a small additional income to support her family.

Mrs. Savorn S. is a widow with four children; one is a seamstress in a garment factory, two are students, while the last one is a car driver.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and to pay for laborer

loans.name: Noëlie

texts.fr: Née en 1962, H. Noëlie est mariée à HOUNGUE Jean et est mère de quatre enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Noëlie a un autre enfant à sa charge. Il y a environs dix sept ans que Noëlie vit au quartier PK10, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, avec ses enfants et son mari. Noëlie vient en aide à son mari et assure avec lui les différentes charges familiales. Noëlie a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Depuis environs cinq ans, Noëlie exerce comme activité, la vente de bois de chauffage, et de façon secondaire, la vente de condiments à son domicile. Noëlie s'approvisionne à Houègbo, dans le département de l'Atlantique. C'est la première fois que Noëlie sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un crédit en vue de rehausser le niveau de son activité et d'accroître sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in 1962, Noëlie H. is married tol Jean Houngue, and has four children. Some of them went to school. She cares for one other child as well. For about seven years, she has lived in the PK10 neighborhood in the commune of Sèmè-Podji with her family. She helps her husband in taking care of their family's needs. She dropped out of high school. For about five years she has sold firewood from her home, and has also sold spices and seasonings. She buys her supplies at Houègbo in the Department of the Atlantic. She is asking for her first loan from ALIDé so as to grow her business and attract more customers.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy firewood

loans.name: Veurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Veurn T. is a 24-year-old married woman who lives in Damnak village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Noeun Chea, are farmers who own a plot of land which they use to cultivate rice for a living. 

With the farm, they do not make enough income to support their family, thus Mrs. Veurn T. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding, as well as to buy fertilizer and to pay for laborer to plow her farm. 

This couple has a child who is four years old. Her husband is with her in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for laborer to plow her farm

loans.name: Yasmeen Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen bibi lives in Vehari Pakistan with her family. She has three children and none of have been able to get an education yet due to financial problems. Her husband has an animal selling business, specifically he sells donkeys to people who do loading (hauling) business on their donkey carts. He has been in this business for over six years.  

Yasmaan bibi is applying for a loan from Asasah to invest the loan amount in her husband’s business. He will buy more donkeys and increase his earnings. She is hopeful that by investing money in her husband’s business for profit, she will be able to send her children to school one day. 

Note: "In this photo Bashiran the group member is showing her clothes selling business".

loans.use: Purchase donkeys for animal selling business

loans.name: Maïzarath

texts.fr: S. Maïzarath est née en Juillet 1989 et vit depuis treize ans au quartier Dandji à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Maïzarath n'est pas encore mariée et n'a pas d'enfant. Maïzarath vit seule et assure seule ses différentes charges. Maïzarath n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Maïzarath mène comme activité la vente de parfums, cotons, thermos, etc. à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est aussi dans le même marché que Maïzarath achète ses produits. C'est la deuxième fois que Maïzarath sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un concours financier, en vue de rehausser son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. Maïzarath a bien remboursé le premier crédit qu'elle a obtenu de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Maïzarath S. was born in July, 1989, and has lived for 13 years in the Dandji neighborhood of of Cotonou, Benin's economic capital. She is still single and has no children. She lives alone and supports herself. She did not go to school. To take care of her needs, she sells perfumes, cotton goods, thermos products, etc., at Dantokpa, Benin's international trade center, where she also buys her stock. She is asking for her second loan from ALIDé so as to grow her business and to better respond to customer demand. She repaid her first loan from ALIDé in full and on time.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy perfume, thermos products, cotton goods, etc.

loans.name: Affoussath

texts.fr: R. Affoussath est née en 1961 à Sakété, dans le département de l'Ouémé. Affoussath est mariée à AMOUSSE Taofik et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. La famille s'est installée depuis sept ans au quartier Lokokoukoumè dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Affoussath n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Affoussath vend des produits de beauté et des savons à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est dans le même marché que Affoussath achète ses produits. Affoussath exerce cette activité depuis cinq ans et a déjà obtenu une fois de crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qu'elle a bien remboursé. Dans le but de développer davantage son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Affoussath sollicite un deuxième crédit.
texts.en:
R. Affoussath was born in 1961 in Sakété, in Ouémé Department. She is married to Taofik Amousse and has three children, all of whom have been to school. For seven years the family has lived in the Lokokoukoumè neighborhood of the commune of Sèmè-Podji. Together they take care of family expenses. Affoussath did not go to school. To meet her needs, she sells beauty products and soaps at Dantokpa, Benin's international trade center, where she also buys her stock. She has been in this business for five years and has already repaid one loan from ALIDé. To grow her business and respond better to customer demand, she is asking for a second loan.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beauty products

loans.name: Nazia Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Nazia perveen lives in a mid-sized city called Vehari Pakistan. Her husband drives a rented auto rickshaw and she does stitching work by taking orders from her neighborhood to fulfill the basic needs of her family. 

Her husband wants to buy his own rickshaw because he wants to increase his income by avoiding rental fees and by using the rickshaw for longer hours. 
Therefore, Nazia is applying for a loan from Asasah (microfinance institute in Pakistan and a partner of Kiva) for her husband. With the loan amount, he will buy his own rickshaw that will definitely bring him more income because he will no longer need to pay rent and also be able to work without any time restrictions. 

Nazia perveen has three children, none of whom are going to school. She is hopeful that one day she will be able to give her children a quality education by sending them to school.

Note: "In this photo Khursheedan a group member is showing her donkey cart on which her husband does loading business".

loans.use: Purchas an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi 1  est issu de l’Association  de femmes mariées du village de Dah Manakina de la préfecture de San, région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 34 ans,  5 enfants et cultivent  de l’arachide. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé tous les  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne.
S. Koné compte utiliser son prêt  pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels agricoles et des intrants. 
Elle s’approvisionne  au grand marché de San ville. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Dah, San,  et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 55.000FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Benkadi 1 group comes from the married women's association in Dah Manakina village in the San prefecture, Ségou region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in traditional families and are, on average, 34 years old with five children. They grow peanuts (groundnuts). In order to turn a profit with their farming operations, the group members decided three years ago to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program. Having fully repaid all previous loans, they are on their third farming loan. S. Koné plans to use her loan to buy a sufficient quantity of peanuts for seed, farming tools, and agricultural supplies such as fertilizer and soil amendments. She gets her supplies from the big market in the city of San. After the rainy season, the products of the harvest will be stocked for a certain period of time to increase their value. They will then be sold at the big market in Dah, in San, and in surrounding markets, for cash on a retail basis and often wholesale, to customers generally from the large cities. The group members plan to make a profit of 55,000 CFA each after selling their harvest, which will be used to pay interest on the loan and everyday family expenses.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and soil amendments, seed, and tools

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is married with three children who all go to school. She also takes care of her elderly parents. She owns a ladies salon in Nakulabye Kiyaye zone and works on all types of hair styles, like weaving, plaiting, relaxing and cutting. She wants to use this loan to buy more hair conditioners, relaxers and boxes of braids and weaves. She has been in this business for eight years. Her customers are mainly women. She works seven days a week. 

Her business challenges include seasonality and transportation of these boxes from Kikuubo in Kampala city to Nakulabye. Aisha goes shopping  once a week and uses public transport to and from shopping. She is aspiring to own a bridal salon. She joined MCDT to boost her business by getting additional capital. Aisha resides in and rents a two roomed house and the family has access to electricity and no piped water. Her monthly expenses include food, rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of hair relaxers, conditioners, weaves and braids.

loans.name: Mrs. Saly Vong Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Saly V. is 46 years old and is the village bank president having been selected by 22 members from Prey Mien village in Takeo province. Each member of the group will use the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Saly V. is a farmer who owns 1 hectare of land to cultivate rice for living. Her husband, Mr. Dorn Touch, is a construction worker who receives a small salary to support his family. This couple has three children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. In order to increase her income to support the family, Mrs. Saly V. wants to start a new business. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to dig a pond for fish breeding. 

Mrs. E. Leng is the group guarantor, so she is in the photo too. All the members are present in the photo, but some of them are blocked.

loans.use: To dig a pond for fish breeding

loans.name: Faïssatou

texts.fr: A. Faïssatou est née le 29 Avril 1968 à Sakété, dans le département de l'Ouémé. Faïssatou est mariée à AMOUSSA Deen et est mère de deux enfants,tous scolarisés. Faïssatou vit depuis onze ans au quartier Dandji à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple subvient ensemble aux besoins de la famille. Faïssatou n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Faïssatou vend divers produits vivriers (maïs, farine de manioc, pâtes alimentaires, riz, conserves, tomates fraiches, etc.) à Abattoir, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Faïssatou achète ses produits à l'intérieur du pays. C'est la deuxième fois que Faïssatou sollicite un appui financier de ALIDé, afin d'augmenter son fonds de roulement et d'élever le niveau de son activité. Faïssatou a bien remboursé le premier crédit reçu de ALIDé.
texts.en:
