loans.name: En Dios Confiamos 4 Group

texts.en:
Milciades is the coordinator of his group En Dios Confiamos 4 (In God we trust), and his story is representative of his group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. His group is located in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and sugar cane industries. The main economic activity in the city is the Free Trading Zone, a cement factory, and others. Both running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable there. Milciades makes his home here in a simple structure with his long term partner and two children.

Milciades is excited to be taking his first loan with Esperanza, to improve in his business raising pigs to sell when they grow up. He plans to use this loan to invest in his business, buying more pigs to raise and sell. He will use the profits to build his home in a stronger structure from wood to concrete block. He thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy Pigs

loans.name: Sope Khadim Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOPE KHADIM est composé de neuf (9) femmes toutes issues du même village et se sont constituées et organisées par affinité. Il est créé le 14 décembre 2008, date d'ouverture du Banc Villageois. Elles sont d'âges très variés, entre  29 et 53 ans. Elles sont toutes mariées mères d'au moins deux(2)  enfants. Elles mènent toutes des activités génératrices de revenues et l'activité dominante est le petit commerce de légumes. En plus des remboursements réguliers qu'elles font cycliquement elles ont une bonne capacité de mobilisation d'épargne soit un cumul épargne de 544 500 FCFA.

Seynabou D. en premier rang à gauche sur la photo, assise et emmitouflée d'une écharpe noire est la responsable du Groupe de Solidarité. Elle est âgée de 53 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants en charge. Elle fait du petit commerce de légumes au marché central de Louga, elle pratique cette activité depuis plus d'une dizaine d'année. Elle a adhéré au Banc Villageois en même temps que ses autres camarades, le 14 décembre 2008. Elle a reçu un prêt de 100 000 FCFA lui permettant de renforcer sa capacité d'investissement afin d'augmenter son approvisionnement en légumes. Elle a comme objectif de répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle et accroître ses revenus financiers afin de mieux participer à la prise en charge de sa famille par rapport à la santé et la nourriture.
texts.en:
The solidarity group SOPE KHADIM is composed of nine women who are all from the same village. The group was formed and organized by affinity. It was created on December 14, 2008, the date the Banc Villageois opened. Their ages vary between 29 and 53 years. They are all married and mother of at least two children. They all have income-generating businesses, with the sale of vegetables being predominant. In addition to making regular loan payments, they good at saving, with a cumulative savings of 544 500 CFA francs. Seynabou D., in the first row on the left on the photo, seated and wrapped a black scarf, is the leader of the Solidarity group. She is a 53 year-old, married woman who is responsible for five children. She has had a small business selling vegetables in the central market of Louga for more than ten years. She joined the Banc Villageois on December 14, 2008, at the same time as her other friends. She received a loan of 100 000 CFA francs to help her improve her investment ability and increase her supply of vegetables. Her goal is to meet the needs of her customers and increase her revenues to better take care of the health and nourishment of her family.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen the economic initiative of the solidarity group by investing in small businesses

loans.name: Luis Armando

texts.es:
El señor Luis Armando R. A., tiene 47 años de edad con su familia y esposa habitan en el barrio Medardo A., tienen 3 hijos que son mayores de edad, el menor de ellos estudia la universidad y los otros viven de manera independiente, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 11 años.

Habitan en un hogar bastante humilde que necesita de mejoras para el buen vivir de todos, sus días en la agricultura comenzaron a medida que logro ahorrar para la comprad e un terreno que le permitió una fuente necesaria en su vida, ahora solicita un préstamo para la compra materiales agrícolas que le permitan mejores condiciones a sus terreno sobre todo que actualmente con la cosecha de piña ha presentado una afectación de plagas que disminuye la producción y sobretodo afecta su economía, el es un productor bien responsable y su esposa posee un pequeño negocio que le inyecta a este de las ganancias de la agricultura. De modo que esta inversión apoyara de sobremanera a la familia en mejores ingresos y condiciones económicas que le permitan la incursión de nuevas fuentes de ingresos.
texts.en:
Sr. Luis Armando R. A., 47, lives with his wife and family in the Medardo A. neighborhood. The couple has 3 children, all grown. The oldest is studying at the university and the others live independently. Sr. Luis has worked at farming since he was 11 years old. Sr. Luis lives in a modest house that needs improvements to make it better for him and his family. He started his own farm after saving the money to buy land that has allowed him to generate enough income to live. He's now applying for a loan to buy farming supplies that will help to improve his fields. The improvements are necessary because of a recent infestation (or plant disease?) that destroyed part of his pineapple crop and, of course, affected his income. Sr. Luis is a responsible manager and he has funded his wife's small business with earnings from the farm. This investment will help to increase the family's earnings and improve their economic condition.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for farming business.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Vicencia de 56 años es presidenta de la Asociación Comunal Nueva Esperanza, que a su vez pertenece al Centro Focal Exaltación. Vicencia es casada y tiene 5 hijos. Desde hace 20 años se dedica a vender productos de escritorio y con el tiempo ha podido establecer una librería, el mismo que le ha permitido cubrir las necesidades básicas de sus hijos, en esta oportunidad necesita el préstamo para adquirir mayor mercadería y ofertar variados productos a su clientela. Ella atiende todos los días de 8 de la mañana a 10 de la noche. 
Vicencia pertenece a la familia de Pro Mujer hace 4 años y le gusta la capacitación y la buena atención en el consultorio.
Sus demás compañeras también tienen diversos negocios y desean mejorar los mismos.
texts.en:
Vicencia is fifty-six years old and is the president of "Asociación Comunal Nueva Esperanza" which is part of "Centro Focal Exaltación." Vicencia is married and has five children. She has sold writing products for twenty years and over time has been able to establish a bookstore which has allowed her to cover her children's basic needs. Right now, she needs a loan to add more merchandise so she can offer her customers more products. She works everyday from 8 in the morning until 10 at night. Vicencia has been a member of Pro Mujer's family for 4 years and she likes the trainings and attention she receives. Her fellow companions have diverse businesses and would like to improve themselves.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Amor Y Paz 1, 3 Group

texts.en:
Belkis is the coordinator of her group Amor y Paz 1,3 (Love and peace), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural area surrounding El Seibo, an agricultural area, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and 3 children.

Belkis is excited to be taking her 8th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling shoes and underwear. She will use the profits to build her home in a stronger structure from wood to concrete block. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy shoes and underwear

loans.name: Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Maiya K. is a 45-year-old married woman with a daughter and son. They live in Sainbu-Bhaishipati, Lalitpur. 
Her husband works in a private office. 

Mrs. K. started selling milk a year ago. She already owns one cow and is requesting a loan of Rs 10000.00 to buy another young cow for milk to sell in the local area. Since they live in a growing neighborhood, she believes that there will be an increase in demand for milk. Nepal people love to drink cow's milk so demand for milk is increasing constantly. She wishes to spend her income for her children's’ education.

loans.use: to buy a second cow for milk to sell

loans.name: Banco Cartagena Group

texts.en:
There are 21 members of the "Cartagena" communal bank, and they live in Cartagena, a coastal community from the 5th Region in Chile.  Their businesses are: the preparation and sale of foods like bread, empanadas, sweets, and salads (among others); kiosks and hardware shops; door-to-door clothing sales; and fishing.

Julia is the secretary of the communal bank, in the attached picture you see her in the center, with a beige zip-up fleece and sort hair, making bunny ears over the head of one of the other group members.  For ten years Julia has been preparing breads, empanadas, and "berlines" (round pastries with cream filling) in her home, and selling the products from her home to neighbors, friends, and other clients she has met.  The best times for sales are over holidays and long weekends, when people arrive to enjoy the beach in Cartagena.

Julia has the support of her husband, who is a bread maker.  They have five grown children, who live independently with families of their own.

With the Fondo Esperanza loan, Julia will purchase ingredients and is considering the possibility of also purchasing a large mechanical bread mixer, which will help her make the dough for her products.  Her husband can help her in the purchase of the machine, because the cost is pretty high.
Julia's dream is to have a bread shop in Cartagena where she, her husband, and two of her sons can work; one of them is also a bread maker and the other makes pastries.

Of the work she has done with Fondo Esperanza, Julia notes that the promotion of the value of the interpersonal relationship between the members of the group has been very important; especially their efforts to share the wisdom of their experiences with the younger members, and to help one another resolve problems.  In terms of business, the most noteworthy part has been the training she and the other communal bank members have received on how to better manage their finances. 

Cartagena is a beach community located in central Chile, very close to the port of San Antonio.  The town’s economy depends primarily on tourism, especially in the summer and over holidays, during which many people come from nearby Santiago (Chile's capital).  The town's population nearly doubles in the summer because of the tourists, whose business is a large source of income for the commercial and service providers in the area.

loans.use: Purchase bread-making ingredients and equipment

loans.name: Thuli Maiya

texts.en: Mrs. Thuli Maiya L. lives in Khokhana-Dobato, Lalitpur. She is a farmer in Khokhana-Dobato, and grows different types of vegetables. Due to the lack of technology, most of the farmers in this area depend on seasonal farming. Mrs. L. sells her vegetables in the local market in the mornings and evenings. She is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. She has two sons and a daughter all of whom are students. A few years ago her husband died so now she has sole responsibility for her three children.

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Carmelo De La Cruz

texts.es:
Carmelo de la Cruz H. tiene 56 años y vive en le barrio Ciudadela 20 de Julio con su esposa y su 4 hijos en las edades de 22 a 31 años. Si usted llega a este barrio encuentra un kiosco muy conocido por vecinos de este sector, fanáticos y aficionados  del futbol, que son la mayor clientela del  negocio de Carmelo   dedicado a la elaboración y venta de fritos, refrescos y bebidas, donde genera  2 empleos y trabaja en un horario desde las 4.00 am a 2:00 pm, porque ese es un sitio preferido para deleitarse con un buen desayuno "el kiosco de Carmelo", que algún día espera convertir  en un restaurante con salón de eventos y este es precisamente su desafío personal.
 
Carmelo está aplicando a su tercer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y por un valor de  $2.000.000 COP para comprar refrescos, y bebidas al por mayor y aprovisionarse para los días festivos en los que  muchas veces escasean estos productos, también comprará  materias primas e insumos como y carnes y pollo.
Carmelo recuerda como inició su negocio en el año 1995, cuando aun  era un negocio familiar, porque desde muy joven ha sido comerciante,  y en la actualidad ha crecido y    está ubicado en el corazón del barrio  Ciudadela 20 de Julio, muy cerca al estadio metropolitano de Barranquilla, escenario futbolero donde juega el equipo Junior de Barranquilla,  el que despierta la pasión de los habitantes  de la Costa Norte de Colombia y de todo el que ha venido a visitar a esta ciudad  y la ha disfrutado.
texts.en:
Carmelo de la Cruz H. is 56 years old and lives in the "Ciudadela 20 de Julio" neighborhood with his wife and 4 children aged 22 to 31 years. If you arrive at this neighborhood you will find a kiosk that is well-known among the residents of this area. Soccer fans and followers are the majority of the customers of Carmelo's business. He makes and sells fried foods, soft drinks, and other drinks. He has 2 employees, and he works on a schedule from 4am until 2pm, because "The Kiosk of Carmelo" is a preferred site where people come to enjoy a good breakfast. Some day he hopes to convert the business into a restaurant with a room for events, and this is precisely his personal challenge. Carmelo is applying for his 3rd loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for an amount of 2,000,000 Colombian pesos to buy soft drinks and drinks at wholesale to prepare for the festival days when he often runs out of these products. In addition, he will buy raw materials and supplies such as meat and chicken. Carmelo remembers how he started his business in the year 1995. At that time it was still a family business, since he was a very young merchant. Now the business has grown and it is located in the heart of the Cuidadela 20 de Julio" neighborhood, very close to the metropolitan stadium of Barranquilla, the site where the team "Junior de Barranquilla" plays. This team stirred up a passion for soccer amongst the inhabitants of the northern coast of Colombia, and everyone who comes to visit this city has enjoyed it.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and drinks at wholesale to stock up for the festival days when he often runs out of these products, in addition he will buy raw materials and supplies such as meat and chicken.

loans.name: Santos Juan

texts.es: El Sr. Santos Juan C.
texts.en: Santos Juan C.

loans.use: For home improvements.

loans.name: Nueva Semilla Group

texts.es:
Maria de 40 años es presidenta de la Asociación Comunal Nueva Semilla que a su vez pertenece al Centro Focal Santiago II. Maria tiene dos negocios pequeños, uno de ellos es el bordado de chompas y otro es venta de comida en un kiosko que está ubicado en su domicilio, necesita el préstamo para reactivar éste negocio, ya que cuenta con el apoyo y colaboración de sus 4 hijos, tiene planificado comprar insumos con el préstamo. Maria indica que le gusta Pro Mujer, por las capacitaciones que se imparte, el ahorro que logra al final de ciclo y las visitas al consultorio  que puede realizar ya que le atienden con amabilidad.
Las demás integrantes de esta Asociación cuentan con diferentes negocios de producción, servicio y comercio y todas necesitan el préstamo para fortalecer y mejorar sus negocios.
texts.en:
Maria, age 40, is the president of the Nueva Semilla (New Seed) Communal Bank. She belongs to the Santiago II Community Center. Maria has two small businesses. One of them is embroidering sweaters, and the other is selling food. She sells the food in a kiosk, which is located in her home. She needs the loan to reactivate this business. She has the help and cooperation of her four children. She plans to buy supplies with the loan. Maria indicates that she likes Pro Mujer for the trainings they give, the savings at the end of the cycle, and the visits she can make to the consultant’s office. She agreeably attends. The rest of the members of this Asociación have different businesses including production, service, and commerce. They all need the loan to strengthen and improve their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies

loans.name: Fuente De Paz 1, 2 Group

texts.en:
Tamary is the coordinator of her group, Fuente de Paz 1,2 (Source of peace), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Tamary’s group is located in the rural area surrounding El Seibo, an agricultural area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a S. structure with her husband and her unborn child because she is pregnant.

Tamary is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business in which she sells clothes.

Tamary will use the profits to buy a baby crib and in the future buy her own house. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy more pants, skirts, shirts, underwear, etc., for her business

loans.name: Margarito

texts.es: Margarito G. de 46 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa, la cual se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, así mismo vive junto a sus 6 hijos, cuyas edades oscilan entre los 9 y los 20 años de edad. Margarito posee un cultivo de maíz en el cual se encarga de plantar y cuidar durante todo el tiempo necesario hasta el momento indicado en el cual pueda obtener la cosecha de este, la cual posteriormente se encarga de comercializar con diferentes clientes. Margarito reside junto a su familia en el departamento de Ahuachapán, lugar en el cual también se encuentra su cultivo, ha pesar que el trabajo que él realiza es muy bien remunerado, es un trabajo bastante duro, así mismo necesita de mucho cuido sobretodo en la temporada de lluvia la cual puede afectar en muchas ocasiones las matas de maíz. Margarito solicita un préstamo con el deseo de poder comprar mayor cantidad de maíz para sembrar en mayores cantidades, así mismo poder comprar frijoles, de forma que tenga un producto más que ofrecer, y abono por mayor para el cuido necesario para las plantaciones. Este negocio es de mucha importancia para él, debido a que es la única fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta para sostener a toda su familia. Más de 30 años de experiencia son el mayor respaldo de Margarito, ya que esto le permite contar con la confianza de sus clientes y la agilidad en su trabajo.
texts.en:
46-year old Margarito G. and his wife have six children between the ages of 9 and 20. His wife takes care of the home. Margarito has a piece of land where he grows maize. He plants the crop and takes care of it right up until harvest time. Afterwards he sells the maize to various customers. Margarito and his family live in Ahuachapán department, the same area where he has his fields. Although he gets well paid for his crop, it is very hard work especially during the rainy season when the plants are often affected. Margarito is seeking a loan so that he can buy a larger quantity of maize to plant. He also wants to buy beans so that he has something else to sell, and wholesale fertilizer to provide his fields with the care they need. This venture is very important to him as it is the only means he has of supporting his family. He has more than 30 years of experience in this work so his customers trust him and his product.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy corn and beans to sow

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
Maximiliana es socia del Bancomunal Manantial, tiene 58 años, es madre de 4 hijos, el mayor tiene 34 años y el último 25 años. Maximiliana se dedica a la venta de pescados como son jurel, bonito, lisa y merluza, tambien vende choros, pota, pulpo y cangrejo. Maximiliana se dedica a este oficio desde hace 5 años, la mayor dificultad que tuvo en su negoció es cuando bajan los precios de los pescados o cuando escasea, en estos casos sube el precio y la gente no quiere comprar. Por ello Maximiliana tambien tiene una tienda de regalos que esta implementando con variados productos, el préstamo que esta solicitando lo va ha invertir en la compra de peluches y relojes para su tienda.
Las capacitaciones que recibe de su bancomunal la han hecho una mejor madre y esposa, agradece por los prestamos recibidos porque son de gran ayuda cuando ella necesita. El sueño de Maximiliana es poder construir su casa de material noble para poder vivir comodamente.
texts.en:
Maximiliana, 58, is a member of the Manantial (The Spring) communal bank. She has 4 children. The oldest is 34 and the youngest is 25. Maximiliana sells fish and seafood. She has been in this line of work for 5 years. The biggest obstacle she faces in her business is when fish prices fall or when fish is scarce prices rise and people don’t want to buy. Because of this, Maximiliana also has a gift shop that she is stocking with assorted products. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy stuffed toys and watches for her store. The training she has gotten in her communal bank has made her a better wife and mother. She is grateful for the loans obtained because they are of great help to her when she needs them. Maximiliana’s dream is to be able to build her house out of substantial materials in order to live comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stuffed toys and watches.

loans.name: Zaidy Magdalena

texts.es: Zaidy Magdalena R. C., es una joven de 22 años de edad, la cual se destaca por ser muy trabajadora y emprendedora, quien siempre cuenta con el deseo de mejorar cada día más. Ella reside el pequeño pueblo de Panchimalco, el cual esta ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo, y junto a su pequeño hijo de 1 año y medio de edad. Zaidy posee su propia tienda de productos perecederos como: golosinas, sodas, jugos, leche, pan, granos básicos y otros más, el negocio se encuentra en su casa de habitación, lo cual es de mucho beneficio para ella debido a que le permite cuidar de su pequeño hijo al mismo tiempo que atiende su tienda. A pesar que cuenta con mucha competencia, posee varios clientes los cuales a diario consumen de sus productos, así mismo ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos con las personas del lugar tales como amigos y vecinos, esto le permite obtener algunas ganancias extras las cuales son bienvenidas en su hogar. Zaidy solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para surtir la tienda, comprando productos por mayor, de manera que cuente con todo lo necesario para atender de la mejor manera a sus clientes y así obtener algunos nuevos. Zaidy desea mucho poder aumentar sus ventas y de esta forma vivir mejor junto a su pequeña familia.
texts.en:
Zaidy Magdalena R. C. is a 22-year old young woman who is well known for being hard working and enterprising. Every day she wants to make some improvement. She lives in the small town of Panchimalco in San Salvador department with her husband and one-and-a-half year old son. Zaidy has her own store where she sells perishables such as candy, pop, juice, milk, bread, bulk grains, etc. The store is in her house, a great advantage as she is able to look after her son at the same time as serve her customers. Although she has a lot of competition, she has regular customers who buy things from her on a daily basis. She also sells clothing and cosmetics to her friends and neighbours which provides her with extra income--always welcome in her household. Zaidy is seeking a loan to buy more stock for her store at wholesale prices. In this way she will have everything that her customers need which will in turn attract more customers. She is eager to increase her sales so she and her little family can have a better standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more stock for her store

loans.name: Fuente De Paz 3 Group

texts.en:
Margarita is the coordinator of her group, Fuente de Paz 3 (Source of Peace), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Margarita’s group is located in the rural area surrounding El Seibo, an agricultural area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure with her longterm partner and her three children.

Margarita is excited to be taking her eighth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her small bakery where she make bread, cookies and other baked goods.

Margarita will use the profits to improve her business and, little by little, provide everything her family needs. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy more flour, oil, butter, sugar, etc., for her bakery

loans.name: Santos Victoria

texts.es: Santos Victoria Q. D. R. D. 46 años D. edad, resiD. en Santa Tecla, ubicado en el departamento D. La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como agricultor y junto a tres hijos, uno D. los cuales trabaja como agricultor y los dos menores a estudiar. Santos posee una venta D. productos D. primera necesidad como: papel higiénico,  consomés, pequeños empaques individuales D. shampoo y cremas para el cabello, salsitas y aceite para cocina. El negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal D. San Juan Opico, ubicado también en el departamento D. La Libertad, este negocio es muy primordial para el sustento D. su familia, ya que es el le permite a Santos brindarle toda la ayuda necesaria a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Es por esta razón que ella solicita un préstamo a Integral, ya que desea poder invertir más en su negocio, y D. esta forma comprar productos D. los cuales ya posee en mayores cantidades, así mismo comprar otros productos como café, pasta dental, cepillos D. dientes, detergente y otros más, esto le permitirá a Santos el poder obtener mayores ganancias, así mismo crecer como comerciante. Ella es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora, la cual se dedica D. lleno al bienestar D. su familia por lo que cuenta con el enorme deseo D. salir adelante.
texts.en:
46-year old Santos Victoria Q. D. R., her husband, and their three children live in Santa Tecla which is located in La Libertad department. Her husband is a farmer, along with their eldest son, and the two younger children are students. Santos has a stall selling basic necessities such as toilet paper, soup, small sachets of shampoo, hair lotion, sauces, and cooking oil. The business is located San Juan Opico’s municipal market, also in La Libertad department. It is of great importance for Santos’ family as it provides much needed help to her husband’s efforts to support them all. For this reason Santos is seeking a loan from Kiva partner Integral so that she can invest more money in the business. She wants to buy larger quantities of the products she already sells, as well as new products such as coffee, toothpaste, toothbrushes, washing powder etc. In this way she will earn more income and develop as a businesswoman. Santos is a responsible and hardworking woman, fully committed to the wellbeing of her family and with a great desire to get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more products for her store

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
Faustina es socia del Bancomunal Manantial, tiene 50 años y 4 hijos, el mayor de 34 años, el segundo de 30 años y las 2 ultimas de 17 y 14 años, la última sigue estudiando en la secundaria. 

Fautina se dedica a la venta de repuestos de carros como son: coronas, tren, tren fijos, deslizantes. Desde el 2002 vende en su propia casa, este negocio surgió como idea y necesidad de su esposo que es mecánico y le propuso abrir este negocio.

A Faustina le dificulta el tiempo, tiene mucha clientela y no le abastece el tiempo para poder atender en su negocio, debido a que todos los productos que tiene los manda a traer de diferentes tiendas de Lima.

A Faustina le gusta las capacitaciones que recibe en su bancomunal, por que de esa manera aprendió a tratar mejor a sus clientes y es una mejor persona gracias a las Charlas de orientación familiar.

El préstamo que esta solicitando Faustina lo va ha invertir en la compra de repuestos especificamente trenes fijos. 

El sueño de Faustina es tener su tienda de variados repuestos con todo lo necesario, y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Faustina, 50, is a member of Manantial (The Spring) communal bank. She has four children. The oldest is 34, the second is 30, and the two youngest are 17 and 14. The youngest is still in secondary school. Since 2002, Faustina has sold vehicle replacement parts; she set up the business in her own home. Her husband is a mechanic and his need for parts led to his suggestion that she set up the business. It’s difficult for Faustina to have enough time to do all her work because she has many customers and she has to send for the needed parts to various stores throughout Lima. Faustina enjoys the training sessions she gets at her communal bank because she learned how to provide better customer service and she feels she’s a better person thanks to the family training sessions. Faustina will use the requested funds to buy replacement parts, specifically gear shafts. Faustina’s dream is to have her store stocked with everything necessary and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vehicle replacement parts.

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es: Oscar Armando B. de 53 años de edad,  posee una venta de frutas, así mismo comercializa zapatos para hombres, mujeres y niños, ambos negocios están ubicada en su casa de habitación, en el municipio de Ilopango, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposa quien le ayuda con el negocio y junto a su pequeño hijo de 2 años y medio. Oscar posee un negocio muy estable, en el cual cuenta con muchos clientes, los cuales compran sus frutas así mismo posee clientes los cuales compran zapatos con mucha frecuencia entre los cuales están sus amigos y vecinos. Desde hace 4 años que él se dedica a este negocio, tiempo en el cual ha ido adquiriendo mucha experiencia, es por ello que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con la posibilidad económica de comprar mayor cantidad de fruta que es la que más vende a diario y así mismo comprar zapatos por mayor, en diferentes tallas y estilos, de manera que pueda obtener mayor cantidad de clientes. Oscar es un señor el cual siempre esta pensando en diferentes estrategias para mejorar su negocio, y de esta forma poder brindarle una vida mejor a su familia, la cual es su mayor prioridad en la vida.
texts.en:
Oscar Armando B., age 53, has a business selling fruit. He also sells shoes for men, women, and children. Both businesses are located in his house, which is in the Ilopango municipality, San Salvador department. He lives there with his wife, who helps him with the business, and their two and a half year old son. Oscar has a very stable business with lots of customers who buy his fruit. He also has customers who buy shoes very frequently. Among his customers are his friends and neighbors. He has had this business for four years. In that time he has been gaining much experience. He is requesting a loan to be able to a get a greater quantity of fruit. That is what he sells the most of everyday. He will also buy different sizes and styles of shoes wholesale. That way he will be able to get a greater quantity of customers. Oscar is a man who is always thinking of different strategies to improve his business. That way he will be able to give his family a better life. That is his greatest priority in life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy shoes and fruit to sell

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Maura es socia del Bancomunal Manantial, tiene 40 años es madre de 4 hijos, el primero de 17 años y la ultima 5 años. Maura se dedica a la venta de repuestos de carros ubicado en la Asociación los Mecánicos este negocio lo posee desde hace 7 años, surgió como idea de su esposo ya que el es mecánico. En su negocio Maura vende trenes fijos, caja, coronas, deslizantes luces para carros, faros, etc.
El préstamo que solicita Maura lo va ha invertir en la compra de faros para carros y trenes fijos.
El suño de Maura es poder tener su negocio en su casa propia, por el momento alquila un local a una cuadra de su casa. Agradece a Finca Perú, gracias a las capacitaciones aprendió la cultura del ahorro y a afrontar las dificultades de la vida.
texts.en:
Maura, 40, is a member of the Manantial (The Spring) communal bank. She has four children. The oldest is 17 and the youngest is 5. Maura sells vehicle replacement parts in the Mechanics Association. She has had this business for 7 years. Her husband is a mechanic and the business was his idea. Maura sells a variety of car parts. Maura is asking for funds to buy gear shafts and headlamps. Maura’s dream is to have her store in her own home. Currently she leases a locale a block from her house. She is grateful to Finca Perú because their training program taught her how to save and face life’s challenges.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy headlamps.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es: María Isabel P. O. de 48 años de edad, vive junto a su única hija de 16 años de edad, con quien vive en el municipio de Lourdes Colón. María posee un comedor llamado Karen, el cual esta ubicado en su casa de habitación, en donde ha trabajado durante 14 años, haciendo desayunos y al almuerzos, los cuales en un principio únicamente vendía con sus vecinos, pero que en la actualidad vende incluso con motoristas del transporte público, lo cual le ha permitido incrementar sus ventas y así mismo ser más conocida en el lugar, María lo que necesita es poder incrementar su materia prima para poder atender a más clientes, es por esto que ella solicita un préstamo a Integral, por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de verduras, granos básicos, fruta, jugos, sodas, todo lo necesario para poder atender mejor a sus clientes y así mismo atender a más clientes. Ella desea mucho poder aprovechar al máximo esta situación, debido a que es la única forma en la cual se gana la vida, y la cual le ha permitido poder sostener a su hija durante mucho tiempo, ya que ella es madre soltera, y es la única que vela por el bienestar de su hogar y el de su hija.
texts.en:
María Isabel P. O., age 48, lives with her only daughter who is 16 years old. They live in the Lourdes Colón municipality. María has a diner named Karen, which is located in her house. She has worked there for 14 years making breakfasts and lunches. At first she only sold the meals to her neighbors. But now she sells to public transportation motorists. This has allowed her to increase her sales and become more well-known in her area. María needs to be able to increase her raw materials in order to be able to wait on more customers. That is why she is requesting a loan from Integral. She will use the loan to buy a greater quantity of vegetables, basic grains, fruit, juices, sodas, and everything that is needed to be able to better tend to her customers. She will also be able to take care of more customers. She very much wishes to be able to take advantage to the maximum of this situation. This is because it is the only way that she earns a living. It has allowed her to be able to support her daughter for a long time. She is a single mother, and she is the only one that watches out for her home and her daughter’s well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials to make food

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Christopher

texts.es: Christopher es un joven emprendedor, tiene 23 años, él vive a lado de su padre en su casa propia. Gracias a los cuidados de su padre, desde muy pequeño logró salir adelante y actualmente está dedicado al ámbito militar, pero sus ganas de apoyar a su padre y ser mejor han hecho que él decida trabajar independientemente, desde entonces vende zapatillas por pedido. Cristopher compra su mercadería al por mayor a un precio cómodo y posteriormente las vende por unidad a sus clientes. En un futuro él espera consolidar su negocio haciéndolo más amplia, pero sabe que aún le falta mucho camino por recorrer, mientras tanto seguirá poniéndole todo el empeño necesario para poder hacerlos realidad. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará al por mayor de zapatillas, para poder cumplir con los pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
Christopher, 23, is a young entrepreneur. He lives with his father in their own home. Thanks to his father’s care he got ahead in life from a very young age. He is currently in the military but his desire to help his father and be a better person led him to decide to work independently. Since then, he has sold sandals on order. Christopher buys his merchandise at wholesale at a good price and then resells it at retail to his customers. In the future he’d like to consolidate his business by enlarging it. However, he knows he still has a long road to travel. In the meantime, he will continue to put in whatever effort is needed to make his dreams become reality. This is his first loan with MFP and he pledges to repay in a timely fashion. He will use the requested funds to buy sandals at wholesale in order to fill his pending orders.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sandals at wholesale.

loans.name: José Bacilio

texts.es: José Bacilio A. A. de 60 años de edad, reside en el departamento de La Libertad, lugar en el cual vive junto a su familia la cual esta conformada por su esposa y dos hijos menores de edad, los cuales trabajan y  en ocasiones ayudan a su padre. José es un señor muy trabajador, el cual se dedica de lleno a su trabajo con el deseo de brindarle una vida mejor a su familia, desde hace 30 años que se dedica al trabajo de la agricultura, en lo cual cuenta con una basta experiencia y muchos clientes. Así mismo él posee una venta de ladrillos, en la se encarga de elaborarlos, así mismo hace tejas, las cuales se utilizan para poner en los techos, en este negocio posee 10 años de experiencia, pero debido a que José cuenta con muy buenas referencias por ser una persona muy responsable con sus clientes ha ido creciendo poco a poco. Él solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar cemento por mayor, así mismo comprar todas las herramientas necesarias para la elaboración de dicho trabajo, en el cual quiere entrar de lleno.
texts.en:
José Bacilio A. A., age 60, lives in the La Libertad department. He lives with his family, which is comprised of his wife and two minor children. The children sometimes work and help their father. José is a very hard-working man. He is fully committed to his work in the hope of giving his family a better life. He has been farming for 30 years. He has plenty of experience and a lot of customers. Additionally, he has a business making and selling bricks. He also makes tiles, which are used on roofs. He has ten years of experience in this business. Because José has very good references for being a very responsible person with his customers, his business has been slowly growing. He is requesting a loan to be able to buy cement wholesale. He will also buy all of the tools that are necessary to make bricks and tiles. He wants to fully concentrate on his work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cement and raw material to make bricks and tiles

loans.name: Reyna De La Paz

texts.es: Reyna De La Paz R. H. de 41 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Sonsonate, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo quien se dedica a trabajar y junto a sus dos hijos quienes estudian. Reyna  posee una tortillería, en la cual trabaja desde hace más de 15 años, el cual ha sido un negocio bastante rentable, debido a que la tortilla por ser parte de la dieta básica de los salvadoreños, posee mucha demanda. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y visionaria la cual posee la habilidad de poder elaborar muy buenos platillos típicos, por lo que desea ampliar las ventas de su negocio. Reyna  solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en la venta de pupusas, comprando maíz por mayor para elaborar siempre tortillas y hacer las pupusas, así mismo comprar queso, chicharrón, frijoles, tomates y otros ingredientes más para la elaboración de estas ultimas, así mismo desea poder comprar una cocina más grande llamada plancha, la cual se utiliza especialmente para hacer tortillas y pupusas, de esta manera ella podrá elaborar mayor cantidad de estas y así atender a más clientes. Reyna anhela ver prosperar su negocio y de esta menara contar con una mejor estabilidad económica junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Reyna De La Paz R. H. is 41 years old and lives in the Sonsonate department. She lives with her working spouse and her two children who are studying. Reyna owns a tortilla shop where she has worked for over 15 years. It has been a very profitable business, in high demand, because the tortilla is part of the basic Salvadoran diet. She is a very hard worker and visionary who has the ability to produce very good traditional dishes, which is why she wants to expand her business sales. Reyna is requesting a loan through which she can have the money to invest for selling pupusas (a traditional Salvadoran food). She will buy wholesale corn to make her tortillas and pupusas; Likewise she will buy cheese, pork, beans, tomatoes and other ingredients for the development of the latter. She also wants to buy a bigger stove called “plancha”, which is especially used for making tortillas and pupusas, so she can make a large quantity of these and thus serve more customers. Reyna longs to see her business grow and thus have better economic stability for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Dina Bach, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy the main ingredients to make tortillas and pupusas.

loans.name: El Paraíso Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal El Paraíso inicia su ciclo 23 con 16 socias, las que pertencen al departamento D. Huancavelica y cuya actividad principal es el comercio.

Valentina es parte D. la Junta directiva del Bancomunal en el cargo D. Fiscal, es conviviente y tiene 04 hijos. Valentina empezó a vender D. forma ambulatoria agua D. manzana, linaza y otras hierbas D. la Región, tiempo después pudo conseguir un puesto en el mercado D. su comunidad, donD. comenzó a vender mercería. 

Valentina afirma que desD. que se encuentra en su bancomunal, se ha convertido en una persona mas responsable y su negocio a incrementado sus ventas, ahora gracias a sus préstamos pueD. comprar mercadería en la capital, lo cual le resulta beneficioso. Invertirá este crédito para comprar cintas, botones y lana. Ella quiere seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y seguir ahorrando, para así poder construir su casa.
texts.en:
The El Paraíso (Paradise) communal bank begins its 23rd cycle with 16 members who are residents of Huancavelica department and whose main activity is commerce. Valentina is the communal bank’s governing body’s auditor. She has a significant other and four children. Valentina started out peddling apple water, flax and other regional herbs. Eventually she was able to get a stall in the local market where she started to sell items used for sewing. Valentina states that since she’s been in the communal bank she has become a more responsible person and her business has seen increased sales. Now, thanks to the loans she is able to buy merchandise in the capital which is a benefit. She will use this loan to buy ribbons, buttons and wool. She wants to continue to invest in the business and to continue saving in order to build her house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy buttons, ribbons, wool.

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en:
Valentine is 39 years old and has seven children, three of whom are her own and four are adopted. All her children are in school, apart from the youngest. Her husband is a driver. She says that it’s quite a challenge taking care of all these children and giving them a quality education.

Valentine has a shop which sells different items such as juices, soap, snacks and milk. She has a good clientele because her shop is near to a health clinic and a bus park. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more items such as sugar and rice so that she can have a wider variety of items for sale.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Rusezera

texts.en: Rusezera is 61 years old and married to a businesswoman.  They have 7 children between the ages of 2 and 35 years. They adopted the two youngest. The eldest child is 35 years old and he has his own small business. Rusezera sells fabric and is a tailor.  His clients may decide to only buy fabric from his shop or they buy fabric and and have Rusezera make different kinds of clothes, such as shirts, dresses, etc. Rusezera needs a loan in order to buy more fabric. With the profits from his business he hopes to put electricity in his house.

loans.use: To buy more fabric for making clothes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy vegetables and fruit

loans.name: Elsita Edilta

texts.es:
Elsita de 31 años, vive en el Fortín de Guayaquil, (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución). Su esposo es chofer y tienen dos hijos de 11 y 10 años. Ella era ama de casa pero como no podía ayudar a su esposo económicamente decidió vender víveres en su casa, poco a poco con esfuerzo compro mas víveres y vitrinas. 

Ahora ella tiene una tienda en la parte delantera de su casa, cuando sus hijos llegan de la escuela le ayudan. Ella trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días. Gracias a los ingresos que ha tenido en la tienda ha podido mantener a sus hijos en mejores condiciones económicas por eso ella quiere seguir comprando víveres y con el préstamo comprar arroz, azúcar y enlatados. 

En el futuro quiere mejorar el estudio que tienen sus hijos, y surtir mas su tienda.
texts.en:
Elsita is 31 years old and lives in the Fortín de Guayaquil, (a peri-urban zone in a deteriorating ecosystem). Her husband is a chauffeur and they have two children, ages 10 and 11. She was a homemaker, but could not financially help her husband so she decided to sell food at home. With her efforts she has gradually bought more food and showcases. Now she has a store in the front of their home, and when the children get home from school they help out. She works daily from 6:00 am - 10:00 pm. Thanks to the revenue from the store, she has been able to maintain good economic conditions for her children. Because of this, she wants to continue buying food. With the loan she will buy rice, sugar and canned goods. In the future she wants to improve her children’s studies and restock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Dina Bach, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Salima

texts.en: Salima is a widow who takes care of her mother.  She is 50 years old and has four children who are between the ages of 12-30 years.  Her eldest child graduated from high school, the second born is married, and the other two are in school. Salima has a small shop in the market and a charcoal store. Her shop contains onions, sunflower oils, small dried food, cassava flour, tomatoes and other food stuffs. She is requesting  a loan in order to stock more foodstuffs such as beans and sorghum. She hopes to expand and renovate her house with her profits.

loans.use: Buying more foodstuffs for her store.

loans.name: Peace

texts.en: Peace  is 58 years-old and married with eight children.  Seven of her children are in school and her husband is unemployed. Peace sells clothes and has done this business for the last 10 years.  With the loan she plans to buy more clothes to sell and therefore make more profit. Her dream to save enough and to buy a cow in addition to the business she has.

loans.use: To by clothes to sell..

loans.name: Pelagie

texts.en:
Pelagie is married and has two children who are 17 months and 4 years old. She is 37 years-old and her husband is a policeman. Pelagie has a shop that sells a variety of items including children's clothes, shoes and clothing materials.  She also sells household items such as match boxes, cooking oil, candles, soap and other goods. 

Pelagie has had this business for three years.  She is requesting this loan in order to expand her shop and buy more items to sell, such as sugar.  She also wants to buy another wedding gown to add to the one she has for rent.

loans.use: To buy new items for her shop.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine is married with two children and she is 36 years-old. Her children are five and two years-old and her husband is a soldier. One child is in school while the other is not yet school age. Vestine sells fabrics for men's clothes and tailors.  She has done this business for 20 years. With the loan, she plans to start a shop that also sells othr household items such as sugar, salt, soap, etc. and with the profits she hopes to expand the number of items she sells.

loans.use: To buy more fabric.

loans.name: Felix Bernabe

texts.es: El Sr. Q. A. Felix Bernabe vive en el caserio la joya perteneciente al Distrito de Santiago. Vive con su esposa quien es ama de casa. El Sr. Q. es pensionista, cuenta con casa propia a la cual le esta realizando acabados. Solicita el financiamiento para realizar acabados a su vivienda a fin de poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su esposa. El Sr. Q. agradece el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Felix Bernabe Q. A. lives in the La Joya settlement in Santiago district with his wife who is a housewife. Mr. Q. is retired and owns his house that he’s making improvements on. He is asking for funds to finish the work on the house in order to provide his wife with better quality of life. Mr. Q. is grateful for any help we might be able to provide through this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For home improvements.

loans.name: La Fe 2, 7 Group

texts.en:
Carmen is the coordinator of her group La Fe 2 y 7 (Faith), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the rural area surrounding El Seibo, an agricultural area, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and one son.

Carmen is excited to be taking her 7th loan from Kiva partner Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business, which sells various snack foods, by purchasing sweets and coffee to sell from her stand. She will use the profits to build a bigger and stronger home as her home is small and made of wood (and some of the wood is damaged). She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase candy and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TRES MARIAS”; La socia vive en el distrito de Santiago en la provincia de Cusco departamento del Cusco.

La  socia es la Sra. Luz Marina; ella tiene 35 años de edad y La socia es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos la socia estudio hasta la secundaria completa pero por motivos económicos ella no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional y desde entonces trabajo en todo lo que pudo, ingeniándose para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, ella ahora se dedica a l comercio minorista, esta señora vende yuca en el mercado de Huancaro, en el distrito de Santiago, La socia también vende en la época escolar útiles de escritorio de manera informal, en las ferias escolares que cada año en el mes de febrero se apertura para poder comprar los diferentes útiles escolares. La socia solicita el préstamo para compra productos como yuca y de este modo incrementar su venta en el mercado. 

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The member lives in Santiago district, Cusco province, Cusco department. She’s a member of the “TRES MARIAS” (Three Marys) communal bank. She is Luz Marina, 35. She lives with her significant other and has three children. She completed secondary school but due to lack of financial resources was unable to study a professional career and has worked at a variety of jobs since then managing to support her children. Currently she’s in retail commerce, she sells manioc in Santiago’s Huancaro market. During the school year she also sells school supplies informally at the school supply fairs that open every February. She is asking for funds to buy products like manioc in order to increase sales in the market. She is grateful for and values the loan granted because it permits her business to grow and her quality of life to improve. She pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Yenny Del Pilar

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TRES MARIAS”; La socia vive en el distrito de Santiago en la provincia de Cusco departamento del Cusco.

La  socia es la Sra. Yenny del Pilar; ella tiene 31 años de edad y La socia es conviviente su conyugue es taxista y ella
 y tiene 3 hijos la socia estudio hasta la secundaria completa pero por motivos económicos ella no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional y desde entonces trabajo en todo lo que pudo, ingeniándose para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, ella ahora se dedica a trabajar con su familia en turismo, ella está apoyando a sus parientes que trabajan en turismo, la socia junto a su conyugue realizan trabajos para sus parientes el presta servicio de movilidad y ella recoje a los pasajeros. La socia solicita el préstamo para mejorar su casa. 

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The member lives in Santiago district, Cusco province, Cusco department and is a member of the “TRES MARIAS” (Three Marys) communal bank. The member is Yenny del Pilar, 31. Her significant other is a taxi driver and they have three children. She completed secondary school but the lack of financial resources prevented her from studying a professional career. Since then she has worked at a variety of jobs finding ways to support her children. She currently works with her family in tourism. She helps out her family with their tourism business. She and her husband do jobs for her relatives providing transportation; she picks up the passengers. She is asking for funds for home improvements. She values and is infinitely grateful for the loan granted because it helps her business grow and improve her quality of life. She also pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For home improvements.

loans.name: Evelyn Pamela

texts.es: La Srta. M. V. Evelyn Pamela vive en asociación de vivienda Santa Rosa de Lima en el distrito de parcona . Trabaja como ayudante de venta desde hace 7 meses en una empresa de transporte. Vive en casa de su madre a la cual le esta realizando acabados. Solicita el financiamiento para realizar acabados a su vivienda a fin de poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su madre quien es viuda y hermanas. La  Srta. M. agradece el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Señorita M. V. Evelyn Pamela lives in the Santa Rosa de Lima housing association in the district of Parcona. She has worked as a sales assistant in a shipping company for 7 months. She lives in the home of her mother, which is almost finished. She requests financing to finish the dwelling in order to be able to offer a better quality of life to her mother (who is a widow) and her sisters. Señorita M. is grateful for the support that we can offer through this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to finish her mother's house.

loans.name: Nuevo Renacer 2 Y 6 Group

texts.en:
Renata is the coordinator of her group Nuevo Renacer 2 y 6 (Rebirth), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the urban slums north of Santo Domingo, an area where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure as a single mother of three children.

Renata is excited to be taking her third loan from Kiva partner Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business which is a beauty salon by purchasing five bags of hair products from different companies, a curling iron, plastic chairs, four gallons of shampoo and rinse, combs, rollers, hair dye and hair relaxer. She will use the profits to save towards building a new home as the one that she currently lives in has problems with leaking water.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Cloaldo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “TRES MARIAS”;  El socio vive en el distrito de Santiago en la provincia de Cusco departamento del Cusco.

El socio es ÉL Sr. Cloaldo;   él tiene 65 años de edad, El socio es casado y es natural de la ciudad blanca de Arequipa; El socio tiene 4 hijos, todos los hijos son independientes y el tiene una tienda de abarrotes junto a su esposa en la cúal ellos trabajan desde hace 6 años, El socio disfruta mucho de atender la tienda de abarrotes mientras la esposa cocina y luego juntos atiende mientras se relajan viendo televisión en su negocio. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar productos e implementar su tienda de abarrotes.

El socio valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The associate belongs to the "THREE MARIAS" communal bank. The associate lives in the district of Santiago in the province of Cusco, department of Cusco. The associate is Señor Cloaldo. He is 65 years of age. The associate is married and he is a native of the white city of Arequipa. The associate has 4 children. All the children are independent and he has a convenience store that he runs with the help of his wife. They have run the store for 6 years. The associate enjoys tending the convenience store while his wife cooks, and later they tend the store together while they relax watching the television in their business. The associate requests a loan to buy products for his convenience store. The associate very much appreciates the loan offered since this permits him to grow his business and to improve his quality of life. He promises to comply with the payment schedule stipulated.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his convenience store

loans.name: Mercedes Clementina

texts.es:
Mercedes de 42 años, vive en el Fortín de Guayaquil, (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución). Su esposo es comerciante, ellos tienen cuatro hijos de 24, 18, 7 y 1 años. Ella era ama de casa pero como no podía ayudar a su esposo económicamente decidió vender víveres en su casa de caña, poco a poco con esfuerzo compro mas víveres y vitrinas de madera. 

Ella continua con su pequeña tienda, vende víveres como arroz, azúcar, aceites etc. Trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días. Ella quiere continuar con su tienda para seguir ayudando a su esposo en los gastos. Para continuar con su negocio ella quiere comprar arroz, azucar y leche. 

En el futuro quiere construir su casa de cemento y que sus hijos terminen su profesión.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 42 years old and lives in Fortín de Guayaquil (a peri-urban zone in a deteriorating ecosystem). Her husband is a salesman, and they have four children, aged 24, 18, 7 and 1. Mercedes was previously a housewife, but since she was unable to help her husband economically that way, she decided to sell groceries in her home, which is constructed of sheets of cane. Little by little, with effort, she bought more groceries as well as wooden display shelves. Mercedes is continuing with her small store, selling groceries such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, etc. She works from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day of the week. She wants to keep up her store in order to continue helping her husband with the expenses. To continue with her store, she wants to buy rice, sugar and milk. In the future, Mercedes would like to rebuild the family's house with cement and to see her children learn a profession.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying rice, sugar and milk

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TRES MARIAS”; La socia vive en el distrito de Santiago en la provincia de Cusco departamento del Cusco.

La  socia es la Sra. Verónica; ella tiene 34 años de edad y La socia es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo la socia  estudio Turismo en un instituto superior; ella trabaja en una agencia de viajes desde hace 5 años y está aprendiendo mucho, ella quiere poner su propia agencia de viajes y turismo. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar una ahorrar y comprar con ello una computadora. 

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The associate belongs to the "THREE MARIAS" communal bank. The associate lives in the district of Santiago in the province of Cusco, department of Cusco. The associate is Señora Veronica. She is 34 years of age and lives in a shared home. She has 1 son. The associate is studying tourism in the higher institute. She has worked in a travel agency for 5 years and she is learning a lot. She wants to open her own travel and tourism agency. The associate requests a loan to open an account to buy a computer. The associate very much appreciates the loan offered since this permits her to grow her business and to improve her quality of life. She promises to make the payments according to the specified schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To open an account to buy a computer for her work in tourism

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TRES MARIAS”; La socia vive en el distrito de Santiago en la provincia de Cusco departamento del Cusco.

La  socia es la Sra. Valentina; ella tiene 29 años de edad y La socia es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo, la socia vende en el mercado de San Pedro productos secos y todo lo referente a abarrotes en un stand; La socia aprendió el negocio este de su mamá, el stand que ella tiene ahora en el mercado central es de su madre quién le cedió para que ella pueda así criar y educar a su menor hijo, ella quiere estudiar enfermería asi que ahorrará también para poder tener un capital para sus estudios. La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su negocio con productos. 

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The member lives in Santiago district, Cusco province, Cusco department. She’s a member of the “TRES MARIAS” (Three Marys) communal bank. The member is Valentina, 29. She and her significant other have a son. She sells dry goods and groceries in a stall in the San Pedro market. She learned this business from her mother and the stand she now has in the central market used to be her mother’s but she passed it on to her so that she could raise and educate her son. She would like to study nursing so she will save in order to have capital for her studies. She is asking for funds to stock her business. She values and is infinitely grateful for the loan granted because it permits her business to grow and improves her quality of life. She pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Mujeres Con Suenos Y Metas Group

texts.en:
Lina is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres con Suenos y Metas (Women with Dreams and Goals), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Lina’s group is located in the slums north of Santo Domingo, an area where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure with her longterm partner and three children.

Lina is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a fantasia or fantasy (a small store catering to women) by purchasing women's shoes, twelve blouses, twelve dozen rollers, combs, hair clips, shampoo, and a gallon of nail polish remover to sell.

Lina will use the profits to save towards buying a vehicle to make her life and her business easier.

loans.use: To buy women's items for her fantasia store

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TRES MARIAS”; La socia vive en el distrito de Santiago en la provincia de Cusco departamento del Cusco.

La  socia es la Sra. Dionicia; ella tiene 62 años de edad y La socia es viuda y tiene 6 hijos todos ellos independientes; la socia para mantenerse ocupada trabaja en vendiendo golosinas, ella compra al por mayor de los almacenes diferentes variedades dde golosinas entre galletas, chocolates, dulces y los vende al por menor en la esquina de su casa puso una carreta en la cual ella vende sus golosinas. La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su negocio de golosinas. 

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The member lives in Santiago district, Cusco province, Cusco department and is a member of the “TRES MARIAS” (Three Marys) communal bank. The member is Dionicia, 62. She is a widow and has 6 children all of whom are independent. In order to stay occupied, Dionicia sells sweets. She buys a variety of sweets at wholesale like: cookies, chocolates and candy. She sells them at retail on the corner where she lives from a cart she set up for this purpose. She is asking for funds to stock her business. She values and is infinitely grateful for the loan granted because it allows her business to grow and her quality of life to improve. She pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For stock merchandise.

loans.name: Nuevo Progreso 3 Group

texts.en:
Denia is the coordinator of her group, Nuevo Progreso (New Progress), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Denia’s group is located in the urban slums north of Santo Domingo where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure with her longterm partner and three children.

Denia is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling various goods in her community by purchasing rice pots, pressure cookers, silver chains. bracelets and bed covers to sell.

Denia will use the profits to invest in iron bars for her home, and to save towards purchasing a location for her business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy rice pots, pressure cookers, silver chains, bracelets and bedcovers to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas De Peligro Group

texts.en:
Venor is the coordinator of his group, Mujeres Unidas de Peligro 3 (united dangerous women), and his story is representative of his group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Venor’s group is located in the rural area surrounding El Seibo, an agricultural area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. He makes his home there in a simple structure with his longterm partner and two children.

Venor is excited to be taking his 10th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid his previous loan and grown his business. He plans to use this loan to invest in his business by buying pants, shirts and other type of clothing.

Venor will use the profits to improve his business and have his own house where his family can live quietly and safely. He thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy pants, shirts, skirts, T-shirts, socks, etc.

loans.name: Omar Alipio

texts.es:
Omar de 53 años,  vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil, (lugar urbano, en sus principios fue llamado Orquídeas por la abundancia de esa flor), tiene dos hijos. El trabaja haciendo ladrillos de distintos tipos hace algunos años atrás. 

El hace ladrillos de con lodo (tierra), acerrim y moldes para el tamaño del ladrillo, trabaja con dos ayudantes desde las 06h00am hasta las 15h00pm todos los días. Para iniciar este negocio fue muy duro pero poco a poco con esfuerzo ha podido continuar con éxito. Pero para incrementar mas su producción el quiere comprar con el préstamo aserrín y moldes de madera para los ladrillos.  

En el futuro quiere incrementar su negocio y trabajar haciendo bloques.
texts.en:
Omar is 53 years old and lives in Orquídeas de Guayaquil (an urban area originally named Orquídeas for the abundance of this flower, orchids). He has two children. He has been working for some years making different types of bricks. He makes mud and sawdust bricks and molds for brick sizes. He works from 6:00 a.m. until 3:00 p.m. every day with two helpers. It was very hard to start up this business but little by little, and with his effort, he has been able to continue successfully. He wants to buy sawdust and wooden molds for the bricks with the loan to increase his production more. He wants to expand his business in the future and make cinder blocks.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sawdust, molds

loans.name: La Fe 3,4,5 Group

texts.en:
Rosaura is the coordinator of her group, La Fe (The Faith), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Rosaura’s group is located in the Samana peninsula, a lush, rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure as a single mother with her eight children.

Rosaura is excited to be taking her seventh loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling clothes by purchasing skirts and pants to sell.

Rosaura will use the profits to purchase a computer for her children to learn on as well as construction materials to finish her home. She thanks you all for your support. 

Although the photo shows some of the faces of more than 15 people this is because this loan was disbursed with a group of 20 people; one group, however, was not (completely) visible in the picture and are therefore excluded from the profile.

loans.use: To buy skirts and pants to sell

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Domingo is an individual loan client with Esperanza and his story is representative of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Domingo is located in the rural area surrounding El Seibo, an agricultural area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. He makes his home there in a simple structure with his longterm partner.

Domingo is excited to be taking his first loan with Esperanza, and he is already planning what to do when he finish this one and gets a second one. He plans to use this loan to invest in his business by buying pants, shirts and others type of clothing.

Domingo will use the profits to move and build his house in town. Presently he lives in a batey (village) outside of the city and he is excited to obtain more loans and save to make this wish come true. He thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy pants, shirts, skirts, T-shirts, socks, etc.

loans.name: Paz Y Amor 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Yesenia is the coordinator of her group, Paz y Amor (Peace and Love), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in Samana, a lush, rugged peninsula, where running water (which isn't potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and three children.

Yesenia is excited to be taking out her tenth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to supplement her business selling jewelry by starting a business selling sheets. With this loan she will buy fabric and a sewing machine with which to make sheets. She will use the profits to remodel her home and buy a computer for her children.

loans.use: To buy fabric and a sewing machine

loans.name: Damas De Honor Group

texts.es:
En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer Exaltación, se reúnen cada dos semanas la Asociación Comunal Damas de Honor. Una de las integrantes y presidenta es Reina de 30 años, casada y con 3 hijos. Hace 18 años tiene el negocio de venta de leche y sus derivados, comenzó  ayudando a su mamá y con el pasar del tiempo consolidó su propio negocio, que le permite, cubrir gastos de alimentación, techo y vestimenta de sus hijos. En esta oportunidad necesita el préstamo para comprar mayor mercadería y seguir mejorando su negocio.
Reina es clienta de Pro Mujer hace 10 años aproximadamente e indica que le gusta la capacitación ya que es una orientación, también visita el consultorio llevando a sus hijos pequeños.
Las demás integrantes de ésta Asociación tienen diferentes negocios de producción, servicio y comercio. Todas necesitan el préstamo para mejorar sus negocios.
texts.en:
In one of the Communal Associations of Pro Mujer Exaltación, the Communal Association Damas de Honor meets every two weeks. One of the members is the president Reina who is 30 years old, married and has 3 children. She has had her business selling milk and milk product for 18 years. She began helping her mother and with time formed her own business. This allowed her to cover living expenses for her children such as food, housing and clothing. She needs this loan to purchase more merchandise and continue improving her business. Reina has been a customer of Pro Mujer for about 10 years. She states that she likes the training since it is an orientation and also likes that she can visit the office with her young children. The other members of the Association have different businesses in production, services and trade. They all need the loan to improve their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Nelson Otton

texts.es:
Nelson de 21 años, vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil, (lugar urbano, en sus principios fue llamado Orquídeas por la abundancia de esa flor). Nelson antes trabaja en una empresa pero como lo despidieron decidió invertir su liquidación en maquinas de coser para trabajar en conjunto con su esposa. 

Poco a poco los dos con esfuerzo y dedicación pudieron confeccionar y repartir la ropa a distintos lugares,  trabaja desde muy tempranos con su esposa y ahora le ayudan dos familiares cociendo ropa. Las prendas por $ 1.20, $ 1.50 y los pantalones a $ 1.80. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar una maquina de coser industrial y hilos para hacer mas ropa, en el futuro quiere ampliar su taller.
texts.en:
Nelson is 21 years old and lives in Orquídeas de Guayaquil (an urban area that was originally named Orquídeas for the abundance of these flowers, orchids). Nelson used to work in a company but since they laid him off, he decided to invest his severance pay in buying sewing machines to work together with his wife. Little by little and with effort and dedication, they were both able to sew the clothes and deliver them to different places. He starts work very early with his wife and now two relatives help them sew clothes. They sell the clothes for $1.20, $1.50 and the pants for $1.80. He wants to buy an industrial sewing machine with the loan and thread to make more clothes. He wants to expand his shop in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sewing machine, thread
