loans.name: La Gran Esperanza 2 Group

texts.en:
Evelin is the coordinator of her group, La Gran Esperanza 2 (The big dream), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural area surrounding El Seibo, an agricultural area, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and a child.

Evelin is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza  after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her clothing sales business by buying different types of clothing, personal use products and cosmetics. She will use the profits to get a better life by having her own house and buying a vehicle. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy clothing, perfumes, cosmetics, etc

loans.name: Fe Y Esperanza 1,2 Group

texts.en: Maria is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza and investing in her business to make money for her family. She plans to use this loan to purchase a sewing machine with which she will make clothes. She will use the profits to purchase medicine, clothes and school supplies for her children and save up to purchase a concrete floor for her home because her floor is dirt. She thanks you all for your support. Maria's group is located in Samana – a lush, rugged peninsuL. with a nascent tourism industry where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their child. Maria is the coordinator of her group Fe y Esperanza (Faith and Hope) and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Sartawi Group

texts.es:
En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer Exaltación se reúnen cada dos semanas la Asociación Comunal Sartawi que significa Levantar, ésta Asociación esta integrado por 8 miembros las mismas son alegres dinámicas y carismáticas. Una de las integrantes es Juana de 35 años, casada y con tres hijos. Hace dos años se dedica a la venta de diversos productos, según la temporada. Juana se organiza bien para atender tanto a sus hijos como a su negocio. Con el préstamo tiene planificado adquirir mayor mercadería ya que ella viaja a Perú para adquirir diversos productos  para luego venderlos en diferentes ferias de la ciudad de El Alto.
Juana se siente complacida con la atención en el consultorio.
Sus demás compañeras también necesitan el préstamo para ampliar sus negocios.
texts.en:
At one of the Communal Associations of Pro Mujer Exaltación, the Sartawi Communal Association which means "to lift" meets every two weeks. This Association is made up of 8 members who are happy, dynamic and charismatic. One of the members is Juana who is 35 years old, married and has three children. For the past two years she has worked selling diverse products according to the season. Juana is well organized in order to take care of her children as well as her business. She plans to acquire more merchandise with the loan. She travels to Perú to acquire diverse products to later sell them at different fairs in the city of El Alto. Juana is pleased with the attention at the office. Her fellow workers also need the loan to expand their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase SOAT (mandatory vehicle accident insurance)

loans.name: G.s. Divino Niño No. 10 Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario Divino Niño N. 10 está conformado por Rosa Emelina y Dolores, pues siempre han trabajado juntas y tienen mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación. Rosa Emelina tiene la venta de bolsas plásticas la necesidad de buscar una fuente de ingresos para sufragar los gastos de su familia, pues siempre le ha gustado mejorar su actividad y está pendiente para mejorar su actividad, por lo que siempre ha luchado por mejorar cada día. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima pues también su amiga Dolores que  se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general necesita invertir en nuevos productos.
texts.en:
The Group called Supportive Divine Boy N. 10 is composed of Rosa Emelina and Dolores, since they have always worked together and they have worked with the Foundation for a long time. Rosa Emelina sells plastic sachels. She had the need to seek a source of income to offset the expenses of her family. She has always enjoyed improving her business and is alert for ways to improve it. She has always fought to improve every day. The loan that she requests is for the purchase of supplies. Her friend Dolores sells general merchandise. She needs to invest in new products.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for resale

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Feliciana is an individual loan client with Esperanza, and her story is representative of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. She is located in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and sugar cane industries. The main economic activity occurs in the free trade zone, with a cement factory and other economic activity, but where where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. Feliciana makes her home there in a simple structure with her husband and two children.

Feliciana is excited to be taking her third loan from Esperanza after having repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her fried food stand where she sells empanada, which is made of flour and stuffed with different meats, vegetables, etc. Feliciana will buy rice, flour and other foods for her business and will use the profits to finish building her house and expand her enterprise. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: To buy rice, flour, sugar, and other goods for her business

loans.name: Esperanza De Dios1,2,3 Group

texts.en:
Soneta is the coordinator of her group Esperanza de Dios (God's Wish), and her story is representative of both her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in La Romana, an area where the economy is dominated by sugar cane, and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children.

Soneta is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza and to invest in her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her small food stand by purchasing soups, coffee, and rice as well as laundry detergent. She will use the profits to save toward her dream of owning a small corner store. Soneta thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase soups, coffee, rice and laundry detergent

loans.name: Sonadores Con Proposito 1 Group

texts.en:
Flora is the coordinator of her group, Sonadoras con Proposito (Dreamers by Purpose), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Flora’s group is located in the rural area surrounding El Seibo, an agricultural area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure with her longterm partner and two children.

Flora is excited to be taking her 10th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business where she sells used clothes. She will use the profits to build her own house. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Armando Abel

texts.es: Armando Abel, cuenta con un negocio que es la venta de mariscos, por lo que siempre le ha gustado obtener un medio de ingreso que le sea de ayuda para sufragar los gastos del hogar. Este negocio lo inicio con fondos propios y con este financiamiento surtirá con más productos su negocio, para poder aumentar sus ventas y generar mayores ganancias. El es casado y tiene dos hijos uno de ellos en edad escolar, por lo que siempre está esforzándose por proporcionarles estudios pues quiere que sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Armando Abel relies on a business that is the sale of shellfish, from which he has always enjoyed earning a moderate income that is helpful to offset the household expenses. This business was started with his own funds and with this loan he will purchase more products for his business, to be able to grow his sales and to generate greater profits. He is married and has two children ,one of them of school age. He is always endeavoring to provide for their studies, so they will become successful people.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more shellfish for resale.

loans.name: Aldrin Wilber

texts.es: Wilber, tiene 38 años vive en casa de sus padres, inicio su negocio aproximadamente hace diez años vendiendo su mercaderia en el mercado, para luego establecer su negocio en un puesto alquilado que le permite tener mayores ganancias ya tiene gran acogida por sus clientes por la atencion que les brinda, solicita el credito para la compra de mercaderia y poder ampliar su negocio para llegar a tener una distribuidora de productos naturales.
texts.en:
Wilber is 38 years of age. He lives in the home of his parents. He started his business approximately ten years ago, selling merchandise in the market. then later established his business in a rented position that permits him to have greater profits. He already has a great reception by his clients because of the service that he offers them. He requests the loan for the purchase of merchandise and to be able to expand his business to become a distributor of Natural products.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise and expand his business to include natural products

loans.name: Herlinda

texts.es:
Herlinda pertenece al Banco Comunal Amor Divino y durante el tiempo que es socia aprendió a ahorrar.
Herlinda es casada y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 2 viven con ella y están estudiando, Herlinda vende pescado en el mercado Covadonga, vende pescado fresco y congelado, actividad que realiza los días sábados y domingos, sus productos los compra de los mayoristas, Herlinda los demás días trabaja en una casa de cuidados de menores.
Herlinda necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pescado.
Herlinda sueña con construir el segundo piso de su casa y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Herlinda belongs to the Divine Love Communal Bank and during the time that she has been an associate she has learned to save. Herlinda is married and has 4 children of which 2 live with her and are students. Herlinda sells fish in the Covadonga market. She sells frozen and fresh fish, an activity that she performs on Saturdays and Sundays. She buys her products from wholesalers. Herlinda works on weekdays in a child daycare center. Herlinda needs a loan of 1000 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of fish. Herlinda dreams of building the second story of her house and offering a good education to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Evelia Del Socorro

texts.es: Evelia Del Socorro tiene 49 años, este no es el primer financiamiento que solicita, por lo que su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos. Ella utiliza una chaqueta que la cubra del inmenso sol por lo que tiene que recorrer lugares lejanos y tiene que hacerlo caminando, esto no la detiene para seguir adelante con su negocio. el crédito lo utilizara para la compra de perfumes, cremas, colonias, lápiz labial, polvos y algunos tratamientos.
texts.en:
Evelia Del Socorro is 49 years old. This is not the first loan that she has requested. Her economic activity is the sale of cosmetics. She uses a jacket with a large sunshade, since she has to travel to distant places and has to go on foot. This does not stop her from continuing ahead with her business. The credit will be used to purchase perfumes, creams, colognes, lipstick, powder and some treatments.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Blanca Graciela

texts.es:
Blanca tiene 32 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos vive junto a su familia en el anexo El Cuarenta del distrito de Mórrope, un distrito agrícola que se caracteriza por tener a la mayor parte de su poclación concentrada en áreas rurales que distan mucho una de la otra, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace cinco años a la crianza y venta de animales, ella cría animales menores (aves domésticas) en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, cuando estas ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes de la zona, que suelen adquirir los animales para revenderlos en la ciudad de Chiclayo. 

Los ingresos que percibe de su trabajo son utilizados para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos económicos familiares. Blanca desea adquirir más animales y mejorar su crianza brindándoles una mejor alimentación y realizando mejoras en los corrales con los que ya cuenta, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer entregada a su familia y muy trabajadora, anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Blanca, age 32, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in the El Cuarenta annex in the Mórrope district. It is an agricultural district known for having the greater part of its population concentrated in rural areas, which are a long distance from each other. It belongs to the Lambayeque province, and it is one and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo. For five years she has been raising and selling animals. She raises small animals (poultry) in the pens behind her house. When the birds are fully developed, she sells them to the merchants who always pass through the area to acquire animals to sell in the city of Chiclayo. The income that she gets from her work is used to help her husband with the family’s expenses. Blanca wishes to get more animals and to improve the care she gives them. She will do this by giving them better feed and making improvements to the pens she has. That is why she has requested a loan for 1,500 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa to help her reach her objective. She is a woman who is very hard-working and devoted to her family. She has worked with our institution before, and she has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy animals and improve the feed in order to maintain her business of raising and selling animals

loans.name: Nemesia

texts.es:
Nemesia es casada y tiene 2 hijos que están estudiando, Nemesia viaja a las diferentes ferias D. L. región en donD. venD. ropa variada, sus productos los adquiere en L. ciudad D. Lima y Juliaca, además venD. abarrotes en general en las ferias.
Nemesia en los días que no viaja prepara gelatinas que venD. en su barrio. Su préstamo será invertido en L. compra D. chompas, polos y ropas interiores.
Nemesia es socia del Banco Amor Divino y lo que mas le agrada es el incentivo al ahorro.
Nemesia sueña con comprar un carro para llevar su mercadería a las ferias.
texts.en:
Nemesia is married and has 2 children who are students. Nemesia travels to the different outdoor markets of the region where she sells various clothes. She acquires her products in the city of Lima and Juliaca. She also sells general merchandise in the markets. On the days that she does not travel, Nemesia prepares gelatins that she sells in her neighborhood. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of sweaters, polos and underwear. Nemesia is an associate of the Divine Love Communal Bank and what she enjoys most is the incentive to save. Nemesia dreams of buying a car to carry her merchandise to the markets.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sweaters, polos and underwear for resale.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad es socia del Banco Comunal Amor Divino.
Natividad es viuda y tuvo 8 hijos, actualmente vive soL., Natividad realiza diferentes negocios, tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, y en su puerta venD. caramelos, frutas para lo cual cuenta con un triciclo, su negocio esta ubicado cerca D. un colegio. Además Natividad viaja a las diferentes ferias D. L. región en donD. venD. pescado y ropa.
Natividad solicita un préstamo que será invertido en L. compra D. pescado y ropa.
Su sueño D. Natividad es mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Natividad is a member of the Amor Divino community bank. She is a widow and has 8 children. She lives alone. Natividad operates various businesses. She has a store in her house where she sells general merchandise and candy. She has a pedal cycle that she uses for a fruit vending business. She often sells her merchandise at a local school. On top of all that, Natividad travels out to various market fairs in the region where she sells fish and clothing. Natividad is applying for a loan that she will use to buy fish and clothing. Her greatest hope is that she can one day make improvements to her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Cumbe Centro ( Cuenca ) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Cumbe Centro esta formado por un grupo de socias y socios que viven la parroquia de Cumbe y siempre se encuentran en la lucha para mejorar su situación económica de sus familias, esta parroquia se caracteriza porque su gente se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, mucha de su población joven a emigrado a diferentes lugares del mundo para brindar a sus familias una mejor estabilidad económica.

La Señora Rosa Yangari está realizando un crédito en la fundación por primera vez  gracias a una amiga quien la invitado, se dedica a la venta de juguetes, correas etc., actividad que la realiza hace 3 años trabaja recorriendo la ciudad desde las 8 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m de miércoles a domingo.
Nuestra socia tiene apenas 19 años edad, vive en unión libre y aun no tiene hijos, su esposo se dedica a la venta de medicina natural, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de sus suegros. Su crédito lo va a invertir en la comprar de más  juguetes y así crecer un poco mas en su negocio, su meta es de llegar a tener su casa propia.

La Señora. Marian M. vive en la ciudad de Cuenca es su primer crédito que realiza en la fundación Espoir, tiene 27 años de edad, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos que se encuentran de 12 y 6 años de edad que están estudiando en una escuela de la ciudad, su esposo se dedica a la venta de productos Naturales, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 
Nuestra socia se dedica a la venta de bisutería hace 13 años siendo sus padres quienes le incentivaron a que empiece con este  negocio, vende recorriendo la ciudad, también es estilista hace un año ya que ha estudiado para ello y trabaja en un local de lunes a viernes de 8 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m.  Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cadenas y artesanías; su meta es llegar tener un bazar para ya no tener que salir a recorrer  la ciudad.
texts.en:
The members of the Cumbe Centro community bank live in the parish of Cumbe and work hard to improve the economic situation of their families. The Cumbe parish is a rural area where people work at farming and raising livestock. Many young people from the parish have emigrated to other parts of the world so that they can better help their families. Sra. Rosa Yangari is getting her first loan from the foundation after being introduced to the group by a friend. She has operated a business selling toys and other miscellaneous products for 3 years, working as a street vendor from 8:00am to 6:00pm Wednesdays to Sundays. Rosa is 19 years old. She lives with her partner who sells traditional medicines. They live with Rosa's in-laws because they don't have a house of their own. Rosa will use her loan to buy more toys so that she can grow her business. Her goal is own her own house. Sra. Marian M. lives in the city of Cuenca. This is her first Espoir loan. Marian, 27, is married and the fruit of the marriage is her two children, 12 and 6 years old, both in local schools. Her husband makes a living selling natural medicines. They live in a rented property because they don't have a house of their own. She has operated a business selling costume jewelry for 13 years, a business that her parents encouraged her to start. She works as a street vendor selling her goods in different parts of the city. She has worked as a stylist for a year since studying to learn it and she works in a shop from 8:00am to 6:00 Mondays to Fridays. She will use the loan to buy products for her jewelry business--chains and craft products. Her goal is to set up a shop of her own so that she doesn't have to work as a street vendor.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa María tiene 60 años de edad. Su actividad económica es la venta y destace de cerdo, por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos. Hace más de 30 años que se dedica a este negocio inicia esta actividad pensando en el bienestar de sus hijos, la idea surgió por una amiga ya que ella le dio la sugerencia, de que se dedicara a esto, con el paso del tiempo fue que decide realzar el destace de cerdo, por lo que la elaboración de los nacatamales no era tan fácil, pero con la ayuda de su amiga aprendió la Elaboración de los nacatamales. El destino del crédito es para capital de trabajo para la compra de cerdos y materia prima como masa, e ingredientes entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Rosa Maria, 60, operates a business selling and butchering pigs, a business for which she has received loans in the past. She has operated the business for more than 30 years. She started it with the welfare of her children in mind. A friend who operates a similar business suggested the idea for the business to her. She eventually decided to butcher the pigs, as well, difficult work that she learned to do so that she could make nacatamales (a local dish). Her friend helped her to learn to make the nacatamales. Rosa Maria will use the loan to buy pigs and basic ingredients for making nacatamales.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Luzminia Maria

texts.es: Luzminia Maria tiene 27 años y es madre de 2 hijos que aun dependen de ella y que están estudiando. La ubicación de su negocio es en su humilde vivienda, por lo que ha sido difícil. Su actividad es la compra y venta de muebles que la ha mantenido activa hasta los momentos, todos los días se levanta muy temprano para dedicarse a los quehaceres del hogar y además atender su negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de de madera que es muy importante. Sueña con tener una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Luzminia Maria is 27 years old and is the mother of 2 children who still depend on her and who are studying. The location of her business is in her humble home, and that has been very difficult for her. Her business is the purchase and sale of furniture, and this has supported them until recently. Every day she gets up very early to perform her household duies and work on her business. The loan she requests is for working capital for the purchase of wood, which is very important. She hopes to attain a distributor.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Secours Divin Group

texts.en:
The “Secours Divin” or “Divine Assistance” group is excited about receiving their 3rd loan from Esperanza. The group has a variety of businesses, from the selling of gas for household lamps to the selling of used clothing and sandals. Marilia P. is the general president of the group. She lives in a mountain community which has no running water or electricity.

Marilia sells a variety of products based on the needs of her clients. Her inventory includes sandals, undergarments, sugar, oil, flour, clothes-washing soap, etc. She hopes to so return to Port au Prince to begin purchasing her merchandise in her own country. Since the January 12th earthquake, she has been unable to purchase in Port au Prince and now buys in the Dominican Republic.

In the future Marilia would like to grow her business and begin investing her profits in animals, then in real estate. On behalf of Marilia, Secours Divin group, and Esperanza we thank you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more sandals, undergarments, oil, sugar and salt to sell

loans.name: Jackeline Baltazara

texts.es:
Jackeline tiene 30 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos, vive en el caserío Punto Cuatro, una zona rural que pertenece al distrito agrícola de Mochumí, el lugar pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar desde hace dos años en la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, ella ofrece estos productos a los vecinos de su localidad, actualmente cuenta con un grupo de clientes ya fidelizados que siempre acuden a ella para solicitar los productos que necesitan. Jackeline no se conforma y siempre se encuentra buscando nuevos clientes, ya que mientras mas clientes capte la empresa que le provee de productos suele darle más puntos por los cuales percibe más ganancias.

Adicionalmente ella también se dedica a la preparación de tortas y dulces típicos los cuales ofrece en venta en su domicilio, con estos ingresos ella apoya a su esposo en el sostenimiento de la economía familiar, el trabaja en un taller mecánico.

Jackeline desea adquirir productos de belleza por su cuenta para instalar un pequeño puesto de venta en su vivienda que cuente con stock permanente, esto le permitirá dar una mejor atención a sus clientes ya que podrán contar con productos al alcance de la mano y no tendran que esperar hasta el fin de mes que llegue el pedido para obtenerlos.

Para lograr su objetivo ella se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos le consideran una persona tranquila y bastante responsable.
texts.en:
Jackeline is 30 years old, married and has 3 children. She lives in the country in Punto Cuatro, a rural area that belongs to the Mochumí agricultural district. This is part of the Lambayeque province and is forty minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She has been working for two years selling beauty products from a catalogue. She offers these products to the neighbors in her area. She currently has a group of loyal customers that always go to her to order the products they need. Jackeline is never satisfied and she is always looking for new customers. The company that supplies the products to her usually gives her more points the more customers she attracts so she earns more. She also works preparing typical cakes and sweets which she sells from her home. With her earnings she helps her husband with family expenses. He works in a garage. Jackeline wants to acquire beauty products on her own to set up a small sales stand in her home that is permanently stocked. This would allow her to give her customers better service by having the products on hand and not having to wait until the end of the month to get them when the order arrives. In order to reach her goal she saw that she needed to apply for a loan of 1000 PEN for the first time with Edpyme Alternativa. Her neighbors where she lives consider her quite a calm and responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics to expand catalogue sales business.

loans.name: Carmelina

texts.es: Carmelina tiene 39 años, su actividad es la venta de abarrotería. Inicio desde muy joven pues su Mama se hacía cargo del negocio y debido a crisis económica Ana no pudo asistir a clases, pues su Mama le enseño este negocio que le serviría para un futuro y pudiera mantenerse, pues Carmelina siempre le ha puesto mucho empeño a su actividad, pues le gusta y además compartir con sus clientes. El financiamiento es para la compra de arroz, ingredientes, tortillas entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Carmelina is 39 years old and her business is the sale of groceries. She started very young because her mother was in charge of the business and in debt from the economic crisis. Ana could not go to classes, so her mother taught her the business that would serve her for a future and could support her. Carmelina has always dedicated much persistence to this business because she likes and shares with her clients. The loan is for the purchase of rice, ingredients such as tortillas and other things.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es: La señora Raquel G. B., tiene la edad 33 años , habita en el barrio las Enramadas, en el municipio de Ticuantepe   junto a su esposo el cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar, ya que tiene una hija adolecente de catorce años que estudia y apoya con las actividades domesticas , doña Raquel se dedica al comercio de venta de ropa nueva y usada, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la crisis por la cual enfrenta el país, por que  el producto que comercializa tiene que estar  en promociones constante para poder venderlo, a la vez esto no le permite comprar materiales de construcción de una sola vez. Ella solicita un préstamo para la comprar de cemento, arena, zinc, bloques, materiales que lleven a cabo estas remodelaciones, este crédito apoyara al bienestar social de los miembros de su familia  y la satisfacción maternal de favorecer al desarrollo y bienestar de sus hijos adolecentes que se encuentran en una etapa de sus vidas que demandan independencia y comodidad.
texts.en:
Raquel G. B., 33, lives in the Enramadas neighborhood of the municipality of Ticuantepe with her husband, who helps with the household expenses. They have an adolescent daughter who is 14 years old and studies in school, and also helps out with the domestic activities. Raquel sells new and used clothing. The main difficulty that she faces is the economic crisis facing the country, because the products that she sells have to be on sale constantly for her to be able to sell them. At the same time this does not give her the opportunity to buy construction materials. She requests a loan to buy cement, sand, corrugated metal sheets, cinder blocks, and other materials to renovate her home. This loan will support the well-being of all of the members of her family, and will give her the maternal satisfaction of promoting development and welfare of their teenage children who are at a stage in their lives that require independence and comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, sheets of corrugated metal and cinder blocks to renovate her home.

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TRES MARIAS”; La socia vive en el distrito de Santiago en la provincia de Cusco departamento del Cusco.

La  socia es la Sra. Nelida; ella tiene 36 años de edad y La socia es conviviente y tiene 2 menores hijos la socia se dedica a la lavandería, ella va a lavar ropa a las diferentes casas familiares y lo hace cada dos semanas por casa, la socia desde hace 3 años ofrece sus servicios de lavandera y tienen ya muchas clientes que la conocen y ella se anticipa los días de semana y las busca en sus casa para quedar el día y la hora para ir a lavar la ropa, con este dinero que la socia ahorra puede pagar los estudios de los colegios de sus hijos. Ahora ella quiere un préstamo para comprar algunos electrodomésticos para el hogar, el cual irá pagando mensualmente con su sueldo. La socia solicita el préstamo para mejorar su casa comprando electrodomésticos (licuadora, plancha). 

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Nelida belongs to the communal bank "Tres Marias" (Three Marias). She lives in the Santiago district of the Cusco province in the department of Cusco. Nelida is 36 years old, has a partner and two small children. She does laundry for a living. She goes to wash clothes at different houses, and goes to each house every two weeks. She has offered her laundry service for three years and now has many customers that know her. She arrives early on weekdays and asks at houses to arrange a time to come and do the laundry. With this money, she is able to pay for her children's schooling. Now she wants a loan to buy some appliances for her home, which she will pay with her salary every month. She is asking for this loan to improve her home. Nelida values and infinitely appreciates the loan she is awarded, which lets her grow her business and improve her quality of life, and she promises to follow through with the payment of her installments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Eileen Gessner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: La socia solicita el préstamo para mejorar su casa comprando electrodomésticos (licuadora, plancha).

loans.name: Jessica Yeniz

texts.es:
Jessica es soltera y trabaja en la Parroquia Maria Magdalena donde desempeña como secretaria. Jessica vende ropa variada, zapatos, productos que ofrece a amigos y familiares, sus ventas en mayor proporción son al crédito. Jessica solicita un crédito de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pantalones, polos, chompas.
Jessica sueña con tener un negocio grande y tener una tienda de ropa.
Jessica es socia del Banco Comunal Amor Divino
texts.en:
Jessica is single and works in the Maria Magdalena Parish where she serves as secretary. Jessica sells clothes, shoes, and other products to family and acquaintances. Her sales are greatly are on credit. Jessica requests a loan of 2000 soles which she invested in the purchase of pants, shirts, and sweaters. Jessica hopes to have a large business, a clothing store. She is a member of the Divine Love Community Bank.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of polos, pants and sweaters

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
Yanet es socia del Banco Comunal Amor Divino y lo que mas le agrada son las capacitaciones en temas de familia y salud.
Yanet es conviviente y tiene 1 hija de 1 año, Yanet tiene un kiosco dentro de un Instituto en donde brinda servicios de fotocopiado, tiene 2 locutorios que es atendido por una empleada, además vende útiles de escritorio, en algunas oportunidades cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de papeles.
Los sueños de Yanet son tener una tienda de venta de fotocopiadoras.
texts.en:
Yanet is a member of the communal bank “Amor Divino.” She really enjoys training in the areas of family and health. Yanet is married with a one year old daughter. Yanet has a kiosk inside a college where she provides photocopying services and sells stationary. She has two booths attended by an employee and sometimes her husband helps out. Her loan would be used to purchase paper. Her dream is to have a photocopying store.

Translated from Spanish by Susanna Sabahi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase paper

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda pertenece al Banco Comunal Amor Divino y lo que le agrada son las reuniones amenas que la distraen mucho y los prestamos fáciles.
Hilda es casada y tiene 2 hijos que estudian su sueño es que ellos sean profesionales, docente de profesión y trabaja por las noches, Hilda tiene una pequeña pensión en su casa en donde vende comida solo en el almuerzo, tiene 30 personas pensionadas, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de 1 persona, además Hilda brinda el servicio de preparación de comida para diferentes eventos y compromisos. En el ultimo año compro un terreno en la ciudad de Lima en donde construyo su casa para que sus hijos viajen a estudiar a la capital y su préstamo solicitado será invertido en la compra de puertas y ventanas para la casa.
Hilda tiene la intención de implementar una boutique.
texts.en:
Hilda belongs to the communal bank “Amor Divino” and enjoys the entertaining meetings and the easy loans. Hilda is married with two children in school. Her dream is for them to become professionals. She is a teaching professional and works at night receiving a small salary. She also sells lunch to 30 retired people from her home with help of one other person. She prepares food for various events and meetings. Last year, she bought a plot of land in Lima and constructed a home so her children could go to school in the capital. Her loan request would be used to purchase doors and windows for her home. Hilda plans to open a boutique.

Translated from Spanish by Susanna Sabahi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase doors and windows for her house

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica runs a stall selling women’s shoes and children's toys at the Berryessa Flea Market in San Jose, California. Before opening her own business, Monica spent five years working for a watch salesman at the market and refining her own sales skills. However, she worked long and difficult hours and did not retain control over the profits she made. In 2001, Monica decided it was finally time to become her own boss. Getting started was difficult, she said, especially figuring out things like permits, but she is glad she did. 

Monica’s stall is now open for business Thursday to Sunday every week, and she has one employee who helps her on the busier weekend days. A $3,500 loan from Opportunity Fund will allow her to increase her inventory and consequently boost sales. To help manage the growth, Monica’s husband, Paul, will begin working at the stall with her. Until recently, Paul made a living selling paintings. He explains that the market for artwork has suffered recently. The couple is excited to have the opportunity now to work together at Monica's stall. 

"I already have the satisfaction of working for myself, but I hope my business grows more," said Monica when asked about her goals for the future. She is proud of her success and that it enables her to send money to Mexico to help her parents and to support her sister's education. While she has a few cousins in the United States, the rest of her family lives in the state of Oaxaca in Mexico.

Monica first learned about Opportunity Fund from a brochure that a cousin gave her. Her experience has been very positive and she hopes to get a slightly larger loan in the future. "I am very grateful to Opportunity Fund," says Monica, "because I'm going to keep moving forward with my business."

loans.use: To increase product inventory for her flea market stall

loans.name: Miguel Adan

texts.es: Miguel Adán tiene 51 años, a pesar de su edad tiene muchas energías y empeño en su trabajo como es la venta de recargas. Pues dio inicio hace más de 3 años, por lo que siempre le ha gustado su actividad ya que siempre le ha gustado mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia tiene 3 hijos y les proporciona lo necesario para salir adelante. El financiamiento es para la compra de recargas en cantidades grandes para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Sueña con mantener su negocio activo y establecer otro negocio.
texts.en:
Miguel Adán is 51 years old. Despite his age, he has plenty of energy and is a hard worker. Miguel Adán began working as an electronics salesman (specialising in the sale of top-ups for mobile phones) 3 years ago. He has always enjoyed his job, since it has enabled him to improve the standard of life of his family of three children, and given them the means to succeed. The loan will be used to purchase a greater quantity of supplies for his business, to satisfy customer demand. His dream is to keep his business going and establish another.

Translated from Spanish by Cameron Graham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more supplies for his business

loans.name: Donatilda

texts.es:
Donatilda vive en el Distrito de Socos a 1 hora de la ciudad de Ayacucho y su mayor sueño es comprar una casa en la ciudad de Ayacucho, Donatilda es casada y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales 1 estudia y espera que culmine todos sus estudios.
Donatilda es socia del Banco Comunal Amor Divino y lo que mas le gusta son las reuniones que la distraen y el préstamo fácil que obtiene.
Donatilda viaja a las ferias a donde lleva maíz, molidos y de las ferias compra carne, quesos, trucha, productos que vende en la ciudad de Ayacucho a los restaurantes. En algunas oportunidades viaja a la selva ayacuchana en donde vende cereales, carnes y de la selva compra frutas que vende en su Distrito.
Donatilda necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de carnero y trigo.
texts.en:
Donatilda lives in the district of Socos, 1 hour from the town of Ayacucho. Her greatest dream is to buy a house in Ayacucho. Donatilda is married and has 3 children, one of whom studies at school and hopes to graduate soon. Donatilida is a member of the Amor Divino communal bank. What she likes most about the bank are the meetings, which help cast her mind from other issues, and the fact that loans are readily available. Donatilda travels to local markets and fiestas, where she sells corn and ground cereals. She also buys fresh meat, cheese, trout and other wholesale products, which then sells to restaurants in Ayacucho. Sometimes, she travels to the Ayacucho forest region where she sells cereals and meat, and buys fruit to sell in Socos. Donatilda has requested 900 soles, which she will use to buy fresh meat and wheat.

Translated from Spanish by Cameron Graham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meat and wheat

loans.name: Anatolia

texts.es:
Anatolia es conviviente y tiene 6 hijos que estudian, el mayor tiene 18 años y el menor tiene 3 años, Anatolia vende medicina natural en una tienda alquilada que se encuentra en una calle concurrida, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima de los laboratorios, Anatolia también prepara las medicinas, actividad que realiza desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 12 del mediodía, por las tardes se encarga del cuidado de sus hijos.
Anatolia vive en casa alquilada y en los últimos meses esta construyendo su casa y el préstamo que solicita en este ciclo será para la compra de materiales de construcción.
Los sueños de Anatolia son tener una casa naturista en el centro de la ciudad y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Anatolia lives with her partner and 6 children, all of whom go to school. Her oldest child is 18 years old and her youngest is 3 years old. Anatolia sells natural medicines in a shop she rents on a busy street. She buys her produce from laboratories in Lima. Anatolia also prepares medicines, working from 6 in the morning to 12 noon. In the afternoons, she looks after her children. Anatolia currently lives in a rented house but for the past few months has been building her own house. The loan she has requested will be used to pay for construction materials. Anatolia's dreams are to have a natural therapy shop in the town centre and for her children to secure professional jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Cameron Graham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials for her house

loans.name: Sotero Rocha

texts.es: Sotero Rocha tiene 49 años, hace más de 10 años que tiene el negocio de destace y venta de carne Hace más de 10 años que tiene este negocio, pues siempre le ha gustado luchar y sacar adelante a su hijo que está a cargo. El ofrece sus productos a los transeúntes. Este negocio es su única fuente de ingresos, por lo que trata de mantenerse de la mejor manera posible, ofreciendo un buen trato a sus clientes y dándoles productos de calidad. El desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de modo que sus ventas puedan incrementarse y perciba mayores ganancias. El financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima.
texts.en:
Sotero Rocha is 49-years-old. For more than 10 years he's had a meat butchering and sales business. He's always enjoyed fighting to get ahead for his son, who he raises. He offers his products to passersby. This business is his only source of income, so he maintains it in the best way possible, offering good service to his customers and giving them quality products. He wants to expand his business with the purchase of more products so that his sales will increase and he'll make more income. The loan is for the purchase of primary materials.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Clever Gonzalo

texts.es:
Clever de 38 años, vive en el suburbio de Guayaquil (zona urbana, la mayor parte de los habitantes son comerciantes de un nivel bajo). Tiene dos hijos de 13 y 4 años, el tiene una tienda de víveres en la parte delantera de su casa. 

La hermana cuando se cambio de casa le dejo la tienda para que el la administre, poco a poco con esfuerzo y dedicación pudo amplia su tienda, junto con su esposa y su hijo ha estado trabajando durante años para solventar el hogar. Por eso con el préstamo el espera comprar arroz, enlatados y bebidas para su tienda. 

En el futuro quiere tener una casa propia y tener su negocio bien establecido.
texts.en:
Clever is 38 years old and lives in El Suburbio de Guayaquil, an urban zone where most of the inhabitants are engaged in low-level commerce. He has two children, aged 13 and 4, and his business is a general store in the front part of his home. When his sister moved to another house, she left him the store to run. Little by little, with effort and dedication, he has been able to expand his store. Together with his wife and son, he has been working for years to make his household solvent. Accordingly, with the funds from the loan he plans to buy rice, canned goods and beverages for his store. In the future he would like to have a house of his own and see his business become well-established.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying rice, canned goods and beverages

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.es: Bonifacio tiene 55 años en los que desde joven su negocio que es una pulpería en su vivienda. Para esto es importante señalar que Fundación León 2000 ha sido su mano amiga en varias ocasiones concediéndole créditos para llegar a establece este negocio. Por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos.  Pues siempre piensa en invertir en la compra de materia como es aceite, arroz, frijoles, pan, detergentes, jabón, consomé, y otros productos que necesita tener de venta. Es por eso que el solicita a esta institución un financiamiento.
texts.en:
Bonifacio is 55 years old. From a young age he has worked in the store that he runs from his home. It is important to note that Fundación León 2000, Kiva´s field partner, has provided a helping hand on various occasions, granting him loans that allowed him to get his store established. He has always thought about buying products such as oil, rice, beans, bread, soup, detergent, soap and other items that he needs to sell, which is why he is requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Julio tiene 39 años de edad, él es un hombre muy trabajador, él comparte su vida con su pareja y su pequeño hijo, quien es su razón de salir adelante. Todos ellos viven en su casa propia. Hace más de 6 años se dedica a brindar servicio de trasporte por las diferentes calles de la zona en la que vive. Gracias a su gran esfuerzo pudo adquirir un carro, que hasta el día de hoy es su principal fuente de ingresos. Por otro lado su esposa aporta con los gastos del hogar pues se dedica en la venta de objetos artesanales. Desde entonces juntos trabajan para progresar y sacar adelante a su querido hijo. El Trabajo de Julio se prolonga durante todo el día dándose tiempo solo para almorzar, pues si quiere obtener los ingresos deseados debe trabajar muy duro y sin parar, en tanto su auto del tanto uso que tiene, sufre algunas averías, es por ello que quiere dejarlo óptimo para poder trabajar con total tranquilidad. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que asegura seguirá cumpliendo con sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, quiere refaccionar su auto para así dejarlo en óptimas condiciones.
texts.en:
Julio is 39 years old and a very hard working man. He shares his life with his wife and their young son, his reason to keep going, in their own house. He has offered a taxi service for over six years in the different streets where he lives. Thanks to his efforts he was able to purchase a car, which up until now has been the main source of income. His wife helps with the household expenses by selling artesanal objects, and they have been able to work together to progress and bring up their beloved son. Julio’s work keeps him busy all day long, only allowing him time to stop for lunch, because if wants to earn the income he dreams of he must work very hard without stopping. Because he uses his car so much, it has suffered some breakdowns and Julio would like to improve its condition so he can work with total peace of mind. This is his second loan with MFP and he assures lenders that he will continue to make his repayments. With this loan he hopes to refurbish his car to bring it up to optimal condition.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Supplies and drinks

loans.name: Amparo Del Socorro

texts.es: Amparo del Socorro tiene la edad de 61 años, Su actividad económica es la comercialización de mercadería en general. Hace más de 12 años que se dedica a este negocio. La ubicación del negocio es de manera ambulante, y con el tiempo decidió incrementar su mercadería. El financiamiento que solicita es para  la compra de los productos como pantalones, camisas, faldas, bolsos y cosméticos.
texts.en:
Amparo del Socorro is 61 years old. She has worked for over 12 years selling general merchandise as a street vendor. As time has gone on she has decided to increase her merchandise. The loan that she is applying for will be used to purchase pants, tops, skirts, bags and cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rolando Felix

texts.es:
Rolando de 30 años, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (zona urbana, la mayor parte de los habitantes son comerciantes de un nivel bajo). Tiene un hijo de 5 meses, el vende huevos al por mayor. 

Para garantizar la economía de su familia el tuvo que invertir sus ahorros en huevos, empezó en el 2004 para independizarse, desde ese tiempo se ha dedicado a vender huevos al por mayor cada cubeta la vende a $ 2.45. Para tener mas ingresos en ocasiones vende productos químicos. 

Para poder continuar con su negocio ella quiere comprar huevos, en el futuro quiere tenr una distribuidora de huevos para asegurar el futuro de su familia.
texts.en:
Rolando is 30 years old. He lives in Guasmo de Guayaquil (an urban area, the majority of inhabitants are lower class sales people). He has a 5-month-old son. He sells eggs wholesale. He needed to invest his savings in eggs in order to guarantee his family’s earnings. He began in 2004 to go out on his own. Since then he has worked selling eggs wholesale. He sells each carton for $2.45. He occasionally sells chemical products to earn more. He wants to buy eggs in order to continue with his business. He would like to have an egg distributor in the future to insure his family’s future.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Eggs

loans.name: Maria De La Concepcion

texts.es: María de la Concepción tiene 44 años,  tiene 3 hijos. La actividad económica es una pulpería hace más de 10 años que Doña María se dedica a su negocio Y dio inicio con muy poco capital, y es por medio de los financiamientos que ha podido mejorar su negocio. Por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos. El destino de este es capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos, pollo, carne, queso y gaseosa y así no perdería su clientela.
texts.en:
María de la Concepción is 44 years old and has three children. She has worked in her store for more than 10 years, which she began with very little working capital. This is not the first loan that she has applied for; it was thanks to previous loans that she has been able to improve her business. This loan will be used as working capital to purchase pulses, chicken, meat, cheese and soft drinks so that she does not lose her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.es: Bernarda tiene 45 años, su actividad es la venta de productos platicos. Hace más de 11 años que tiene este negocio, pues sus inicios se han dado porque no tenía un trabajo que le proporcionara los ingresos mensuales. Pues con el paso del tiempo es que ha ido creciendo siempre le ha gustado ser una persona independiente y tener una forma cómo sobrevivir, por lo que disfruta de hablar e interactuar con sus clientes que siempre llegan a comprar a su negocio. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como valdes, bolsas, pajillas, entre otras cosas. Sueña con ampliar su negocio para establecer otro local.
texts.en:
Bernarda is 45 years old and has been selling plastic products for more than 11 years. She started this business because she did not have a job that could provide a monthly income. Her business has grown over time. Bernarda likes being an independent person and having a means of survival. She also enjoy talking and interacting with her customers who always come by her business to shop.

This loan will be used to buy merchandise such as buckets, bags, drinking straws, and other items. She dreams of expanding her business by opening another store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase buckets, bags, drinking straws, and other items

loans.name: Delma Ramona

texts.es: Delma Ramona tiene 24 años, su actividad económica es la venta de ropa y cosméticos. Hace más de 4 años que decidió comenzar con este negocio que fue por cuenta propia pues tenía un dinero que había guardado, pues ha obtenido muy buena clientela por lo que siempre está pendiente de lo que sus clientes le solicitan. El también es un padre responsable pues tiene 1 hijo a su cargo, por lo que él le proporciona lo necesario. El financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como pinturas de labios, pinturas de uñas, polvos, sombras y ropa interior. El sueña con incrementar su capital de trabajo que es lo más importante que el tiene.
texts.en:
Delma Ramona is 24 years old and sells clothing and cosmetics. She started this business more than four years ago using her own money which she had saved. Delma has been able to attract good customers because she is always aware of what they are requesting. She is also a responsible parent with a child under her care, so she provides him everything he needs.

This loan will be used to buy merchandise such as lipsticks, nail polishes, powders, eye shadows, and undergarments. Her dream is to increase her operating capital since it is the most important thing she has.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase lipsticks, nail polishes, powders, eye shadows, and undergarments

loans.name: Jorge Denis

texts.es: Jorge Denis tiene 37 años, su actividad es la venta de combustible y lubricantes. Hace más de 5 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que vende de contado y al crédito, cuenta con muy buenos clientes pues este negocio es el sustento diario de él y su familia, siempre le ha gustado ser un padre responsable y proporcionarle a su hijo los estudios necesarios que sus Padres no le pudieron ofrecer y el no quiere que su hijo pase por eso es por eso que se esfuerza siempre mas. El financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima.
texts.en:
Jorge Denis is 37 years old and sells fuel and lubricants. He has been in this business for more than five years and sells his products for cash or on credit. Jorge has many good customers and his business provides daily support for himself and his family. He always enjoys being a responsible parent and providing his son with the necessary schooling since his parents were not able to do the same for him. Jorge always strives to do more because he does not want his son to lack anything. The loan will be used to buy more inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Trancisto

texts.es: Trancito tiene el negocio de venta de leña. Hace más de 5 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que siempre ha sido una persona muy confiable y humilde. El está pendiente de lo que su familia necesita, el inicio por su familia pues tenía que recorrer distancias muy largas por ofrecer la leña el tiene clientes en las orillas de la ciudad, que esperan a Trancito para que les venda la buena calidad de leña. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima.
texts.en:
Trancito has been selling firewood for more than five years. He has always been a reliable and humble person. Trancito is aware of what his family needs, so he travels great distances so that he can sell firewood to his customers who live on the outskirts of the city. They wait for him because he sells high quality firewood. The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase raw materials.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Bismar Enrique

texts.es: Bismar Enrique tiene 44 años, hace más de 10 años que tiene el negocio de pulpería. Hace más de 10 años que tiene este negocio, pues siempre le ha gustado luchar y sacar adelante a su hijo que está a cargo. El ofrece sus productos a los transeúntes y a los transportistas que circulan cerca de su negocio. Este negocio es su única fuente de ingresos, por lo que trata de mantenerse de la mejor manera posible, ofreciendo un buen trato a sus clientes y dándoles productos de calidad. El desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de modo que sus ventas puedan incrementarse y perciba mayores ganancias. El financiamiento es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, detergentes y pan.
texts.en:
Bismar Enrique is 44 years old and has managed a general store for more than ten years. He has always enjoyed striving to succeed on behalf of his dependent child. Bismar sells his products to passersby and travelers who come to his business. This venture is his only source of income, so he tries to maintain it in the best manner possible by offering good service to his customers and giving them quality products.

Bismar wants to expand his business by purchasing more products so that he can increase his sales and generate more revenue. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy candy, soft drinks, detergents, and bread.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase candy, soft drinks, detergents, and bread

loans.name: Maria Del Transito

texts.es: La señora Maria tiene un negocio que es una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, realiza sus compras de contado en Managua y a camiones repartidores, ella compra la mayoría de sus productos en el mercado ya que los precios son más favorables y le generan más ingresos. Sus ventas las efectúa de contado y al crédito. Esta solicitando un nuevo financiamiento para invertirlo en su negocio y hacerlo más productivo, la señora cuenta con los servicios básicos.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria has a grocery store business located in her home. She purchases her goods in Managua with cash, from delivery trucks, and mostly from markets since the prices there are better and generate more revenue. Her sales are made in cash and with credit. She is applying for a new loan to invest in her business to make it more productive and for basic needs.

Translated from Spanish by Susanna Sabahi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rosa Agentina

texts.es: Rosa Argentina tiene 33 años. Ella tiene 2 hijos a su cargo, su actividad económica es un comedor. El negocio empezó hace 11 años, ya que inicio vendiendo comida en su habitación, pues no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos pues siempre ha sido una persona responsable que paga sus cuotas en tiempo y forma, ella se levanta muy temprano para realizar las comprar de sus productos y también la elaboración de sus deliciosos platillos. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, frutas, vegetales. Ella sueña con convertir su negocio en un restaurante.
texts.en:
Rosa Argentina is 33 years old. She has two children in her care. Eleven years ago, she started selling food out of her dining room. She gets up very early to go food shopping and to cook her delicious food. This is not the first time she had received a loan, but she has always been a responsible person who pays her installments in full and on time. This loan is for working capital for the purchase of rice, beans, sugar, oil, fruits, and vegetables. She dreams of converting her business into a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Eileen Gessner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital for food purchase

loans.name: Arvin Ramon

texts.es: Arvin Ramón tiene 21 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de comida. Hace más de 6 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que siempre le ha gustado su medio de vida, el tiene muy buenos clientes que ha adquirido con el paso del tiempo pues siempre se ha dedicado a ser una persona muy independiente y trabajadora pues poco a poco es que su negocio ha ido creciendo. El financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como granos básicos, bolsas, platos y cubiertos plásticos.
texts.en:
Arvin Ramón is 21 years old and his business sells food. He has had this business for more than six years, therefore he has always liked his way of life. He has very good customers, who he has acquired as time went on. He has always been a very independent and hardworking person, so his business has been slowly growing. The loan is for the purchase of raw materials like basic grains, bags, plates, and plastic silverware.

Translated from Spanish by Eileen Gessner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Eddy Enrrique

texts.es: Eddy Enrique tiene 41 años. El negocio que tiene  es la venta y elaboración de materiales de construcción. Eddy obtuvo este negocio por su Papa, ya que anteriormente era él quien se hacía cargo y debido a su edad no pudo continuar y el enseño a Eddy a manejado la actividad, pues no es la primera vez que solicita un financiamiento para que su negocio salga adelante. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra de cemento, arena, palas, piedrín, cerámica y otras herramientas. Le gustaría establecer su negocio en otro lugar para obtener nuevos clientes.
texts.en:
Eddy Enrique is 41 years old. He makes and sells construction materials. Eddy acquired this business from his father. Previously, Eddy’s father took care of the business. However, when he could no longer continue working due to his age, he turned the business over to Eddy and taught him how to manage it. This is not the first time that he has requested a loan in order to advance his business. The purpose of the loan is to purchase cement, sand, shovels, gravel, ceramic tiles, and other tools. He would like to establish his business in another location in order to obtain new customers.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna Gloria is 41 years of age and a resident of Batangan, Hamtic, one of the most historical towns in the province of Antique. Most “Hamticanon’s”, or people of Hamtic, are dependent on farming for their livelihood. Vegetables, rice, fruits, root crops and corn are some of the most common crops they grow to sell for a living.

Myrna and her hired-construction-worker husband are one of the couples who contribute to the number of farmers of the municipality. Both are poor yet hardworking. They are determined to improve their standard of living and give their seven children a better future through the profit they earn from rice farming.

The loan Myrna is requesting right now will be invested in this, hoping that she will increase her harvest and will sell larger volume for more profits.

Myrna also plans that some amount of her loan will be used to finance her desire to grow a hog-fattening business. She has been doing this kind of business previously and this has given her and her family good profits. The hogs she fattens after four months are sold either alive or slaughtered to people in their village or in the market.

Having farming and hog fattening businesses, Myrna believes that it is much easier to improve their standard of living through the profits she would be making. 

Without a loan to support Myrna’s need to finance her farming and hog-fattening businesses, she wouldn’t have an income for her family, especially for supporting the basic needs of her children. Frustration, because her two eldest daughters were not able to graduate from high school and are now working as housemaids, the earnings of which are just too small and insufficient for their own needs, has led her to this kind of worry. As much as possible, she wants all of her children to graduate from college in the future and have a life that is not poor. Now, she has five children who go to school and that she needs to support with a better education.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as rice seedlings, fertilizer, and herbicides plus purchase a piglet

loans.name: Maria Lizeth

texts.es: Maria Lizeth tiene 37 años, su actividad es la venta de repostería y cosméticos. Hace más de 10 años que tiene este negocio pues dio inicio con la ayuda de su Papa que la impulso económicamente pues poco a poco, es que su negocio ha crecido y mejorado. Ella es una joven muy dinámica pues le gusta trabajar y no depender de nadie. Tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. el financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de azúcar, harina, queso, mantequilla, leña y entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Maria Lizeth, age 37, sells pastry and cosmetics. She has had this business for over ten years. She started with her father’s help; he gave her an economic boost. Little by little her business has grown and improved. She is a very dynamic young woman. She likes to work and not be dependent on anyone. She has two minor children under her care. The loan she is requesting is to buy sugar, flour, cheese, butter, firewood and other things.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Haydee

texts.en:
Hayde C. is a widow who lives in Shopping, Fabrica, Sagay City, Negros Occidental.  She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures:  RTW (ready-to-wear) and frozen foods businesses. 

Hayde joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1993 because she wished for something better for her family.  With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Hayde has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 19,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000 - uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 13th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,500 which she intends to use to buy additional frozen foods and stocks for her RTW businesses so that she can continue to save up for expanding them. Hayde C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional Working Capital

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie L. is a 42-year-old married woman who lives in Talisay, Sta. Fe Cebu City. She earns her living by buying and selling of coconuts and also by pig fattening.

Rosemarie’s 45-year-old husband, Victor, is a farmer; the couple has 6 children.  One of their children has a family to raise already while the other 5 are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Rosemarie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by buying and selling coconuts as well as pig fattening. Now she earns an average monthly income of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from her businesses.

Rosemarie is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of 10,000 PHP was used to fund operations of her coconut business, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her 11th cycle loan, in the amount of 11,000 PHP, which she intends to use for both the coconut and pig-fattening businesses. Rosemarie is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Ma. Mildred

texts.en:
Ma. Mildred L. is a 42-year-old single woman who supports her family with a general store and as a rice retailer. She lives in Brgy. Tapon, Dalaguete, Cebu City with her 12-year-old child who is currently going to school.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and rice retailer business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP).

Ma. Mildred is now borrowing 12,000 PHP so that she could use it as additional working capital for her general store. This will be her 4th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 10,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Ma. Mildred aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional capital for general store

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe Q., 45, is a mother who faces a lot of challenges. She was left by her husband with a 13 year-old child to raise and to provide for a better future. She is poor and insecure. But because of the innocent child she brought to life, she regained strength and courage to face the challenge and to continue the battle against poverty as a mother. Hence her vision of graduating her only child from college, for a better future became clear. From that she was able to gain inspiration.

Fe has been working hard each day to earn money to support her child’s needs. However, she realized that it was hard to grow and sustain any income generating activity with no source of capital. 

Despite the fact that ASHI has been operating in the province of Antique for 15 years, the town where Fe lives was only reached this year.  Although there were microfinance organizations offering her a loan before ASHI came, Fe hesitated because of her capacity to repay. 

But with ASHI's services, Fe thought things could work out and that ASHI would be friendly to a poor woman like her.  Just recently she joined and was recognized as a member, which she feels very happy about.  Fe is very excited to receive a loan to start up a rice buying and selling business.  She hopes to grow her income to support her dream for her child.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of rice for resale.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Fifty-year-old Virginia D. supports her family by engaging in selling herbal and beauty products. She lives in Brgy Tapon, Dalaguete, Cebu City, with her common-law husband and their 10 children who are between 6-29 years old.  Three of their children are already working, while the other seven are currently going to school.  One of their children is also raising their own family.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her herbal and beauty product business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP).

Virginia is now borrowing 20,000 PHP to use as additional working capital for her business. This will be her 7th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 19,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Virginia aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
