They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Mrs. Then Yoem Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Then Y. is 38 years old and the village bank president. She was selected by the 20 group members who are located in Samar Khmaer village in Takeo province. Each of the members of this village loan will use for a different purpose. Mrs. Then Y. is a silk weaver and a fruit seller. She is able to earn a small income to support her famiL.. Her husband, Mr. Hakk Sann, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice for a living. In order to increase their income to improve the famiL.'s standard of living, Mrs. Then Y. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets and to build a pigsty for pig breeding. This couple has three children who are students and help in their parent's businesses.

loans.use: To buy piglets and build a pigsty

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Despite of her low educational level (elementary), Liezel R., 28, possess a great amount of drive and passion.  She wants to run a fish selling business.

Her loving fisherman husband has given her emotional security which opens her mind and enhances her strength.  Her three loving children are her inspiration. 

Liezel’s children range in age from 3-5 years old.  As a mother, she is working to give them a better and brighter future.  She also wished to earn money and augment her husband’s income to help support their family. 

Liezel recently joined ASHI and is requesting a loan for her fish business.  She plans to buy supplies to make a raft for fishing that will be managed by her husband. So, aside from buying and selling her fish, she would also sell her husband’s catch.

loans.use: Purchase materials for making a raft for fishing and purchase fish for resale.

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Ludivina R. is a 46-year-old married woman who supports her family by engaging a general store and food vending business. She lives in Prk. Bless Consolacion, Dalaguete, Cebu City with her 50-year-old husband, Raul, and their two children, ages 21 and 23.  Her husband helps run the business.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and food vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP).

Ludivina is now borrowing 10,000 PHP to use as additional working capital. This will be her 4th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Ludivina aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Mrs. Sok Hoeurng Chin Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village loan consists of 14 members located in Samar Khmaer village in the Takeo province. Mrs. Sok Hoeurng C. is 31 years old and is the village bank president, having been selected by its members. The members of this village loan will use it to support different purposes. 

Mrs. Sok Hoeurng C. is a silk weaver at home who is able to earn a small income to support her family. In order to support this business, Mrs. Sok Hoeurng C. decided to ask for a loan to buy more silk. Her husband, Mr. Kol Chil, is an iron welder who is also able to earn a small profit to support his family. This couple has four children, all of whom are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy more silk

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito G. is a 32-year-old married woman who lives in Brgy. Lakawon, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living with her fishing and food vending business.

Charito’s husband, Henry, work as a fisherman, and they have 2 children who are 7 and 11 years old. The children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Charito joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in her fishing and food vending business. Now she earns an average monthly income of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from her business activities.

Charito is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of 19,500 PHP was used to fund operations of her fishing and food vending business, and it had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing her 9th cycle loan, in the amount of 23,000 PHP, which she intends to use on her fishing and food vending business. Charito is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:

loans.use: Additional capital for fishing

Evelyn A. is a 39-year-old married woman who supports her family with her fishing business. She lives in Brgy Lakawon, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental with her husband and their 5 children who are between 9-25 years old.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fishing business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP).

Evelyn is now borrowing 21,000 PHP for her fishing business. This will be her 7th loan cycle from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 18,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Evelyn aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the “Dungganon” way.

loans.name: Mr. Hort Srey Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mr. Hort S. is 63 years old and the village bank president. He was selected by its 12 members who are located in Samar Khmaer village in Takeo province. The members of this village loan will use it to support their family. Mr. Hort S. and his wife, Mrs. Chray Luy, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice for a living. Mr. Hort S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support his farm crop. This couple has three children. They are all students who also help their parent's with the farm. Mrs. Lieng Gnoem and Mrs. Saren Torn are group guarantors so they are also in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita A. is a 52-year-old married woman who lives in Brgy. Lakawon, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental. She makes her living from her general store.

Merlita lives with her husband Armando and their two children who are 10 and 21 years old. The children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Merlita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 in the hopes that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income with her general store. Now she earns an average monthly income of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from her business activities.

Merlita is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of 29,500 PHP was used to fund the operations of her general store, and it had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her 12th cycle loan, in the amount of 29,500 PHP, which she intends to use on her general store. Merlita is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

loans.name: Mrs. Phea Chey Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Phea C. is 31 years old and the village bank president. She was selected by the 13 members located in Paen Meas village in Takeo province. Each member of this village loan will use it for a different purpose. Mrs. Phea C. is a grocery seller in the local village. She is able to earn a small income to support her family. Since this business is going well, Mrs. Phea C. wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to expand her business activities. Her husband, Mr. Pheakdey Ngoun, is a soldier who receives a small salary to support his family. This couple has three children. One of her children attends the local school and the others are too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy more groceries

loans.name: Sarah Jane

texts.en:
Sarah Jane S. is a 36-year-old married woman who supports her family by fishing. She lives in Brgy. Lakawon, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental with her husband Oscar and their three children who range in age from 5-15 years old.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fishing business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP).

Sarah is now borrowing 20,000 PHP for her fishing business. This will be her 10th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 15,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Sarah aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the “Dungganon” way.

loans.name: Melly

texts.en:
Melly F. is a married woman who lives in Prk. 2, Brgy. Inayaun, Cauayan , Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: a carinderia (mini-restaurant) and a general store. 

Her husband Napoleon, who is 62 years old, works as a carpenter to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have six children who range in age from 19 to 38 years old. 

Melly joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1992 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Melly has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of 7,000 PHP, thus bettering the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 17th loan cycle, she is borrowing 15,000 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase fresh meat and vegetable for her fast-food eatery so that she can continue to save up for the future and for her youngest child's schooling. Melly F. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Purchasing fresh meat and vegetables for mini-restaurant

loans.name: Josephena

texts.en: Josephena F. is a 50-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: rice and feeds retailing, and general store. She lives in Purak Genpas, Barangay West, Cauayan, Negros Occidental. Josephena has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her rice and feeds retailing and general store businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average income of P20,000. Josephena is now borrowing PHP 12,000 so that she can purchase an additional stock of rice. This will be her 4th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of P9,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Josephena aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita S. is a widow who lives in Barangay Purisima, Manapla, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a carinderia business (an eatery or mini-restaurant). Nenita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she wished for something better for her family. With the help of her past fifteen loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 15,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 16th loan, Nenita is borrowing PHP 18,000 which she intends to use to purchase fresh meat and vegetables for her fast-food so that she can continue to save for the future to sustain her family’s daily needs. Nenita S. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. loans.name: Mrs. Thorn Nget Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Thorn N. is 42 years old and the village bank president. He was selected by the 15 group members located in Andoung Thma village in Takeo province. Each member of this village loan will use it for a different purpose. Mrs. Thorn N. and her husband, Mr. Thorn Hoa, are farmers who own one hectare of land to cultivate rice for a living. Aside from farming, Mrs. Thorn N. is a pig breeder at home who earns a small income to support her family. In order to increase her income to improve the family's living condition, Mrs. Thorn N. decided to ask for a loan to hire laborers to dig a pond for fish breeding. This couple has four children; two are seamstresses in the garment factory and the other two are students in the local school who also help with their parents businesses. All the members are shown in the photo but some of them are blocked.

loans.use: To hire laborers to dig a pond for fish breeding

loans.name: Togtohjargal

texts.en:
Togtohjargal T. is 39 years old and lives with her husband and four children in the Uvs province of western Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. All of her children attend a local middle school while her husband helps with her shoe-making business. 

Togtohjargal has been making shoes for many years now; initially, she began the shoe-making business in 1990 and since then, she has been gaining a lot of experience. Her shoes are known and valued by her customers for their quality and design. She employs three people and has purchased a new car and built a bigger workplace with her business revenues.

Togtohjargal would eventually like to expand her little shoe-making shop into a factory employing several people. She is requesting a 3,000,000 Mongolian Tugriks loan to purchase materials such as glue, leather, rubber and tools for her shoe-making business.

loans.use: To purchase materials such as glue, leather, rubber and tools

loans.name: Taim's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Taim T. is 36 years old and the leader of a group loan. She was selected by the four members, who are located in Samphli village in Takeo province. Mrs. Taim T. and her husband, Mr. Vuthy Penh, are farmers who own 1.2 hectares of land. They cultivate rice and vegetables for a living. In order to support this farm, Mrs. Taim T. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer for her crops. Mrs. Taim T. also sells Khmer cakes in the local market to earn extra income.  This couple has four children, all of whom are students and also support their parents' businesses.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: Lorelyn

texts.en:
Lorelyn E., 25, believes that dreaming is not only meant for wealthy people. Being poor and having limited access to many services that would enhance her standard of living, has not tempered her optimistic view.  With her loving and supportive husband who is a tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar) driver, she is determined to make her dream of improving her family lifestyle, especially for her two children come true. 

Her husband's tricycle is very old and not reliable and this impacts their family income.  Lorelyn would like a loan to finance the repairs needed for the tricycle.  She cannot run a business right now because her children are very young (two years old and seven month old).

With loans through ASHI, Lorelyn hopes to one day purchase many tricycles for a transportation business.  By then she would need drivers to operate the vehicles. She would help many unemployed men in their village as well as their families.

loans.use: Purchase motorcycle spareparts and pay for tricycle repair.

loans.name: Kov

texts.en: Mrs. Kov C. is 39 years old. She lives in Trapeang Khlout village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 1 hectare of land where she cultivates rice.  She also breeds pigs and is able to earn a small income to support her family. Her husband sells ice cream in the local village. In order to improve the pig business, Mrs. Kov C. decided to ask for a loan to buy three piglets and pig food.  This couple has three children, all of whom are students and also support their mother's businesses. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy three piglets and pig food for breeding

loans.name: Mon

texts.en: Mrs. Mon L. is 54 years old and lives in Tuol Kandal village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Touch L., are farmers who own 4.2 hectares of land where they cultivate rice for a living. Mr. Touch L. also has a horse cart to transport goods for income. Mrs. Mon L. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline to support her farming efforts. This couple has four children; one is a soldier, two are students, while the last one is a farmer. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline

loans.name: Noeun

texts.en: Mrs. Noeun S. is 55 years old and lives in Tuol Kandal village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 2.6 hectares of land, where she cultivates rice for a living. Her husband, Mr. Sophat Phann, is a construction worker who earns a small income to support the family. In order to support her farm, Mrs. Noeun S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline. This couple has two children; one is a seamstress in a garment factory while the other is a student at the local school. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline

loans.name: Khorn

texts.en: Mrs. Khorn S. is 36 years old and lives in Boeng Satong village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Ang Ouch, are farmers who own 2.5 hectares of land to cultivate rice. They also make rice wine and earn a small income to support the family. In order to increase her income, Mrs. Khorn S. decided to ask for a loan to buy six piglets and pig food for a new business. This couple has five children, all of whom are students at the local school and also support their parents' businesses. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To by six piglets and pig food

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.en:
Forty-five-year-old Maria Luz O. has no regrets at having six children. Despite being poor, as a mother she makes sure that she brings up her children so that they are responsible for their own selves and other people. She believes that poverty does not hinder them from being raised with good moral character and values. In order to support their basic needs, she and her fisherman husband work hard to earn money. Education is their top priority and their only hope is for a brighter future for their children. Even though she failed with her eldest daughter, she is still hoping to see that her second child, who is now in the second year of college, and the rest of her children, earn a college degree.

To be able to make her dream for her children and family come true, Maria Luz and her husband agreed to join ASHI and requested a loan. Maria really wants to grow and stabilize her present income-generating activity, which is fish selling, to augment her husband’s income. She knows that being a productive wife is very important to improving their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Se

texts.en: Mrs. Se S. is 40 years old and she lives in Trapeang Lean village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Sokha Net, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice for a living. Beside farming, Mrs. Se S. is also a pig breeder at home and is able to earn a small income to support the family. This couple has four children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. Mrs. Se S. decided to ask for a loan to buy pig feed. Her husband is shown in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy pig feed

loans.name: Lav

texts.en: Mrs. Lav P., 53 years old, lives in Prey Khvav village, Takeo province. She is a pig breeder at home and a congee seller at the local market while her husband, Mr. Sim Paen, is a farmer who owns 2-hectares of land to cultivate rice. With these businesses, they are able to earn a small income to support their family. To support her pig business, Mrs. Lav P. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets and pig food for breeding. This couple has six children; four are soldiers and two are students who also help out with their parents' businesses. Mrs. Lav P.'s husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig food
